story:
Short Summary

You're tired.  Hungry for a life you've never known.  Exhausted every possible opportunity for success.  Around each corner is a taste of your dream, but try as you might, you just can't grasp hold.

Where do you go now?

HA\/EN.

The word "haven" often means an escape, a retreat, a safe place.  To us, it is more than that; HA\/EN is rebirth.  It's a fresh outlook, a new demeanor, and a rise-or-die-trying attitude.  It's an opportunity to live life on our terms, and give back to those who would never let us fall.

What We Need & What You Get

After meeting with some of New York's finest studio executives, we've set an approximate budget of $5,500 for recording expenses.  This covers everything from studio time to post-production, mixing, and mastering, and transportation to and from New York City, estimated to be about 160 miles daily.

The rest of our goal is allocated to merchandising expenses, such as artwork, design, and press, advertising expenses (in the form of purchasing new equipment for social media presence), and miscellaneous legal fees.

The Impact

We've taken the low road plenty of times before to know one thing for sure: you definitely get what you pay for.  This time around, there's no cutting corners and no holding back.  However, without your help, we without a doubt cannot afford to make this dream a reality.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest obstacle is honestly fundraising.  We're two highly-motivated individuals who have faced more than our fair share of demons, and still we stand strong with the will to carry on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.  Seriously.  Even the smallest effort makes the biggest difference.  With a little help from you, rock & roll is back, and we're here to stay.

story:
Short Summary

From 9th till 11th October, 2015 YES Foundation (yes-foundation.com) together with Riga Festival (riga-festival.com) organises charity concert in honour of John Lennon’s 75th Birthday Anniversary. The concert takes place at the heart of Riga – Dome Square. Starting from 9th October, 17:00 till the evening of 11th October both young and famous bands will be performing their covers on John Lennon’s and The Beatles 108 songs. Entrance is free to everyone. 
Please join our festival on Facebook – https://www.facebook.com/events/400207110171872/ 

Part of the funds donated during the concerts will be used in order to organise exhibitions of two young artists – Vera Bondare and Olga Smirnova. Depending on the amount of funds raised to support, the list of creative individuals will be expanded.

Dear friends, give peace a chance! We are asking you to support our initiative and take part in the charity concert!

What We Need

  • Stage (9m X 9m X 8m) together with assembly and disassembly
  • Musical equipment together with the work of sound engineer 
  • LED screen (4m X 6m) 
  • Guard for the stage, screen and other equipment at night 
  • Agreements with companies protecting copyrights 

All we need is love and 10 000 EUR to organise the Festival. Please help!

What You Get

1) 5 EUR – Instant Karma!

  • Thank you on Riga Festival Facebook and Instagram pages (fb.com/RigaFestival, @riga.festival)
  • Thank you on YES Foundation Facebook page (fb.com/yesfoundationcom)
  • Thank you on festival's event page (goo.gl/BRBEWp) 
2) 10 EUR – Here, There and Everywhere
  • Thank you on Riga Festival Facebook and Instagram pages (fb.com/RigaFestival, @riga.festival)
  • Thank you on YES Foundation Facebook page (fb.com/yesfoundationcom)
  • Thank you on festival's event page (goo.gl/BRBEWp) 
  • Thank you on riga-festival.com and yes-foundation.com 
3) 25 EUR – Power to the people
  • Thank you on Riga Festival Facebook and Instagram pages (fb.com/RigaFestival, @riga.festival)
  • Thank you on YES Foundation Facebook page (fb.com/yesfoundationcom)
  • Thank you on festival's event page (goo.gl/BRBEWp) 
  • Thank you on riga-festival.com and yes-foundation.com 
  • We will post links to your websites, FB pages, Instagram accounts and a short information about you at our resources (websites, Facebook pages, Instagram accounts) 
4) 50 EUR – Imagine. Peace
  • All the thanks, links and everything mentioned above 
  • Special "Imagine Peace" Festival T-shirt (S, M, L sizes)


5) 150 EUR – Endless light love
  • All the thanks, links and everything mentioned above 
  • Special "Imagine Peace" Festival T-shirt (S, M, L sizes)
  • Your logo or name will be put on a large LED screen (4m X 6m) for 12–15 seconds between groups' performances, for 3 days 
6) 350 EUR – Stand by Me 
  • All the thanks, links and everything mentioned above 
  • Special "Imagine Peace" Festival T-shirt (S, M, L sizes)
  • Your banner with logo or name (1m X 1m) will be put on a stage for 3 days. Everybody will be able to see your name or logo all the time, even at night! Please note that we can put only 6 banners in total. 
7) 500 EUR – Give peace a chance
  • All the thanks, links and everything mentioned above 
  • Your logo or name will be put on a large LED screen (4m X 6m) for 12–15 seconds between groups' performances, for 3 days
  • A pair of handmade Woolings shoes with your design and festival logo! You can choose any colour for the wool felt, back heel, sole and rubber layer around the shoes! Let your imagination create! 

The Impact

Please help us to celebrate John Lennon's 75th Birthday! This great musician was trying to make this world a better place. It's already 35 years that he is not with us, but his songs are still alive and loved around the world. Join us and together we will make our and his dream come true! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please share this campaign to your friends. We appreciate any single share and like. Give peace a chance, it is easy if you try!

story:
Time to open Love's Door!

Love's Door, an album of devotional chants, has been my ongoing labor of love.  I began work on the project in 2007, recording several tracks in John McDowell's studio in upstate New York, including a duet with my friend Krishna Das. Nearly 10 years later I'm committed to bringing this recording to life, with eleven original kirtan tracks and guest musician support including: a second duet with Krishna Das, instrumental contributions by Steve Gorn, Arjun Bruggeman, John McDowell, Terrence Pompey, Jesse Kotansky, and Nina Rao, guest vocals by Devadas Labrecque, Nina Rao and Janaki Kagel and a response choir full of many, many wonderful kirtan friends...but I can't make that final walk through the Door without your support!

Your Help & My Gratitude

The practice of chant and kirtan brings gifts that are way beyond anything that can be raised on Indiegogo, but still, creating a kirtan album that I feel good about offering to you all costs lots of money...more than I have in the bank!  I want very much to bring Love's Door into the world and I simply can't do that without your help to cover the expenses of recording, mixing, mastering, musicians, and of course packaging/presentation and production of the physical CD and the download; your generous support will go to fund all of these. In return, of course, there will be the completed double album! And also, we've put together some pretty cool gifts and incentives, listed to the right.

A Little Bit About Me:

I've been singing in choirs, bands, and as a performing songwriter all through my life, but these days I love most and best to chant the Sanskrit Divine Names and feel lucky and blessed to be able to center my days around this subtle, profound practice.  I regularly lead kirtan in New York City—my childhood hometown—and beyond, and I've had the lucky joy of singing in Krishna Das’ Posse, live and on his recordings, for many years. I've also been featured in response vocals on a number of other chant recordings. Alongside my kirtan schedule, I stay busy teaching  harmonium and with my therapeutic massage practice in the New York metropolitan area.

A CD of my original music, Road Songs, was produced in 2003 by Bonnie Hayes and is available online (and as an incentive!).

Open The Door to Others...

Help get the word out and let your friends, family, and community know about the campaign by clicking on the Twitter, Facebook, and the other sharing tools at the top of this page (next to the "Back It!" button).  You can also contact me at shyamachapin@gmail.com to set up a fundraising kirtan at your local yoga studio or other venue. Thank you so much for your interest and support...now let's get this album made!  Support Love's Door Today!

story:
The Low-Down

Hi. We're Thunderpony, an Austin-based indie-rock quintet. We're going into the studio to record our first full-length album, and we need your help! This is your chance to preorder the record, or contribute a bit more and get some awesome perks, like a custom song written just for you. To get a general idea of what we sound like, check out our demo at www.thunderpony.com. The album is going to sound even better!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording is expensive. We're expecting this to cost at least $5,000. When you include studio time, mixing, and mastering, it adds up. We're hiring a great local engineer/producer to help us realize the full potential of our songs, which, by the way, we're pretty proud of. We're well-rehearsed and ready to go -- all we need is you!

$10 or more gets you a digital copy of the record when it comes out. Any amount over $10 will also get you a digital copy of the record, plus other perks. Check out the perks section for more info.

Vinyl, anyone?

We love vinyl records, and we'd love to press some vinyl for this album. However, we're not sure if there will be enough people interested in that to make it a worthwhile endeavor. If you're interested in vinyl, please write to us at indiegogo@thunderpony.com and let us know how much you contributed and that you'd be interested in vinyl if and when it becomes available.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, or you think you might know someone else who would dig our sound, please, please, please, pass this along to them. Even if they don't end up contributing, we'd really appreciate you getting the word out.

Thanks so much! We'll see you on the other side!

story:
Who I am:

My name is Jesse Gale and I am a singer/songwriter from the San Francisco Bay Area. My solo project Youngest of Elders is planning on recording two brand new original songs and getting them pressed on vinyl, which has always been a dream of mine, and I need your help.

I've been playing music both solo and with bands for a long time now, and paying for any recording or merchandise out of pocket is always a financial and mental pain. With all of the success crowdfunding has been recently, I thought I'd try it out and hope fellow musicians, friends, family, and fans both new and old could help out.

What I want to do:

I want to raise enough money with my campaign to produce a radio and vinyl-ready two song release.

The total estimated cost of the release is $3000, which covers the writing, producing, recording, mixing, mastering, and vinyl costs. I’ll be working with The Canvas Group, a San Francisco Bay Area-based production team, for the duration of the project, who I've worked with previously for my last release, "ASL". All funds raised for the campaign, whether it be more or less than my goal, will go to making my dream of being on vinyl a wonderful reality.

story:
Freaks Like Me 

Like any band trying to tour the US these days money is hard to generate and FLM has the added challenge of it's members living on opposite sides of the Atlantic.  Hailing from Dublin Boston and London, they've forged a new edge on a grungy style and are in a good position to take it up a notch.
Out in support of their Pavement Ent release, FLM is on tour this Jan/Feb in the US with Flaw in the southeast. The tour will be near 7000 miles total and even with fuel prices low as they are now, it's still the biggest cost and the band is looking to diffuse the cost with the fundraiser. The album 'Philosophies For Modern Ant' has been getting great reviews and airplay and getting out there and staying out is priority one.  
Donations starting at $5 will receive exclusive FLM merch with donations over $100 getting a bundle-pack including concert passes!  Even if we miss the mark on the amount we still will need all the support we can get. 
www.facebook.com/freakslikememusic  

Thanks 
Even if you can't contribute please share!

story:
Project Summary

Danielle French Presents: Miss Scarlett & the Madmen ~ Dark Love Songs

I am a nomadic singer/songwriter based out of Calgary, Alberta. Having toured extensively throughout North America over many years, there are several places that I call "home" in my heart. Sturgeon Bay, a small city in Door County, Wisconsin is one of those places. Allow me to explain...

For almost 20 years I had been minding my own business- writing, recording and performing my own music as a self-contained solo singer/songwriter. When one fateful day in February 2012 the trajectory of my career was magically altered. A chance email led to a generous invitation by Holiday Music Motel creative director pAt mAcdonald, asking if I would like take part in a week-long songwriting intensive. I was told that there would be 40+ songwriters participating from all over the United States. Songwriters would be paired through a random "spin-the-bottle" process and the new creations would be recorded in the on-site recording studio throughout the week, to be released on a compilation CD the following year. 

With both excitement and trepidation (as I had very little co-writing experience), I accepted. Little did I know that the songwriters, engineers and supporters in this quaint Wisconsin community would quickly become like family to me and I would migrate back to Sturgeon Bay three times a year over several years to continue writing, recording and performing with this amazing group of creative co-conspirators. And little did I know that several years down the road I would one day reflect on the songs I had co-written and a group of songs would emerge as a collection of material that wanted to be released to the world! And that YOU would be along for the ride as a Contributor, helping to give birth to this new collaborative recording project: Miss Scarlett & the Madmen ~ Dark Love Songs! Due for release in the spring of 2016.

Where Your Contributions Go & What You Get

     

At this time, all the material has been recorded and mixed. Seven of the nine songs on this project were recorded with co-producer Steve Hamilton at the Holiday Music Motel and at his studio Makin' Sausage Music in Milwaukee and they feature a band of my co-collaborator musician family (the Madmen!). One song, Splinters, is a pAt mAcdonald song that I chose to cover on a recent tribute album to our fearless leader (http://holidaymusicmotel.com/tribute). 


And there was one additional non-co-written song that felt like it belonged on this project thematically. Recording it was a dream come true... during a pilgrimage to London, England to see Kate Bush perform live for the first time in 35 years, my travel partner and musical collaborator from Reno, Tom Gordon, arranged for us to visit Peter Gabriel's Real World Studio in Bath to record my song, Black Sunday.

Contributions to this project will provide mastering, design, pressing and initial promotion funding which will be allocated in stages, so should I not reach my entire fundraising goal, all funds will be used towards one or more stage in the release process including: 
- Mastering
- Mechanical Royalties
- CD Cover Layout & Design (I have some very unique packaging ideas up my sleeve!)
- Manufacturing- Pressing 1000 physical CD's
- Marketing- Hiring a Professional Radio Tracker/ Publicist to promote the release

PERKS, PERKS PERKS!
Although the official CD release is not until spring 2016, as my Christmas gift to contributors of $100 and up, you will receive a full album digital download on Christmas Eve (with all other perks to follow upon release)! 

CONTRIBUTOR PERKS for various levels ranging from $10 to $1000:
- All Contributors will have immediate access to a free download of the first single, Black Sunday (recorded at Real World Studios)
- $10 Contributors receive a digital download of the full album upon release. *You may want to consider upgrading to the $25 level to receive a copy of the physical CD. Each CD will feature a unique handmade element, so no 2 CD's will be completely alike, making the packaging an artwork in and of itself!
- $25 Contributors receive 1 copy of the physical CD upon release, plus 2 additional songs (mp3's) that I co-wrote at the Holiday Music Motel.
- $50 Contributors receive 2 copies of the physical CD upon release, plus 3 additional songs (mp3's) that I co-wrote at the Holiday Music Motel.
- $100 Contributors receive an advance digital download of the full album on Christmas Eve, plus 5 copies of the physical CD upon release, plus my entire back catalogue (4 additional CD's), plus 5 additional songs (mp3's) that I co-wrote at the Holiday Music Motel.
- $400 Contributors receive an advance digital download of the full album on Christmas Eve, plus  10 copies of the physical CD upon release, plus my entire back catalogue (4 additional CD's), plus a copy of Steel Bridge Songs Vol. 8 featuring a variety of artists from the Holiday Music Motel (including 2 songs co-written by me), plus a copy of the tribute album Begging His Graces- The Songs and Sins of pAt mAcdonald CD, plus a set of 5 Art Cards (blank greeting cards that feature my photography)
- One $500 Contributor will receive all the perks of the $400 Contributor, plus a live concert, plus I will send you the actual empty wine bottle we drank at dinner at Peter Gabriel's Real World Studio. It would make a lovely candle holder and memento. NOTE- THIS PERK IS NOW SOLD OUT!!

I have some very creative ideas for the packaging of this CD. Each disc will feature a unique handmade element incorporated with the printed design, so no 2 CD's will be completely alike, making the packaging an artwork in and of itself. I don't want to give away too many secrets, so you will be pleasantly surprised when you receive it, but let's just say it will be full a scentsory experience like nothing I've ever seen before!

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate all the support and encouragement I've received from my friends, family and fanbase over the years. I understand not everyone may be in the position to contribute to this fundraising campaign, but if you are even able to help get the word out through the Indiegogo share tools, that would be great!

Truly, 

Danielle French
aka Miss Scarlett

I was told that there would be 40+ songwriters participating from all over the United States. Songwriters would be paired through a random "spin-the-bottle" process and the new creations would be recorded in the on-site recording studio throughout the week, to be released on a compilation CD the following year. 
With both excitement and trepidation (as I had very little co-writing experience), I accepted. Little did I know that the songwriters, engineers and supporters in this quaint Wisconsin community would quickly become like family to me and I would migrate back to Sturgeon Bay three times a year over several years to continue writing, recording and performing with this amazing group of creative co-conspirators. And little did I know that several years down the road I would one day reflect on the songs I had co-written and a group of songs would emerge as a collection of material that wanted to be released to the world! And that YOU would be along for the ride as a Contributor, helping to give birth to this new collaborative recording project: Miss Scarlett & the Madmen ~ Dark Love Songs! Due for release in the spring of 2016.
  Where Your Contributions Go & What You Get 


     At this time, all the material has been recorded and mixed. Seven of the nine songs on this project were recorded with co-producer Steve Hamilton at the Holiday Music Motel and at his studio Makin' Sausage Music in Milwaukee and they feature a band of my co-collaborator musician family (the Madmen!). One song, Splinters, is a pAt mAcdonald song that I chose to cover on a recent tribute album to our fearless leader (http://holidaymusicmotel.com/tribute). 
And there was one additional non-co-written song that felt like it belonged on this project thematically. Recording it was a dream come true... during a pilgrimage to London, England to see Kate Bush perform live for the first time in 35 years, my travel partner and musical collaborator from Reno, Tom Gordon, arranged for us to visit Peter Gabriel's Real World Studio in Bath to record my song, Black Sunday.Contributions to this project will provide mastering, design, pressing and initial promotion funding which will be allocated in stages, so should I not reach my entire fundraising goal, all funds will be used towards one or more stage in the release process including: - Mastering- Mechanical Royalties- CD Cover Layout & Design (I have some very unique packaging ideas up my sleeve!)- Manufacturing- Pressing 1000 physical CD's- Marketing- Hiring a Professional Radio Tracker/ Publicist to promote the release




PERKS, PERKS PERKS!Although the official CD release is not until spring 2016, as my Christmas gift to contributors of $100 and up, you will receive a full album digital download on Christmas Eve (with all other perks to follow upon release)! 
CONTRIBUTOR PERKS for various levels ranging from $10 to $1000:- All Contributors will have immediate access to a free download of the first single, Black Sunday (recorded at Real World Studios)- $10 Contributors receive a digital download of the full album upon release. *You may want to consider upgrading to the $25 level to receive a copy of the physical CD. Each CD will feature a unique handmade element, so no 2 CD's will be completely alike, making the packaging an artwork in and of itself!- $25 Contributors receive 1 copy of the physical CD upon release, plus 2 additional songs (mp3's) that I co-wrote at the Holiday Music Motel.- $50 Contributors receive 2 copies of the physical CD upon release, plus 3 additional songs (mp3's) that I co-wrote at the Holiday Music Motel.- $100 Contributors receive an advance digital download of the full album on Christmas Eve, plus 5 copies of the physical CD upon release, plus my entire back catalogue (4 additional CD's), plus 5 additional songs (mp3's) that I co-wrote at the Holiday Music Motel.- $400 Contributors receive an advance digital download of the full album on Christmas Eve, plus  10 copies of the physical CD upon release, plus my entire back catalogue (4 additional CD's), plus a copy of Steel Bridge Songs Vol. 8 featuring a variety of artists from the Holiday Music Motel (including 2 songs co-written by me), plus a copy of the tribute album Begging His Graces- The Songs and Sins of pAt mAcdonald CD, plus a set of 5 Art Cards (blank greeting cards that feature my photography)- One $500 Contributor will receive all the perks of the $400 Contributor, plus a live concert, plus I will send you the actual empty wine bottle we drank at dinner at Peter Gabriel's Real World Studio. It would make a lovely candle holder and memento. NOTE- THIS PERK IS NOW SOLD OUT!!I have some very creative ideas for the packaging of this CD. Each disc will feature a unique handmade element incorporated with the printed design, so no 2 CD's will be completely alike, making the packaging an artwork in and of itself. I don't want to give away too many secrets, so you will be pleasantly surprised when you receive it, but let's just say it will be full a scentsory experience like nothing I've ever seen before!
    
Other Ways You Can Help


I appreciate all the support and encouragement I've received from my friends, family and fanbase over the years. I understand not everyone may be in the position to contribute to this fundraising campaign, but if you are even able to help get the word out through the Indiegogo share tools, that would be great!
Truly, 


Danielle Frenchaka Miss Scarlett

story:
IL NOSTRO PROGETTO

Il nostro sogno e quello di allestire la seconda stagione articolata in 15 concerti con l’orchestra al completo e con la collaborazione di musicisti ed artisti che hanno sposato il nostro progetto e sono pronti a sostenerlo esibendosi gratuitamente.  

PERCHE’ SOSTENERCI 

Purtroppo siamo un’orchestra che si autofinanzia, non abbiamo ancora nessun contributo, fino ad ora siamo riusciti a fare tutto grazie al desiderio e alla forza di giovani musicisti che vengono da molteplici zone d’Italia e grazie alla sensibilità di artisti che hanno sposato la nostra causa. Allestire una stagione ha dei grandi costi per un’orchestra così giovane, così numerosa e senza sponsor né pubblici né privati. Abbiamo bisogno di comprare sedie, leggii, rimborsare gli spostamenti dei musicisti, pagare l’affitto del teatro, pagare l’allestimento scenico, affittare la musica che ci piace suonare, pagare i diritti d’autore, pagare il noleggio degli strumenti e molto altro ancora. Fino ad ora ogni singolo acquisto è stato sostenuto con le donazioni e la rinuncia al cachet di ogni singolo musicista. Con il tuo piccolo contributo puoi aiutarci a diffondere la musica e a realizzare un sogno. Vogliamo continuare a fornire contributi unici alla scena musicale Italiana e una piccola donazione a questa raccolta fondi ci permetterà di farlo. Vi ringraziamo in anticipo per il vostro sostegno e ci auguriamo di vedervi ai prossimi concerti dell’Orchestra Filarmonica di Benevento.


RISCHI E SFIDE

Se l’obiettivo fissato non dovesse essere raggiunto sarà quasi impossibile per l’Orchestra progettare una seconda stagione di concerti e sostenere i costi di produzione. La sfida è riuscire a sopravvivere anche dopo la campagna di crowdfounding e riuscire a partecipare ai bandi culturali che lo stato emette per le associazioni no profit come la nostra.


LA NOSTRA STORIA

Siamo 70 giovani musicisti tra i 18 e i 27 anni e siamo i componenti dell’Orchestra Filarmonica di Benevento. La nostra storia inizia nel Marzo 2015 dall’idea di un gruppo di giovani musicisti neolaureati con il desiderio di avere un’orchestra professionale e giovane nella loro città e con la quale girare il mondo! A poco a poco il piccolo gruppo si è avvalso della collaborazione sempre crescente di altri musicisti con gli stessi desideri, gli stessi obiettivi, gli stessi sogni e, ad oggi, l’orchestra consta di oltre 70 professori d’orchestra. Con le nostre sole forze economiche e con una grande passione che ci spinge a credere nella possibilità di rendere stabile la nostra orchestra abbiamo realizzato la nostra prima stagione concertistica che ha registrato sempre il tutto esaurito e ha visto alternarsi sul palco della nostra città, a titolo gratuito, artisti di fama internazionale come il M° Francesco Ivan Ciampa, il M° Valerio Galli, il M° Sir Antonio Pappano, il soprano Jessica Pratt, il ballerino Josè Perez e molti altri.

 “E’ un’orchestra piena di talento, piena di voglia e di grinta. Sono questi i progetti che bisogna portare avanti per far crescere la cultura musicale” 

Sir Antonio Pappano

https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=102&v=B-pXgBjH2lI

 “La linfa vitale di questa orchestra è l’amore per la musica. Ogni sforzo, ogni difficoltà diventa energia sonora. Sono fiero ed orgoglioso di guidare questi giovani artisti” 

M° Francesco Ivan Ciampa 

 “Questi ragazzi sono fantastici, tornerò ogni volta che potrò perché è veramente una gioia poter lavorare con loro. Mi sta rimettendo al mondo. Fantastici. Una grandissima orchestra” 

 M° Valerio Galli

https://youtu.be/9tNsryVZIJQ?t=1m58s

 “Le rivoluzioni camminano sulle gambe degli uomini. In questo caso su una corda, su un polpastrello, su un soffio”  

Melania Petriello, giornalista e scrittrice

 “Orchestra "made in Sud", un miracolo di cultura e bellezza partito dal basso che ha il sapore dell'amicizia e che lega la musica all'idea di un futuro da costruire sull'impegno e sul talento” 

ANSA 

http://www.ansa.it/sito/notizie/cultura/musica/2015/08/08/orchestra-benevento-amicizia-fai-da-te_1de578c7-bc88-4be4-b40a-12bc5c327870.html


OUR PROJECT 

Our dream is to set up a second season of 15 concerts, involving the full orchestra and with the collaboration of all the musicians and artists who have embraced the project, ready to support it by performing for free.

SUPPORT US 

We are a self-financing orchestra, we have no funding yet, so far we have managed to achive our goals thanks to the passion and the strength of young musicians from many areas of Italy and with awareness of artists who embraced our cause. There are so many costs to setting up an orchestra season so big, so young and without funding. We need to buy chairs, lecterns, repay our trips and theater, staging, music and instrument’s rent, pay royalties and so more. Until now each purchase was supported by donations and the sacrifice of each musician. You can help us spread the music with your small contribution. We would like to work together providing uncommon italian music. Your little public funding would be very appreciated, allowing us to go on with our dream. We thank you in advance for your support and we hope to see you at the next Philharmonic Orchestra of Benevento’s concert.

OUR CHALLENGE

Our challenge is surviving after the crowdfunding campaign and gain the possibility to organize a second concert theater orchestra season. Our (and yours) effort is focalized to reach the goal to realize such dream and take part in many cultural tender notice for non-profit organizations.


OUR HISTORY

 We are 70 young musicians aged between 18 and 27, members of the Philharmonic Orchestra of Benevento. It all begins in March 2015 with a young graduates musicians group wishful to found a youth and professional orchestra in their city and to travel the world! Step by step, the small group has taken advantage of the increasing collaboration of other musicians tied by same goals and dreams. So, to date, the orchestra is arrenged by over 70 members. We were confident of our strenght and passion, achiving our first concert season with our own economic effort, gaining the possibility to call such important and international artists as Maestro Francesco Ivan Ciampa, Maestro Valerio Galli, Maestro Sir Antonio Pappano, soprano Jessica Pratt, the dancer Josè Perez and many others. All the concerts were sold out.

 "It is an orchestra full of talent, full of desire and determination. These are the projects that you have to carry on to grow the music culture"  

Sir Antonio Pappano

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=102&v=B-pXgBjH2lI

"The lifeblood of this Orchestra is the music love. Every effort, every difficulty becomes sound energy. I'm proud to guide these young artists." 

M° Francesco Ivan Ciampa 

 "These guys are great, I will come back whenever I can because it's really a joy to work with them. It’s a fantastic and great orchestra". 

 M° Valerio Galli

 "The revolutions walk on men legs. In this case on a rope, on a fingertip, on a breath"

Melania Petriello, giornalist and writer 

“A made in South Orchestra, a miracle of culture and beauty linked together by a strong friendship and by the desire to build a future based on talent and responsability”.

ANSA

http://www.ansa.it/sito/notizie/cultura/musica/2015/08/08/orchestra-benevento-amicizia-fai-da-te_1de578c7-bc88-4be4-b40a-12bc5c327870.html

story:
Overview

Hi! I'm Steven Budden (aka Saint Milkweed). For the past ten years, I've been tenderly crafting acoustic ballads for a handful of devoted fans. 
I live in a cabin up in the redwoods in Northern California  (I'll tell you how I got here in minute). 

This spring, I'm summoning all my courage and emerging from my cabin-retreat to bring my songs out into the world FOR THE FIRST TIME!

This is a HUGE leap for me... let me tell you why... 

"When you sing, I feel like I get a doorway into your heart and into the heart and soul of the world." - Handwritten note from a beloved fan. 


Birth of 'Saint Milkweed' 

In 2008, I recorded my first album, 'Saint Milkweed' at Tiny Telephone Studios, on a shoestring budget, plunging myself into debt. It was fairly simple: just me, the guitar, and the harmonica. 

A few songs seem to be have an underground following on Pandora (Go to Hell, Caroline- I'm About to Fall, Couldn't Hold Onto You, for instance).  Royalties trickle in... enough to feed a moderately sized chicken or perhaps a large quail. 

I've received glowing letters from a few die-hard fans about how the album 'haunts them' and they have it on endless repeat. 

"I love that album, and hope you make more. I could listen to it on a loop for hours. It's seriously one of my ten or so favorites. It's just so spare and beautiful, and makes me ache." Facebook message from a fan

"One could argue that taste in music is subjective but I truly believe that, in a music industry overshadowed by consumerism, Steve Budden is one of our truly great songwriters" - P. Parise

There are no Accidents

In 2009, as I was giddily planning a tour in the wake of that album,  I BROKE my NECK in the Pacific Ocean in a bodyboarding accident, and my life veered off in a whole new direction.   

The 'accident' brought out the healer in me. I became a somatic healer and a consultant on embodiment and healing, founding Flow Healing Arts in 2011. 

I also continued to write. An underground novel... 'The Flop Eared Gospels'. A healing manual: 'Flow: An Illuminated Training Manual.' Various articles, poetry, and music. 

Out of the Forest and Into the Fire


In 2014, I moved into a cabin in the forest with a partner. She was my main inspiration and my main audience. 
When she moved out, heart-wrenched, I retreated into the cabin to heal and write.
Fate swept in. My cabin neighbor offered his recording set up at this critical hour (thank you D!) and I poured out recent songs onto a new album: Sweet Redemption. Bitter-sweet, much of it is about her. 

New Inspirations

Recently, at an intimate group event  (an Emerging and Evolving Economies JAM put on by an organization called YES!)... we were asked to  speak our deepest desire. 

"I want to start playing my music live and bring my songs out into the world. I want to live in a world where we are each celebrated for sharing our most precious gifts. Where music becomes a mode of connection." 

Tears filled my eyes. Old fears flooded my mind. 

THIS campaign is me living into this ideal. Taking a leap into my higher self. 

I'm inviting you to become an integral part of this unfolding and to share in the evolution of me as a musician and a man. 

This is my humble cabin retreat. 

What I Need 

$20,400 for: 
  1. Saint Milkweed Tour of the Western States for 3 Months (Arizona, California, New Mexico, Colorado, Utah, Washington, Oregon, Montana, Wyoming, Idaho)
  2. Live Recording and CD (Saint Milkweed- In the Rapture) -So people not on the tour path can also experience the magic. 
  3. Printing CD's of my latest release, Sweet Redemption, to bring on tour. 

The Breakdown

1. PROJECTED TOUR EXPENSES (90 DAYS- Spring 2016) - $11,000 
  • Lodging: $4500
  • Food: $2700
  • Transportation Expenses: $2000 
  • Required Gear: (acoustic guitar pickup, used microphone, cables, etc) modest estimate based on what may be needed, as venues differ drastically: $1000
  • Misc. Expenses: $800 
2. 'INTO THE RAPTURE' PROJECTED RECORDING EXPENSES - $8200
Traveling inspires me to create. This album will include my 'greatest hits' as well as new songs I compose on the road. 

  • Recording equipment basics (rental and / or purchase as needed): $3000
  • Engineering support (as needed): $2000 
  • Mastering, editing: $2000 
  • CD manufacture: $1200 
3. 'SWEET REDEMPTION' CD PRINTING -$1200
The Sweet Redemption is already recorded, mixed, and mastered... I just need to print the CDs. 
  • CD Manufacture with jackets (I do my own graphic design work).: $1200 
Please sign up for my newsletter HERE and I'll keep you updated. 

What You Get

The Intangibles:

The heart-warming feeling of knowing you contributed to making a dream come true. 

My eternal gratitude. 
First invitations to the shows. 
Some input to co-create the tour by suggesting towns and venues that excite you. Ie: A chance to bring the music to YOU. 
The Tangibles:

I've also put together some beautiful offerings for you, ranging from digital downloads of unreleased materials to hand-crafted gifts, a private house concert, and a musical hike / journey with me, healing sessions, attire.

'Saint Milkweed' Organic Cotton T, designed by me (men's version). That's the guitar I recorded my first album on. 

What the!? An organic baby bodysuit!? For the sheer hilarity and cuteness factor of it. 

If I am unable to reach my goal for whatever reason,... I will pour more energy into the tour and save the recording pieces for another date, as well as attempt to bring in funds from other sources to support the project. 

The Impact

I am an idealist. I've created the music I love to create without a thought of it's commercial appeal. I record it bare bones, so there is nowhere to hide. This is, I think, the source of it's appeal as well as the reason I'm not more well known yet. 
Creating music underground for 20 years without much exposure to other musicians has been in interesting experience.Through this, my songwriting has evolved into a unique and very personal mode of expression. 
I'll write songs forever. I know that. However, I would LOVE if more people could actually hear these creations I pour so much love into. 
The next step in my journey is to bring my music to the world. To get out of the digital reality and go out and play for people like you in person. 
What this REPRESENTS is the dare to dream. 
I feel doubts arise as I write this. 'Maybe I'm too old or it's too late.' 
Is it ever too late to chase dreams? 
When I play live, I feel the transmission from heart to heart. Sometimes, after a song, I look up and see tears in peoples' eyes and it trills in my soul. 
I want all of us to have more of THAT. So I'm doing what I can to create it. To 'be the change I wish to see in the world.' 
Wherever possible, I'll try to keep the venues small and intimate, to foster that sense of connectedness. 
I truly need your support to move forward and to spread the music of love and redemption. 

Confession

I notice I'm nervous, because without you, I know I could easily regress into my hermit songwriting mode- tenderly crafting passionate songs few hear.  
I'm also excited! Because with your support, I can move forward and deliver music you'll never forget. 
I'm humble during this process. I'm open to learning from other seasoned-touring musicians and from you. 

Surrender

The name Saint Milkweed came to me upon reading a Richard Wilbur poem:
"Anonymous as cherubs
Under the crib of God,
White seeds are floating
Out of my burst pod.
What power had I
Before I learned to yield?
Shatter me, great wind:
I shall possess the field"
This campaign represents is me 'surrendering,' and putting my faith in you. 
To spread the seed / songs, I just need a gentle breeze. 

Ways You Can Help

  1. YOUR CONTRIBUTION means the world to me. Everything helps. Without your support, this dream can't happen. 
  2. If you can think of a few people in your community that might be a great fit for this, EMAIL is the BEST way to reach people. 
  3. Please use the share buttons on the left to share this on SOCIAL MEDIA. 
  4. If you would like me to come to your town on TOUR, please contact me or put it in the comments. 
  5. If you have any venue ideas, perk ideas, places to stay, towns to visit, etc, please let me know. If you can think of any one in the music industry or fellow musicians I might open for or play with, I'm open to that too. Or if you are a seasoned indiegogo campaigner, any feedback is profoundly appreciated. 

Thank you, thank you. 
You meet my need for inspiration and generosity. 
Love and Flow,
Steven
Saint Milkweed 
PS. Please sign up for my newsletter HERE so I can keep you updated as I add perks and details. 

Perks Gallery

I tried to create some perks that would captivate and inspire you. 
'Warms the Bones' Hoodie and Mug

Overview
Hi! I'm Steven Budden (aka Saint Milkweed). For the past ten years, I've been tenderly crafting acoustic ballads for a handful of devoted fans. 

I live in a cabin up in the redwoods in Northern California  (I'll tell you how I got here in minute). 
This spring, I'm summoning all my courage and emerging from my cabin-retreat to bring my songs out into the world FOR THE FIRST TIME!
This is a HUGE leap for me... let me tell you why... 
"When you sing, I feel like I get a doorway into your heart and into the heart and soul of the world." - Handwritten note from a beloved fan. 


Birth of 'Saint Milkweed' 


In 2008, I recorded my first album, 'Saint Milkweed' at Tiny Telephone Studios, on a shoestring budget, plunging myself into debt. It was fairly simple: just me, the guitar, and the harmonica. 
A few songs seem to be have an underground following on Pandora (Go to Hell, Caroline- I'm About to Fall, Couldn't Hold Onto You, for instance).  Royalties trickle in... enough to feed a moderately sized chicken or perhaps a large quail. 
I've received glowing letters from a few die-hard fans about how the album 'haunts them' and they have it on endless repeat. 
"I love that album, and hope you make more.  I could listen to it on a loop for hours.  It's seriously one of my ten or so favorites.  It's just so spare and beautiful, and makes me ache." Facebook message from a fan
"One could argue that taste in music is subjective but I truly believe that, in a music industry overshadowed by consumerism, Steve Budden is one of our truly great songwriters" - P. Parise

There are no Accidents
In 2009, as I was giddily planning a tour in the wake of that album,  I BROKE my NECK in the Pacific Ocean in a bodyboarding accident, and my life veered off in a whole new direction.   
The 'accident' brought out the healer in me. I became a somatic healer and a consultant on embodiment and healing, founding Flow Healing Arts in 2011. 
I also continued to write. An underground novel... 'The Flop Eared Gospels'. A healing manual: 'Flow: An Illuminated Training Manual.' Various articles, poetry, and music. 

Out of the Forest and Into the Fire



In 2014, I moved into a cabin in the forest with a partner. She was my main inspiration and my main audience. When she moved out, heart-wrenched, I retreated into the cabin to heal and write.Fate swept in. My cabin neighbor offered his recording set up at this critical hour (thank you D!) and I poured out recent songs onto a new album: Sweet Redemption. Bitter-sweet, much of it is about her. 



New Inspirations
Recently, at an intimate group event  (an Emerging and Evolving Economies JAM put on by an organization called YES!)... we were asked to  speak our deepest desire. 
"I want to start playing my music live and bring my songs out into the world. I want to live in a world where we are each celebrated for sharing our most precious gifts. Where music becomes a mode of connection." 
Tears filled my eyes. Old fears flooded my mind. 
THIS campaign is me living into this ideal. Taking a leap into my higher self. 
  I'm inviting you to become an integral part of this unfolding and to share in the evolution of me as a musician and a man. 

This is my humble cabin retreat.    What I Need 

$20,400 for: 



Saint Milkweed Tour of the Western States for 3 Months (Arizona, California, New Mexico, Colorado, Utah, Washington, Oregon, Montana, Wyoming, Idaho)


Live Recording and CD (Saint Milkweed- In the Rapture) -So people not on the tour path can also experience the magic. 


Printing CD's of my latest release, Sweet Redemption, to bring on tour. 



The Breakdown
1. PROJECTED TOUR EXPENSES (90 DAYS- Spring 2016) - $11,000 




Lodging: $4500


Food: $2700


Transportation Expenses: $2000 

Required Gear: (acoustic guitar pickup, used microphone, cables, etc) modest estimate based on what may be needed, as venues differ drastically: $1000

Misc. Expenses: $800 


2. 'INTO THE RAPTURE' PROJECTED RECORDING EXPENSES - $8200
Traveling inspires me to create. This album will include my 'greatest hits' as well as new songs I compose on the road. 



Recording equipment basics (rental and / or purchase as needed): $3000

Engineering support (as needed): $2000 

Mastering, editing: $2000 
CD manufacture: $1200 

3. 'SWEET REDEMPTION' CD PRINTING -$1200
The Sweet Redemption is already recorded, mixed, and mastered... I just need to print the CDs. 


CD Manufacture with jackets (I do my own graphic design work).: $1200 

Please sign up for my newsletter HERE and I'll keep you updated. 







What You Get
The Intangibles:
The heart-warming feeling of knowing you contributed to making a dream come true. 
My eternal gratitude. 
First invitations to the shows. 
Some input to co-create the tour by suggesting towns and venues that excite you. Ie: A chance to bring the music to YOU. 
The Tangibles:
I've also put together some beautiful offerings for you, ranging from digital downloads of unreleased materials to hand-crafted gifts, a private house concert, and a musical hike / journey with me, healing sessions, attire.


'Saint Milkweed' Organic Cotton T, designed by me (men's version). That's the guitar I recorded my first album on. 


What the!? An organic baby bodysuit!? For the sheer hilarity and cuteness factor of it. 

If I am unable to reach my goal for whatever reason,... I will pour more energy into the tour and save the recording pieces for another date, as well as attempt to bring in funds from other sources to support the project. 
    The Impact
I am an idealist. I've created the music I love to create without a thought of it's commercial appeal. I record it bare bones, so there is nowhere to hide. This is, I think, the source of it's appeal as well as the reason I'm not more well known yet. 
Creating music underground for 20 years without much exposure to other musicians has been in interesting experience.Through this, my songwriting has evolved into a unique and very personal mode of expression. 
I'll write songs forever. I know that. However, I would LOVE if more people could actually hear these creations I pour so much love into. 
The next step in my journey is to bring my music to the world. To get out of the digital reality and go out and play for people like you in person. 
What this REPRESENTS is the dare to dream. 
I feel doubts arise as I write this. 'Maybe I'm too old or it's too late.' 
Is it ever too late to chase dreams? 
When I play live, I feel the transmission from heart to heart. Sometimes, after a song, I look up and see tears in peoples' eyes and it trills in my soul. 
I want all of us to have more of THAT. So I'm doing what I can to create it. To 'be the change I wish to see in the world.' 

Wherever possible, I'll try to keep the venues small and intimate, to foster that sense of connectedness. 

I truly need your support to move forward and to spread the music of love and redemption.    Confession
I notice I'm nervous, because without you, I know I could easily regress into my hermit songwriting mode- tenderly crafting passionate songs few hear.  
I'm also excited! Because with your support, I can move forward and deliver music you'll never forget. 
I'm humble during this process. I'm open to learning from other seasoned-touring musicians and from you. 

Surrender
The name Saint Milkweed came to me upon reading a Richard Wilbur poem:
"Anonymous as cherubsUnder the crib of God,White seeds are floatingOut of my burst pod.What power had IBefore I learned to yield?Shatter me, great wind:I shall possess the field"
This campaign represents is me 'surrendering,' and putting my faith in you. 
To spread the seed / songs, I just need a gentle breeze. 
   Ways You Can Help


YOUR CONTRIBUTION means the world to me. Everything helps. Without your support, this dream can't happen. 

If you can think of a few people in your community that might be a great fit for this, EMAIL is the BEST way to reach people. 

Please use the share buttons on the left to share this on SOCIAL MEDIA. 


If you would like me to come to your town on TOUR, please contact me or put it in the comments. 

If you have any venue ideas, perk ideas, places to stay, towns to visit, etc, please let me know. If you can think of any one in the music industry or fellow musicians I might open for or play with, I'm open to that too. Or if you are a seasoned indiegogo campaigner, any feedback is profoundly appreciated. 


Thank you, thank you. 

You meet my need for inspiration and generosity. 
Love and Flow,
Steven
Saint Milkweed 
PS. Please sign up for my newsletter HERE so I can keep you updated as I add perks and details. 

Perks Gallery
I tried to create some perks that would captivate and inspire you. 
'Warms the Bones' Hoodie and Mug

story:
LISTEN TO MORE OF OUR MUSIC ▶

Girls with guitars and drums... what's not to love?

Hi there!  We're Rose, Susie, Becky and Maria, and we play in a band called Letters in beautiful Gainesville, FL.  This month, we will finish recording our very first album.  This album has been years in the making, and we're super-excited about it!  

In the spirit of true punk DIY, we're doing all the recording and mixing ourselves, with our own gear, in our own space.  Maria is an experienced sound engineer, and she's doing a fantastic job.  We get to spend as long as we want getting the songs perfect, and Rose can record 4-part harmonies on, like, everything.  Our goal is to get the music out there, tour and play shows, and generally keep the riotgrrl movement alive through our music.    

Why we're here

We launched this campaign to raise the money we need to actually press the album and make CDs.  (FYI, we're open to pressing vinyl too, if enough folks tell us they want records).  We'll also release the digital album for download in all the places (iTunes, Amazon, Spotify, Pandora, our Bandcamp site, somebody's Myspace, your mom's clock radio), along with digital versions of the artwork and lyrics.

We know most people only listen to music on their phones these days, but we also remember how cool it was to open a new CD and hold the liner notes in our hands.  We're going to include full lyrics to all our songs and all original artwork by Rose with this album.  We want folks to be able to touch the physical cardstock, and we want to be able to sign CDs at shows for anyone who wants one.  No jewel-cases though.  We're going with planet-friendly cardboard wallets with inserts. 

The money will be used exactly like this:    

  • 1000 CDs in cardboard wallets with booklets (including CD replication, full-color printing, shipping and tax) = $1,752.30 (quote from CDBaby, who does CD replication for musicians by musicians, which is why we chose them.)

  • Indiegogo 5% fee = $87.61

That's it.  That's the whole campaign.

Why you should help

If you love seeing more and more women playing in rock bands... if you want to support unsigned bands from small towns... if you want to help produce independent music... if you love riotgrrl music and you want to keep it going... if you're already a fan of ours and you're frustrated that we haven't recorded any of our music yet... if you dig our music, and you want to hear it better, louder and longer... and for any other reason that speaks to you, we would love your support!

Plans A & B

Plan A: We get all the money we need through this campaign, and we send the album to press by November 1.  We get it back in December, and we have our album release show in January 2016.  Anyone who contributes to this campaign at the Pre-Order level receives their albums in time for holiday gift-giving :)

Plan B: We don't get all the money we need by the end of the month, and we have to save up a little bit more to get the album pressed.  We're doing it no matter what - it's just a question of how long it will take to save the money.  In that event, we'll let you all know the new timeline (it'll depend on how far we are from our original funding goal).  Regardless, every cent you contribute will be used for this project only, and rest assured - IT'S GONNA HAPPEN.

If you has no monies

If you like us but can't give any dollahs right now, do not fret.  Visit our Facebook page and keep abreast (see what we did there?) of our upcoming shows.  We've got a shows coming up Oct. 24 at the High Dive in Gainesville and Oct. 29 at Market Street Pub in Gainesville, and we'd love to see you.  Use the share tools on this Indiegogo campaign to spread the word in your network about our album funding project - that helps so much!

Thanks so much for visiting our campaign page.  As they say in Gainesville Girls Rock Camp, YOU ROCK!

P.S. YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE ANY AMOUNT YOU WANT.  Select the perk you want, and then choose the option to add an additional contribution, if you feel inspired to.  Also, if you want a perk or something that isn't listed here, CONTACT US.  We want to make you happy, and we're super-grateful for your support!

P.P.S.  We love you!!!!

P.P.S.  We love you!!!!

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Tom D’Ademo and I’ve been writing acoustic, singer-songwriter type music under the pseudonym "Me, Like Many" for seven years. This campaign is aimed to launch this project into another dimension in the form of getting it off the ground and pushing it to the point where it’s visible to a mass amount. This campaign is the attempt to reset the bar of popular music in both lyrical content and instrumentation.

Your contribution will make you a partner in bringing this album to fruition and help bring my music to the next level.  We have some great perks for all levels of contributions and we will all benefit from this project. 

What we need/What you get:

$30,000 

Okay, so here’s what we need to get this project done. This project is going to involve more musicians, and technical production hours that it will cost around $30,000 to produce, package & promote.  Our producer is Vic Steffens of Horizon Music Group in West Haven, CT who also recorded “In The Moment”, the first EP we released.  His knowledge and support, in my opinion, is second to none.  We are really excited about this project. 

Here’s an estimate of how the costs break down:

·  Recording costs = $10,000
For studio time, gear, assisting engineers....

·  Mixing = $3,000

·  Mastering = $1,000

·  Artwork and packaging design = $1,500

·  Web related costs and Paypal fees = $1,000

·  Publicity = $4,000

·  Exclusive Indiegogo CD = $2,500

·  Exclusive Indiegogo Vinyl LPs = $3,500

·  Exclusive Indiegogo Poster = $750

·  Exclusive Indiegogo T-shirts = $2,000

·  Exclusive Indiegogo Lyric Book = $750

Total Estimated Cost: $30,000

For contributing we have great lineup of perks that include CD’s, Vinyl Records, T-shirts, a home concert, lyric book even a chance to become an associate producer or even perform on a song. See the side bar for details.

If we should exceed our goal, the money will go toward marketing, touring, producing a video, music equipment & software. 

We do not anticipate not making our goal, but if that should happen, the funds raised will go toward getting the word out about Me, Like Many and getting this project funded by hiring a promotion company to help us. 

The Impact:

It’s not a secret that the composition of popular music has been dumbed down to four chords and tired clichés that anyone with an elementary school diploma and a pen can construct. In most cases, popular music lacks substance, depth, and intelligence. It is our goal to reestablish these institutions into mainstream media.  We refuse to accept the norm that simplicity is the only way into a successful career. We personally miss the days when the radio was flooded with music that was written to evoke a feeling or thought rather than just the urge to dance or blindly sing along. Whereas those songs are good to have, it’s crucial to also involve well-constructed music into mainstream mediums. At almost every show we play at, we have been told that the music we play is a breath of fresh air in a stagnant room full of the same concepts. Our goal is to achieve this at an immensely greater scale. If you agree with us, then please join us on our journey of creating meaningful music with us and contribute.  Let’s make beautiful music together.

Risks and Challenges:

With any venture there are always risks.  We have a great team in place to help me to reduce the risks as we proceed to production.  I’m not facing this venture alone my team consists of my mom, a former VP of Finance who also worked in the music business during her college years, my dad who has worked in the IT field, owns his own real estate business and has many years’ experience with live and recorded sound and Vic Steffens who has over 40 years’ experience in the music business, will be producing this new album.  My team which is in place, will keep the risks to a minimum, provide support when we face challenges and can call upon advisers to overcome hurtles that we may face. 

Other ways:

We know that some of you may not be able to contribute, and that is OK, here is what you can do to help…..please spread the word multiple times over the next few weeks on your social media pages, tell your friends, neighbors and family to become a fan and contribute.

story:
Musicians for Musicians!


  • Vocal Productions NYC, corp. is a not-for-profit organization, committed to produce the highest caliber of vocal stage experience. We consider it our responsibility to cultivate opportunities to perform a role, conduct an ensemble or accompany a major musical work with positive, nonjudgmental surroundings. These opportunities will expose professional artists to the business of opera and give them a venue in which to display their talents and accomplishments.
  • VPNYC is a volunteer run company  and all proceeds to toward making the best show possible for our artists and audiences.
  • We need your help in funding our next show's orchestra!!!

The Breakdown

  • We need to raise a sum of $2000.00 to be able to pay our orchestra members.
  • This breaks down to $100.00 a person for a 20 piece orchestra for our upcoming show, Lucia di Lammermoor by Donizetti. Even though our Orchestra members need to be paid, they are incredibly generous with their time for such a small honorarium. 
  • If we are unable to pay our musicians, we may not have a show!
  • We have levels of perks for levels of donations for those who can help!

The Impact

  • Helping us to grow, means helping musicians grow!
  • For the last three years we have been able to give experience to young professionals thanks to help from donors like you!
  • It takes an army of people putting in their time and effort to make these shows, but it wouldn't be possible with out your help!

Challenges

As you may know, Opera is a grand art form. There are countless factors in creating a show and having an orchestra is an extremely important one. Our staff is completely volunteer and incredibly dedicated to finding local talent, but we still need your help in getting that talent a paycheck!

  • We already have a long list of committed and talented orchestra members. We just need to secure them! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Additionally we would love your help in getting the word out. The more the merrier! 
  • You can send this campaign via e mail FB or twitter by copy pasting the link or you can use the indiegogo share tools.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Alexander and the reason for this campaign is to provide an avenue for self-discovery and continuing my musical spiritual journey without limitations. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need approximately $3,000 in order to support myself with transportation while in Florida, Colorado, and California, and any place in between. It is also for providing myself with basic stability while looking for employment in each of these locations. A necessary backbone if you will so I can fulfill my dream. 

I am an overly energetic person full of positive energy and love to spread to the world or anyone who comes into contact with me. I have the ability to light up the room with my smile as well as my music. 

The Impact

This is a valuable project because when successful, I will finally be able to utilize a platform in order to continue my love and passion for music and finally start to pave my way for my spiritual musical journey. 

Risks & Challenges

I do not utilize vehicles for transportation for many personal reasons, so I tend to lean towards public transportation and my own two legs for getting around. Although it seems like a hindrance, it provides me with my own peace of mind. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Although anything helps, if you are unable to donate, please spread the word that I am trying to follow my dreams and I am finally taking the steps to thrust myself forward..

Short Summary Hello,
My name is Alexander and the reason for this campaign is to provide an avenue for self-discovery and continuing my musical spiritual journey without limitations.    What We Need & What You Get I need approximately $3,000 in order to support myself with transportation while in Florida, Colorado, and California, and any place in between. It is also for providing myself with basic stability while looking for employment in each of these locations. A necessary backbone if you will so I can fulfill my dream. 
I am an overly energetic person full of positive energy and love to spread to the world or anyone who comes into contact with me. I have the ability to light up the room with my smile as well as my music. 
    The Impact This is a valuable project because when successful, I will finally be able to utilize a platform in order to continue my love and passion for music and finally start to pave my way for my spiritual musical journey. 
    Risks & Challenges I do not utilize vehicles for transportation for many personal reasons, so I tend to lean towards public transportation and my own two legs for getting around. Although it seems like a hindrance, it provides me with my own peace of mind. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Although anything helps, if you are unable to donate, please spread the word that I am trying to follow my dreams and I am finally taking the steps to thrust myself forward..

story:
Hi! My name is Naysan and I'm a part of the team that runs Baha'i Blog!

We recently started Studio Sessions, where we invite Baha'is and their friends to come into a recording studio in different parts of the world, in order to share songs they've composed based on the Baha'i Writings while we film and record them.

We then make these videos and recordings available on our Baha'i Blog YouTube Channel and SoundCloud page for everyone to listen to and download for free! This initiative has proven to be extremely popular and a great resource!

We're aiming to produce 52 new Studio Sessions (one per week) from around the world for 2016, but we need your help to do this!

How & Why it Started

A letter from the Universal House of Justice to all National Spiritual Assemblies dated 12 December, 2011, states:

"We long to see, for instance, the emergence of captivating songs from every part of the world, in every language, that will impress upon the consciousness of the young the profound concepts enshrined in the Baha’i teachings." 

As someone who’s had the opportunity to travel a whole lot over the years, I’ve had the good fortune of attending a variety of different Baha’i-related gatherings around the world. One of the things I’ve enjoyed immensely while attending these gatherings, is being able to experience "the emergence of captivating songs from every part of the world, in every language" first hand!

I’ve always wished others could hear these wonderful songs which celebrate the Writings of the Baha'i Faith, and now with Studio Sessions they can!

The Impact

We've been releasing one Studio Sessions song per week (that's over 20 songs so far) and we've recorded in Sydney, Australia; Los Angeles, USA; Arequipa, Peru; London, UK; Toronto, Canada; the Gold Coast, Australia and Madrid, Spain.

The global response to these Studio Sessions has been absolutely amazing, and we've had a ton of great feedback from so many different people, but here's an example of one response which really sums it all up:

"Just want to let you know how much I am enjoying the Baha'i Blog Studio Sessions. Every time we get a notification a new one has gone up, its the first thing I jump on YouTube to check. I have seen friends using these prayers in their devotionals and this Sunday night we also used one of the prayers to start our devotional. They are really useful to the teaching work underway as well. I think as more friends start to engage with these prayers others will be inspired to craft their own prayers or pick up a guitar to learn these prayers within their own clusters as we have seen already in some of the comments.  Anyways just want to say to the team keep up great work and I hope this series will continue on for the foreseeable future, traveling to more and more countries!" -Chad

As we want these songs to serve as a resource for you and communities around the world, every song we release includes the lyrics and the chords so you can learn to play them as well. We do hope this initiative encourages the use of music in communities around the world and inspires others to create their own songs.


How You Can Help

We have enough songs recorded to take us to the end of the 2015, and we'd really like to be able to continue Studio Sessions into the future, but getting people into a studio and filming and recording them isn't always that easy - or cheap.

So far Studio Sessions has been possible thanks to the help of volunteers, and because we've been digging into our own pockets, but unfortunately doing things this way is simply not sustainable.

Since we don’t generate any income through advertising (and we don't want to do this - can you imagine having to listen to an ad before listening to a beautiful prayer?), and we also don’t want to charge anyone for these wonderful songs either, we're asking for your help to make sure we can keep Studio Sessions going. 

Based on our experience, and excluding our time and the generous help of volunteers, we've calculated that if we had to pay for everything else, each Studio Session song would cost on average US$250. So, to have 52 songs will cost a total of US$13,000. I know this may sound like a lot, but it goes towards things like studio room hire, sound engineer hire, hire of a camera person to film and edit, some travel expenses (for instance sometimes we have to help artists to come in from certain parts of a country which isn't always that cheap), and other bits-and-pieces like hard drives to store all the footage.

And remember! The above covers both the video and audio production, which are FREE to download and available online as long as the internet exists! ;)

Any funds raised in excess of what is needed will be put aside for Studio Sessions 2017 and the years beyond. 


What's in it for You?

Most crowd funding campaigns provide those contributing  with rewards or perks for their contributions, but after discussing this at length, the team at Baha'i Blog decided that we are going to keep the perks very simple, and I'll explain why:

We feel like the production and release of these Studio Sessions to the world ARE the reward, and this is the product we're offering. It's not a CD, a slick suitcase or a belt buckle - it's a collection of songs based on the Baha'i Writings made available for FREE on YouTube and SoundCloud for millions of people to listen to and use.

Nevertheless, we thought about creating t-shirts, we thought about producing a CD; but then we calculated the cost and time this would take, and we quickly realised that would increase the cost, and would take away from the limited time we have to dedicate to this very important initiative. Additionally, things like creating a CD and shipping it would not only add up cost-wise, but could also have legal and copyright issues with those wonderful individuals who have contributed their music for free to this initiative. We'd like to try and keep this initiative as simple and straightforward as possible, ensuring that the music is always free. As a result, we decided to give everyone who makes a contribution a digital copy of the most listened to Studio Sessions song of 2016 as a token of our appreciation. The main reward therefore, is the sharing of this beautiful Baha'i-inspired music from around the world - with the whole world!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to Studio Sessions financially, that's totally cool, but we’d really appreciate it if you could help us by doing the following:

1.  Help spread the word and let others know about this campaign.

2. Subscribe to Baha’i Blog’s YouTube Channel so we can share with you all the new Studio Sessions as they're released.

story:
In a nutshell

After 10+ years of independently releasing music with nothing but the money I've saved up I'm asking for a little help this time. I don't mind saving and spending and have done it happily all along. This time however I feel that the time it would take to save the amount I need would bring me so far away from where I am now the music would come out ingenuine. I also don't want to put out something now for the sake of capturing the mood but in sacrifice of quality.

I really do record in my bathroom right now. 
The video says it all but this bears repeating, this is not just a hip hop album for the sake of head boppin and hype tracks. This is poetry over soulful sounds. The respiration of a man battling with balancing his emotions, obligations, responsibilities and priorities. These songs are gonna come out one way or another but for the sake of something that will be of a quality that allows the listener to absorb every little nuance, where every intentional quirk will be noticeable, for something for once better than just a blank CD and artwork going from color to monotone because color copies cost too much and all the feeling that color invokes being thrown out the window, I'm raising some cash.

Your support will make this dream a reality. By supporting honest music you're helping raise the standard for all music. By supporting one person's dream you give hope to dreamers everywhere.


This money is going to pay for:

  • MUSIC- I'm breaking away from producing every instrumental on my own or jacking beats from the internet. There are producers out there that deserve to be paid for their craft and I want to work with them.
  • CASES/ DISCS- Instead of buying the cheapest cases and blank CDs I can afford and having inconsistent products, I'm ordering in bulk printed cases and discs.
  • ARTWORK- This album is going to be released in a four panel cardboard sleeve which I'm reaching out to various artists to contribute to.
  • RECORDING/ MIXING-  Quality in this case does start with equipment and I don't have it. I've got a good laptop and software but for the purposes of live vocals and ensuring the finished product is of the highest quality, I'm going to people with experience in doing so.


The Impact

Like I said, these songs will come out one way or another. The sound quality isn't gonna be the deciding factor on whether this gets played on Hot97 or land someone on Sway in the morning. This really is just so the people who are gonna listen are gonna get the full experience. All art should have the opportunity to be appreciated to the fullest.


Risks & Challenges

Having transplanted myself across the country in the past year I have let go of some of the resources I'd had established in my home town. Los Angeles can be hard to navigate especially in the presence of sharks and other dreamers who care only about connections and piggybacking on the success of others. I'm looking into a few studios and working with a few producers but it's not always easy to read who has honest intention and who is only willing to work with you because of where it could get them. I'm not looking to work with opportunists which makes the pool relatively smaller.

The other biggest challenge here is time. I've got songs that are a few months old that are already no longer relevant to my life today but that still fit the theme of the project. I have been rehearsing them constantly as not to loose the mood but as my song library grows it becomes a more arduous process and I fear some is already being lost. If I don't reach my goal by the deadline I've outlined there's a good chance that what finally comes out is gonna be very far from the original vision. There's something to be said for being in the now but the point of recording is to capture the now and make it accessible again to re-live, to learn from, to enjoy.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't throw in $1,000 throw in $10.
If you can't throw in $10 throw in what you can.
If you can't give anything but your time then I ask if you would use that time to tell a friend.
Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Howdy and thanks for stopping by! SheKudo is a Sydney based label which started up between two pals who have been wreaking havoc since 1998.


After launching our first collection "Wahala" in 2013; inspired by the bright, bold and eclectic aspects of our African heritage, we received such an amazing response and just managed to break even. As with most new projects, the first couple of years are crucial and hence we decided to put the costs back into the label, find ourselves an office and get the 2nd collection up and running. 

SheKudo is passionate about Sydney and the abundance of emerging and established creatives we have in this city and we are not looking to take our production anywhere else. This city has shaped so much of who we are and we want to share that with the world. In this collection entitled "Laguna Colorada" we have collaborated with two local Sydney artists to create our fabric designs; Mulga The Artist and Daniella Argenta.

We are hoping this campaign will give us the extra help that we need to launch our second collection "Laguna Colorada" and provide us with a leg up to cover fabric supply, digital printing and manufacturing costs  as producing at on home soil can be super costly as we all know.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to be able to deliver affordable high quality pieces which continue to transcend trends and time. Pieces that you can buy for that catch up dinner with the mates  and then to be able to pull it out again 3 years later for that visit to your mother-in-law's (eeek). Based on personal experience -- affordable, quality pieces aren't always easy to come by - and to have a taste of something truly unique, you're forced to dig deep in the wallet or head to the thrift store to keep things interesting. 

SheKudo looks to become a staple in the wardrobes of trendsetters worldwide with each piece making the wearer feel authentic, confident and comfortable in their own crazy.

Every contribution counts and even if you can't support us financially, please take the time to mention it to a mate - that is a gift within itself. You can donate with the intention of receiving something in return - or you can simply just make a donation.


Wahala Wax Notebooks *please note they come in a variety of prints, due to this we can't guarantee which print you will get


Limited edition Mulga Magnets *not all magnets are shown here, artworks will vary


Framed Bolivian artwork duo *Personally designed Bolivian artworks ("Mama Bolivia" and "Cact-i"), framed individually (each artwork is 20cm x 20cm in either a brown wooden frame or plastic white frame).

story:
Do you hear that sound?

I read somewhere that owls hoot to search for a mate, to mark their territory, or to locate their babies. Well, babies, we’re hooting at you.

Hi. I’m Little Sara, from Little Sara and the Night Owls. We are a Seattle based band with a collective century of experience in the music world, bringing you a selection of classic blues and soul songs. Our first hoot was delivered loud and proud to attract our mates, the members of our parliament: Kenny “Dr. Sax” Mandell on woodwinds and percussion, “Reverend” Al Walker on guitar, Dennis “Dr. Stax” Staskowski on bass, Donny “Chesterfield” Berman on drums, and me, “Little” Sara Depp, on vocals. And we’ve been marking our territory all around town, in Seattle venues such as Egan’s, Couth Buzzard Books, The Angry Beaver, the Park Public House, and at large events like the Greenwood Car Show, the Bellevue Strawberry Festival, and Olympia’s Music in the Park series in Sylvester Park. All that’s left is to locate you, babies, because we need your help.

The life of a musician is a lot like the life of an owl: majestic, adventurous, largely nocturnal…and not exactly financially lucrative. In order to keep bringing you the booty-shakin’, ear-caressin’, high-energy shows we’ve become known for, we need a good PA system. Right now we are using old, out-of-date equipment that’s quite frankly about to go the way of another famous bird — the dodo. We want our sound equipment to let our voices and instruments ring clear and bright. And we’d like to ask you for your help in making that happen.

$2000 will allow us to buy a quality PA, which means at future shows we will be able to play music for you that sounds the way it should. The way you remember. A sound that does justice to the long and storied traditions of blues and soul. We are so appreciative of the support of our fans, friends and family. We would be grateful for any dollar amount, and if you’re not able to donate financially at this time, we ask that you share this video on social media to help spread the word.

Thank you in advance, Owlets, and hoot hoot! We look forward to playing for you soon.

MORE PERKS ARE COMING!!!!
