story:
The Muze Story 

The idea behind Muze guitars is to make incredible sound accessible. Every option we make available, every detail we perfect, and everything we put in to our work is done with integrity. Our goal is to make sure your instrument sings the sweetest song possible, feels easy in your hands, and lasts a lifetime.

Muze founders, Alec & Matt were shopping for guitars in the fall of 2012. As college students, the Ramen Noodle budget made it difficult for them to find an all-solid wood, non-machine made guitar. This problem sent the duo into a serious research binge to find out what made the guitars of yesteryear so great, and if anyone was still building that way. The short answer was: yes, but for well outside their means. 

                                         

That was the revelation. Matt, a 15+ year guitar veteran, and former professional musician teamed up with Alec to design and produce guitars that used traditional building methods (people, not lasers) with modern appointments (armrest bevels, side-port sound holes, etc). What was the result: Muze Guitars.

Why are we on IndieGoGo? What are the rewards?

Like many start-ups, Muze is in need of a financial catalyst! More than that though, we want to do this in a way where we build a true community around what Muze stands for: making incredible sound accessible. The only platform perfect for us is IndieGoGo. Here is how you can be a part of this story from the beginning!

With your help we hope to raise $10,000. With your funding we will:

  • Produce your own custom Muze Guitar which will be delivered to you Spring 2016

  • Finish our custom online guitar configurator on muzeguitars.com

  • Design new models and features including jumbo, 12 string, and fanned frets

  • Ship some awesome swag to our evangelists

  • Donate a custom Muze guitar to The Record Co. in Dorchester, MA.
     


How YOU can make a difference...   

While producing guitars is our main focus, we also hope to have a positive impact on our community and support musical arts programs. As fellow musicians, we understand the importance of supporting music programs geared towards children and young adults, and believe they play a vital part in youth development. During our campaign if we surpass our $10,000 goal, we will donate a guitar to The Record Co. The Record Co. is a Dorchester, MA nonprofit, whose goal is to build a sustainable, nationally recognized modern music scene in Boston. The Record Co. does this through several programs engaging inner-city youth who would not otherwise have access to music and audio recording services. During the campaign, we will release charitable stretch goals, and continue to donate one Muze at a time to worthy organizations (such as this one) that support the musical arts!


Risks and Challenges

As a new product company we have, of course, come up against challenges. Two specific demands that we have targeted are; (1)  gaining credibility within the music community and (2) securing quality manufacturing and logistics partnerships.

We have been working tirelessly to validate our guitars by getting them into the hands of musicians to receive feedback and make improvements. Leveraging our music-industry network, we have already received great constructive feedback and have more artists lined up for future testing. At this point, we are 100% confident in our partnerships to start production. We know that we can get the highest quality guitar into your hands for a reasonable price.

Be Part of Our Story

Thank you SO MUCH for visiting our page. The work and effort from the founders of Muze Guitars is only surpassed by the glowing generosity and support of the people around us. We have been fortunate to find eager-volunteers and workers for the price of food and thank you’s. Muze Guitars is a grassroots effort, and we are excited to sew the seeds of what may one day become the next great guitar company. Please post any questions, comments or concerns, and we will happily engage and answer. Thank you again for visiting, we hope that you will consider becoming part of the Muze Guitars family!
story_txt:
The Muze Story 




The idea behind Muze guitars is to make incredible sound accessible. Every option we make available, every detail we perfect, and everything we put in to our work is done with integrity. Our goal is to make sure your instrument sings the sweetest song possible, feels easy in your hands, and lasts a lifetime.Muze founders, Alec & Matt were shopping for guitars in the fall of 2012. As college students, the Ramen Noodle budget made it difficult for them to find an all-solid wood, non-machine made guitar. This problem sent the duo into a serious research binge to find out what made the guitars of yesteryear so great, and if anyone was still building that way. The short answer was: yes, but for well outside their means. 
                                          
That was the revelation. Matt, a 15+ year guitar veteran, and former professional musician teamed up with Alec to design and produce guitars that used traditional building methods (people, not lasers) with modern appointments (armrest bevels, side-port sound holes, etc). What was the result: Muze Guitars.
Why are we on IndieGoGo? What are the rewards?

Like many start-ups, Muze is in need of a financial catalyst! More than that though, we want to do this in a way where we build a true community around what Muze stands for: making incredible sound accessible. The only platform perfect for us is IndieGoGo. Here is how you can be a part of this story from the beginning!
With your help we hope to raise $10,000. With your funding we will:

Produce your own custom Muze Guitar which will be delivered to you Spring 2016
Finish our custom online guitar configurator on muzeguitars.com
Design new models and features including jumbo, 12 string, and fanned frets
Ship some awesome swag to our evangelists
Donate a custom Muze guitar to The Record Co. in Dorchester, MA.



     
How YOU can make a difference...   
While producing guitars is our main focus, we also hope to have a positive impact on our community and support musical arts programs. As fellow musicians, we understand the importance of supporting music programs geared towards children and young adults, and believe they play a vital part in youth development. During the campaign, we will release charitable stretch goals, and continue to donate one Muze at a time to worthy organizations (such as this one) that support the musical arts!

We have been working tirelessly to validate our guitars by getting them into the hands of musicians to receive feedback and make improvements. Leveraging our music-industry network, we have already received great constructive feedback and have more artists lined up for future testing. At this point, we are 100% confident in our partnerships to start production. We know that we can get the highest quality guitar into your hands for a reasonable price. 


Be Part of Our Story


Thank you SO MUCH for visiting our page. The work and effort from the founders of Muze Guitars is only surpassed by the glowing generosity and support of the people around us. We have been fortunate to find eager-volunteers and workers for the price of food and thank you’s. Muze Guitars is a grassroots effort, and we are excited to sew the seeds of what may one day become the next great guitar company. Please post any questions, comments or concerns, and we will happily engage and answer. Thank you again for visiting, we hope that you will consider becoming part of the Muze Guitars family!

story:
So why am I doing this?

I'm in the process of making the best album I've ever made in my entire musical career.  It's been a long time in the making, a life time in fact. 

I took a break for five years for the best things, for the best person. During that time I reflected, I grew, I woke the hell up, I was able to fully grasp the word HUMBLE and the word LOVE. I wrote lyrics and I made some incredibly kick-ass music.  And I'm sure that what I came to realize is... 

Great aspirations require a little help from your friends.

I know a lot of us don't have $25 to give, but any contribution is extreamly appreciated.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello World! My name is Polly and im a songer-songwritter from a DEEPSIX band!!!!  I have already singing all my life and now I'm at the point where I have to make big decisions. I really believe that money cant control your destiny. So that's why I'm here! And I would be glad to find an echo in your hearts guys.

Of course, a lot of bands in the world who want to achieve success! What distinguishes us is! ??

We are international, we love to made a great shows, we crave rock, we are really funny guys who brings not only music, but also the message in the world !!

My musicians live in different parts of the world and right now we are recording our first album. It is gonna be a pop-rock and  the first music video is scheduled for early June. Each of us contributes a small portion of the money. But in general, the total price of the music video - 15 thousand dollars.

We also have a business plan, marketing promotion plan. And we can promise you  to BORN a wonderful music coming from our hearts!

The Impact

I truly believe that with the popularity comes great responsibility. I took part in the x factor in my country some years ago and then fell on me a little popularity.

I saw how a generation younger than me absorb the role  model behavior of their favorite artists and musicians. SO great to be an inspiration and to give the right direction !? Dont you think so?

Risks & Challenges

In the world there are millions of obstacles, interference on the way to a dream!

Actually I can not get a visa before coming to the music video.

But let's be optimistic! Right now I feel as if I am on the threshold of something new and cool! So perhaps even monkeys-Zombie invasion can not stop me!:D

IM JUST KIDDING! Of course everything in God's hands!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you dont have a opportunity with money!! Sooo wheteveer.. We love you anyway!! Just remember us and join our music latter!)) Also tell all the world about us and follow our instagram to know all the breaking news!!! YO 

https://www.instagram.com/deepsixband/

story:
Who, or what, are The Stomping Boondocks?

Stomping Boondocks are a lively five piece Folk band, based in Dorset.

We are looking to record an album of traditional Irish, English, Welsh & Scottish tunes, traditional folk songs, shanties and originals too.

Our line up is comprised of Guitar, Fiddle, Viola/Saxophone, Accordion and Cajon Drum.

Between us, we have many years of experience in Folk & Irish music, and even more years playing! We can play the instruments above, as well as Bouzouki, Mandolin, Bass, Keyboard, Saxaphone and Penny Whistles to name just some!

We're looking to get an album together and we will reveal the full listing of the album when we reach £450, but can tell you it will be a 12 track album, with 5 additional songs - 2 of which will feature Molly Tilston on vocals.

Why are we turning to Crowdfunding?

Well, its the same old story really - we're poor musicians! 

We've dug out, and dusted off, some tunes and songs from as far back as 1720 - we've done some work on them to re-jig them, re word in places or two and maybe even put a bit of a bouncier feel to it - but the heart is still there.

We're looking to crowdfunding as we really want to record and release the album independently, which gives us more freedom in recording so we can keep the sounds the way we believe they should be and also means that we don't have to charge and arm and a leg for the completed album.

Do I get anything not listed with the perks?

Yes! If we are successful in at least 85% of our funding we will be holding a ticketed album launch party in London.  As a contributor, you will be offered a priority ticket to the event which will have cake, balloons, and of course music!

What are you going to do with the money?

We've negotiated the cost of the studio time, so of course the majority of the money will be going into the recording itself - recording, mastering and getting it all pretty and ready.  This is another reason we have turned to crowd funding - with your help we can have more days in the studio, and longer to perfect the sound.

We'll also be looking to host a special album launch party at a venue in London, where all backers would receive priority (and with any luck, free!) tickets where we can personally thank each and every one of you

Can you tell us who the guest singer is?

 We can now confirm the special guest singer will be Molly Tilston - an incredibly talented folk singer, and songwriter, who will be joining us on a track that all folk lovers hold dear to their hearts - which we will reveal as the funding gets going.

If you've not checked out some of Molly's songs, then you really should! https://soundcloud.com/m-840

Will there be bonus tracks?

Yes! On 12th November 2015, we will be performing with Shaun Buswell's pop up orchestra at Shelley Theatre in Bournemouth and will be performing one of our tracks with a full backing - this will also make the album.

As well as this, we'll be keeping a video diary of our time in the studio, and in the cottage attached to the studio, so you get to see the magic happen; along with whatever else unravels in our brains as we spend too many days in a confined space together.

Why should I back this?

We've uncovered some great, old traditional songs from up to 200 years ago; dusted them off, made some changes and we want to bring these songs and tunes back to life - and of course, not to gloat, but we feel we're pretty good at it too!

With your help, it allows us to record the album exactly as we think it should be done and every single person that contributes to us will be thanked through our social media, through perks and hopefully through an invitation to the album launch where we'll make sure there is enough cake for everyone!

story:
About me
My name is J. Michael, I'm a singer-songwriter living outside of St. Charles, MO. I have been singing and writing music since I was 11 years old.

I've always been very passionate about music and even want to make it a career. Experimenting with different sounds and then sharing my music with an audience is my favorite part of the creative process. So, I began playing solo acoustic shows about 3 years ago around the St. Charles/St. Louis area. My passion for performing continues to grow and I plan to start touring in the fall.

But first, I will need an album to sell and promote. Unfortunately I have never released an album, but I met up with a local music writer and producer, Alvin Zamudio, and we now have plans to record my 6 song EP this September.

About this project

I will record the "Found EP" at Alvin’s studio this Summer and  then make it available online and on CD. Then I will launch my tour with a sendoff party in October. 

But I can't do this without your help. Here's how you can be a part of making this happen...

How you can help

The goal for  this indiegogo campaign is set to $4500, this will go towards recording and creating the album.  There are several ways that you can help with raising the funds to get my original songs professionally produced and recorded. They’re called “perks,” they range from digital downloads of my music all the way to your own private house concert!

Join me in making this happen. I look forward to sharing my first EP with you all.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Slow Lights formed in 2013. Having written a multitude of original songs together, Asa Kurland, Jesse Baker, and David Rosenfeld bring their tracks to life with a blend of indie, rock, and soul influences.  Their unique alternative sound contains a mix of electronic pop, acoustic songwriting, and funky rhythms which has only been expanded by the acquisition of one of Baltimore's finest horn and rhythm sections.

 

Asa Kurland - Vocals/Guitar

Jesse Baker - Guitar

David Rosenfeld - Drums/Vocals

Bailey Straw - Bass / Vocals

Kim Gravatt - Saxophone / Flute / Vocals

Steven Bailey - Trumpet / Flugelhorn

Aaron Walker - Keyboard / Vocals 

 

Donations and Prizes:

$10  = 2.5" Slow Lights Button

$25 =  Slow Lights Full Length Album (signed) and 2.5" Slow Lights Button

$35 = Original Slow Lights print made by Aminah Shourbaji and Slow Lights Full Length Album 

$50 =  Slow Lights T-Shirt, Slow Lights Full Length, and 2.5" SL Button

$100 = Name listed on Thank You for Album (inside cover), Slow Lights T-Shirt, an original Slow Lights print made by Aminah Shourbaji, Slow Lights Full Length, and 2.5" SL Button

$250 = 2 VIP Tickets to Slow Lights show of choice (some restrictions apply),  Name listed on Thank You for Album (inside cover), Slow Lights T-Shirt, an original Slow Lights print made by Aminah Shourbaji, Slow Lights Full Length, and 2.5" SL Button

 

**YES, you can donate more than once!**

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are A Place In Time and we are an independent three-piece band from Washington DC. The band currently consists of Joel Vi Brittania (vocals/guitars), Danny Salsbury (vocals/guitars), and Caleb Dorsch (vocals/bass). 

After 4 independently released EPs, including the breakout "Not For Nothing" and subsequent "Take This To Heart," the band is finally ready to head into the studio to record our long awaited first full length effort. 

What We Need & What You Get

There is a lot more that goes into making an album than just the recording costs. An album also requires merchandising, distribution, and promotion in order to be successful. We have never been able to take on a project this large due to lack of funding, but the bottom line is, a full length album is the next logical progression in our growth as a band. 

The $6000 we are campaigning for is to help fund the creation, promotion and distribution of our first full length album. Here is a quick breakdown to show you where your money is going:

  • Cost of recording, mixing, and mastering $3000
  • Cost of two music videos to promote the album $1200
  • Album pressing and distribution $500
  • Cost of goods for perks $1000+
  • IndieGoGo Platform costs and Credit Card Fees $300+
In exchange for your support, we are offering exclusive items, some of which are only available through this campaign and are limited in number.
This experience is about our interaction with you and we want to hear your ideas so that we can best support you in supporting us. If there is a perk you want to see added, or have a suggestion, please feel free to contact us!

Exclusive Items


Perks


Risks & Challenges

Whether you've been following us since Not For Nothing or are a new fan, you probably know that this band has had its fair share of trials. We have never been more committed to a music project and we want this to get out to your beloved earholes as soon as possible. We will provide studio updates along the way to ensure you hear all news from us first. 

The biggest challenge we will have will be the length of time with which this project will take to complete. Perk fulfillment will begin once the album is completed and since there are only three of us and we have full time jobs/coursework, it will take some time to get all perk orders fulfilled. We appreciate the patience.

The album itself will take time. The material for the album is still going through the writing process but we expect to have all songs finished and recorded by the beginning of Fall. Post-production and distribution will take  two to four months. The goal is to have the album released by January 2017.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, share this campaign with everyone you know! Especially with people that like pop punk, easycore, and alt rock. You never know who could stumble upon us, just like you did! 
You can also help by sharing our music video for Perish the Thought. This will help bring people to our page and discover more about us.

story:
Après avoir trimballé ses parcelles de vie sur les scènes de campagne jusqu'à la métropole, les voilà enfin gravées sur disque, mais vêtues cette fois de leurs plus beaux atours; habillées par l'esprit créateur du réalisateur rimouskois Antoine Létourneau-Berger (Talfast, L'œil et le monocle) grâce à de brillantes étoffes musicales bonifiant l'univers unique de Marilie. Le résultat? Une plume habile, des mélodies inventives et une voix maîtrisée, vêtues des habits du dimanche d'une facture orchestrale aux accents d'Europe de l'Est, de big band des années 30 et de chansons françaises.

Cet opus, La demoiselle aux papillons, est un produit 100 % bas-laurentien. Outre le génie multi-instrumentiste de Létourneau-Berger, Marilie s'est entourée de sa complice Emmanuella Razgui-Alain au violoncelle et à la contrebasse, de Raphaël Arsenault au violon, et de Pierre-Alexandre Bergeron au trombone.

avoir trimballé ses parcelles de vie sur les scènes de campagne jusqu'à la
métropole, les voilà enfin gravées sur disque, mais vêtues cette fois de leurs plus
beaux atours; habillées par l'esprit créateur du réalisateur rimouskois Antoine
Létourneau-Berger (Talfast, L'œil et le monocle) grâce à de brillantes étoffes
musicales bonifiant l'univers unique de Marilie. Le résultat? Une plume habile,
des mélodies inventives et une voix maîtrisée, vêtues des habits du dimanche
d'une facture orchestrale aux accents d'Europe de l'Est, de big band des années 30 et de chansons
françaises.
Cet
opus, La demoiselle aux papillons, est
un produit 100 % bas-laurentien. Outre le génie multi-instrumentiste de
Létourneau-Berger, Marilie s'est entourée de sa complice Emmanuella
Razgui-Alain au violoncelle et à la contrebasse, de Raphaël Arsenault au
violon, et de Pierre-Alexandre Bergeron au trombone.

story:
Wow! This album means so much to me! It's like watching a child grow and develop into maturity. "Said And Heard" is a 5-track EP designed to encapsulate every emotion in the duality of relationships.  Beginning with the tease of infatuation and the fear that comes with it, to falling in love, then losing love but overcoming the pain and remaining positive and able to sincerely wish the best for the other.

My Story-

My name is Derek Bohl and I grew up on a farm ouside a typical small town in Kansas. I have been singing from the moment I could make noises as a baby, and have always been fascinated by the sounds of music and voice.  Picking up a guitar for the first time at age 14, it immediately became an extension of my self. I was consumed by the beautifully intricate sounds and it could create. What a wonderful experience!  After graduating high school I moved to Lubbock, Texas to pursue a degree in commercial music from South Plains College. Never would I have imagined that in two short years, I would bring my first album to life!   Playing music has been a passion and dream of mine since I was 11 years old, and now I have the chance to make it a reality! I would love for you join me on this journey.    

The making of "Said And Heard"- 

I have worked for a year and a half to bring these little stories to life and I'm so excited to share them with you. This process of writing, perfecting, recording, and collaborating with so many awesome people along the way has really brought me out of my shell and taught me how to just live in the moment and love people despite our differences. Now is the time to get this beautiful piece of art out of the nest and let it fly!  With your contributions you will be a part of it! 

Here is a breakdown of how your donations will be used:

Step 1- Mixing and Mastering 

Now that the album is finished being recorded, it's time to mix and master so it sounds great on all devices. To do it well, I'm sending it off to a really great friend as well as mixing engineer based in Austin, TX to put the finishing touches on it. After that, it goes to New York City to be mastered for Radio, iTunes etc. 

Step 2- Physical and Digital Copies 

Once we get it back from NYC, it goes into production for actual CD's. I want this EP to be as memorable and long lasting for you as it is and has been for me. I have chosen the best quality packaging because the art truly deserves it. More importantly, YOU deserve the best I can offer.  

Step 3- Marketing, Promotions and Merchandise

After the technical part is finished, the fun begins! We will have T-shirts, USB thumb drives with exclusive content, handmade guitar string bracelets and other exciting merchandise created. We will be sharing these things and more with those of you who help this dream become a reality. I know it's a lot to ask, but we can do it!  If we can make the $7000 goal, I can get more merchandise at a better price, and the more we can get at a time means the more you can get as well!!

Thank you for your support and help in this endeavor. It means the world to me!


God Bless.

-Derek Bohl

story:
Kaos Skola Festival 22.+23. July 2016
Horn - Sweden A few words about the next Kaos Skola Festival :) All of those who joined us last year, have an idea of what to expect already, but we are hoping to see many new faces.

A bit about us: We are a small family, we live in the beautiful South of Sweden and we simply thought that we should use the freedom and space for something amazing and one of a kind, to bring creative people together and simply enjoy a good time. Music had to play a big role, it should be family-friendly, rather hyppyish, and some good food (100 % vegan) was on the plan…and that's exactly what we did. Our Expectations were totally topped, the Kaos Skola Festival 2015 was absolutely brilliant, wonderful and we can't resist repeating it.

All that not just for fun but for a good cause? Impossibe - nah…totally possible! We donated all profits to 2 charitable causes (an amazing 1200,-). And this will, of course, also be the case at the next festival. Maybe we can even top the amount? If you want to enter your organisation as a recipient of the profits, feel free to get in touch!

About the location: We have a yard of 5000 square meters, which offers a lot of space for many activities. It is quiet but not completely cut off. A 3 minute walk gets you to the lake for a nice swim.

Accommodation: Camping in our yard, on the neighbour's lawn, at the lake or in the forest. The choice is yours. We will also improve the sanitary facilities but please don't expect 5 stars ;)

Also: Dogs will be present, be prepared.

And: Kids until 12 yrs are free!


                                                          *** Music ***

 *** MATZE ROSSI *** JAWKNEE MUSIC *** TIGERYOUTH *** JOHN ALLEN*** KINGA DULA *** MARCEL GEIN *** MATES *** AND:I *** CHAPLIN *** ANDREAS LIEBERT *** CATCH: firefly *** NICOLE CARTER CASH *** STEVEN& STANLEY *** FREDDY FUDD PUCKER  *** PLANTYOGI *** PHIL HUTZON *** *** BEN BARRITT *** HERR LEHMANN ***ANDISOLO *** How I left *** ADOLFINA FUCK ***

Kaos Skola Festival 22.+23. Juli 2016
 Horn - Sweden

... ein paar Worte zum nächsten Kaos Skola Festival :) Diejenigen, die letztes Jahr dabei waren wissen ja schon in etwa was es zu erwarten gibt, wir hoffen aber auch auf viele neue Gesichter.

Erstmal zu uns: Wir sind eine kleine Familie, wohnen im schönen Südschweden und haben uns irgendwann gedacht, dass man das Stückchen Freiheit und Platz nutzen sollte um was Verrücktes zu tun, interessante kreative Menschen zusammen zu bringen und einfach eine gute Zeit zu verleben. *** Musik *** sollte eine grosse Rolle spielen, es sollte familienfreundlich sein, eher hippiemässig, noch dazu war gutes Essen geplant ( 100% vegan )... tja, also haben wir das einfach mal gemacht, unsere Erwartungen wurden auch noch total übertroffen, das Kaos Skola Festival 2015 war absolut genial, wunderschön und wir können garnicht anders als es zu wiederholen.

Und dann noch was Gutes tun? Geht nicht- klar, geht! Wir haben im letzten Jahr den kompletten Gewinn an 2 gemeinnützige Vereine gespendet ( immerhin 1200,- ), das wird auch dieses Jahr der Fall sein, und vielleicht wird es dann ja auch ein wenig mehr. Vereine dürfen sich auch gerne bei uns melden, für dieses Jahr sind noch nicht alle Begünstigten ausgewählt.

Zur Umgebung: Wir haben ein Grundstück von 5000qm2 was auf jeden Fall Platz für einige Aktivitäten lässt, es ist ruhig gelegen, aber nicht völlig abgeschieden, in 3 Minuten ist man beim See wo man wundervoll baden kann.

Unterbringung: Entweder auf unserem Grundstück oder auf Nachbars Weide zelten ist möglich, man kann auch am See zelten oder im Wald, das steht jedem frei. Wir werden auch die sanitären Anlagen etwas verbessern, man darf aber dennoch keine 5 Sterne erwarten ;)

Sonst: es werden einige Hunde anwesend sein, da muss man mit zurecht kommen :)
Und übrigens: Kinder bis 12 Jahre feiern umsonst mit!

story:
To Sum Things Up

For those of you who may not know me, my name is Tricia Wolf. I came to own MAD PLAID MUSIC through unfortunate circumstances. As they say - when life hands you lemons, make lemonade!

  • Small businesses are the fabric that America is made of. Sadly, many struggle to stay stay alive. Local, family-owned music stores are a dying breed. Fortunately, Antioch is a community blessed enough to have a music store right on Main Street in the downtown business district. Our music store provides lessons to close to 200 students per week. We provide the rental instruments for the local band programs. We also have a retail shop and consignment sales, as well as repair services for instruments. We are your one-stop-shop for all of your musical needs.
  • Our goal is to expand our product lines to have on-hand inventory of day-to-day items (such as guitar strings and accessories and band accessories) as well as major purchase items such as guitars, amplifiers and digital pianos. We are looking to expand our current guitar line and digital piano line and to add on a supplier for amplifiers and drum products! You can be a part of that!

Our goal is to be able to have you walk out with the product you came in for!

 

What We Need & What You Get

To break it down:

  • As I've mentioned we need a paint job - both exterior paint as well as the basement area where the lesson rooms are - AND our bathroom needs some work as well!
  • Our product line needs expansion! Drums, amps, guitars ... and how awesome would it be to have a few band instruments for sale on the wall? Most of the vendors that we work with have what they call a "minimum buy in" for example, the amp line we are looking at has a buy in of $4000 (that's just to get my foot in the door with them.) My one guitar line had a buy in of $2500, several other vendors buy in amounts are $600, $800, etc. - all just so I can place a beginning order so I can carry their products.

What do you get for helping? Aside from the satisfaction of supporting a small business, you also get recognition within the store in the form of either a music themed plaque or crystal star award and a personalized thank you from MAD PLAID MUSIC.

 

The Impact

While it may not seem like much - a facelift to the store is essential. The new paint job and carpeting (which is imperative at this point) while go a long way to improve the esthetics of the store. It is always nicer to shop in a store that is pleasing to the senses.

We are also looking to improve lesson rooms with better sound-proofing materials, update some of the products used in the lesson rooms, and update the carpeting and furniture in the waiting room area. We would also like to increase the size of the waiting room and create a large group practice room!

Risks & Challenges

It has been an uphill battle from the start - and we continue to fight. Aside from fighting Big Box stores, online shopping sites and the economy in general - we are also fighting a legal battle.  We are doing all that we can to remain open to continue to provide our community and the surrounding communities with music lessons, rental programs for the local school districts and retail products for your convenience.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in making an impact but cannot contribute financially there are other ways you can help. Please contact MAD PLAID MUSIC to find out how you can make a difference.

 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Shape of Music is in the Hands of our Youth

My name is Scott Johnson and I am a high school teacher from Barrie,Ontario Canada.

Last May I organized a DJ & Turntable workshop for students in my Media Arts courses.   

What I expected was a fun and unique way for my students to explore the origins of music that we know today as Hip Hop, House, Breakbeat, Rap, EDM, etc.   It was a blast!  The students had a great time!

Something else happened too…

The students who usually struggled in class were the most engaged!  They became the leaders of the room! As I watched, their CONFIDENCE GREW, they were PROUD OF THEIR WORK!

I want to provide a space for these students to THRIVE.  Through the art of the DJ and Turntablism, I want to provide a fun and dynamic environment for these students while at the same time keeping them busy when they're not in school.  

We've got the curriculum, amazingly talented instructors, and a great downtown location.  What we need now is the equipment.  With your donation, we will be able to provide turntables, mixers, controllers, and headphones for our students.  

Help us EMPOWER our city's youth.  Help us put the music back in their hands.

story:
Our Goal

We aim to record Qualia in September 2016. Recording can be a very demanding process that requires a lot of different stages. From studio time, mixing and mastering  to printing and designing the album, in order to achieve our creative goals, there is a line of people working for this project and this is your chance to be a part of our team!

Reaching our goal in our Indiegogo campaign would provide the necessary funds for a high quality production and guarantee releasing Qualia by the end of 2016.

For more info about Terry visit: http://artistecard.co/TerryVakirtzoglou#!/bio


Qualia

Qualia are the sensations we are conscious of. They are often referred to as the phenomenal properties of experience and experiences that have qualia are referred to as being phenomenally conscious.
 

The qualia problem has to do with the communication of feelings. How can someone describe green to a colorblind person? Which is the same as the problem of the self. The person who experiences the qualia can reflect on their qualia. There's is a subjective experience of experiencing them and a peculiar solipsistic quality to it.

Those two problems are like the two sides of a coin. You cannot understand one without simultaneously understanding  other. It is uniquely human to have the sense of self, the sense of a future and the self being able to inspect the information coming in. 
We create mental representations of the representations, which allows us to manipulate symbols internally in our heads and intimately lead to things like... meaning.

V.S Ramachandran



·  " ..one of the central questions of our existence , How do subjective feelings/How does consciousness enter into the world? Through your head is obviously the answer. But that answer is not very helpful. What about the brain inside your head that makes you conscious of colors, of pain and pleasure, of the past and the future, of yourself and of others?"

·  "On the one hand there is the brain the most complex object in the known universe, a material thing subject to the laws of physics. On the other hand is the world of awareness , of the sights and sounds of life , of fear and anger , of lust , love and ennui. "

Christof Koch



Recorded & Mixed by Duke DeLuca, Created & Directed by Katerina Zoupanou
Cinematography & Editing by Jay Simms,"Extra Hands": Vassilea Terzaki

 

Qualia  is  Terry's debut album. It is an attempt to communicate feelings and states of awareness that people may experience through their life line.  Each song has an emotional landscape mirroring reality at that time.

The album consists of 9 original songs and one cover. It was composed and  inspired by life between New York and Athens. 

The recording will take place in Athens, Greece this upcoming September and will include a set up of guitar, keyboards and piano, double bass, drums as well as backing vocals and  guest musicians in 2 of the tracks.



                       Our team

Nothing would be possible if it wasn't for this group of extraordinary individuals. Creating an album from scratch, is a challenging task which demands hard work, persistence, team spirit and of course creativity on many levels. 

Terrys' band is a formation of exceptional musicians all very talented and established in their own field: Thodoris Kotsifas on guitar, Yiannis Papadopoulos on piano, Kostas Konstantinou on bass and Dimitris Klonis on drums. Having those musicians in the record is one of the most important parts of the project that determines the final sound and brings our music to another level.

               Risks & Challenges

Being an independent artist can be very challenging and there are many obstacles to overcome in order to  be able to exist and create.  Greece's financial crisis of the last years is definitely one of them but at the same time  it increases the need for expressiveness  and existence of original projects even more.

Raising 9.000$ will guarantee  recording  Qualia and will cover all the necessary expenses needed throughout the whole process of the production of the album.


          Other Ways You Can Help

You can always contribute by sharing our video and Indiegogo Campaign with your friends. Spread the word and help us cut a record!!!


              Special Thank You's:

Damian Aronidis:  For directing and filming our Indiegogo Campaign video as well for the technical support.

"Spiti Art Bar": For hosting us during the shooting of this video.

Theis and Natalia: For practical and ethical support during the whole process of producing the campaign.

Ioanna Zouli: For photo capturing the project .

Katerina Zoupanou, Jay Simms,  Duke Deluca and Vaseilia Terzaki: For making "I Wish I  Knew How It Would Feel To Be Free" and setting the start line.

 

             




Connect with Terry via :

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Terry-Vakirtzoglou108286402568745/

Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzylYEIX7f5WOeU49p5wK2w

Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/terry_vakirtzoglou/?h...

hand there is the brain the most complex object in the known universe, a
material thing subject to the laws of physics. On the other hand is the world
of awareness , of the sights and sounds of life , of fear and anger , of lust ,
love and ennui. "
Christof Koch



Recorded & Mixed by Duke
DeLuca, Created & Directed by Katerina Zoupanou
Cinematography & Editing by Jay Simms,"Extra Hands": Vassilea
Terzaki
  
Qualia  is  Terry's debut album. It is an attempt to communicate feelings and states of awareness that people may experience through their life line.  Each song
has an emotional landscape mirroring reality at that time.
The album consists of 9 original songs and one
cover. It was composed and  inspired by life between New York and Athens. 
The recording will take place in Athens, Greece this upcoming September
and will include a set up of guitar, keyboards and piano, double bass, drums as
well as backing vocals and  guest musicians in 2 of the
tracks. 



                       Our team
Nothing would be possible
if it wasn't for this group of extraordinary individuals. Creating
an album from scratch, is a challenging task which demands hard work,
persistence, team spirit and of course creativity on many levels.  Terrys' band is a formation of
exceptional musicians all very talented and established in their own field: Thodoris Kotsifas on guitar, Yiannis Papadopoulos on piano,
Kostas Konstantinou on bass and Dimitris Klonis on drums. Having those
musicians in the record is one of the most important parts of the project that
determines the final sound and brings our music to another level.                Risks & Challenges
Being an independent artist can be very challenging and there are many obstacles to overcome in
order to  be able to exist and create.  Greece's financial
crisis of the last years is definitely one of them but at the same time  it increases the need for expressiveness  and existence of original projects even more.
Raising 9.000$ will
guarantee  recording  Qualia and will cover all the necessary expenses
needed throughout the whole process of the production of the album. 

          Other Ways You Can Help
You can always
contribute by sharing our video and Indiegogo Campaign with your friends.
Spread the word and help us cut a record!!! 



              Special Thank You's:
Damian Aronidis:  For directing and filming our
Indiegogo Campaign video as well for the technical support.
"Spiti Art Bar": For hosting us during the shooting of this video. 
Theis and
Natalia:
For practical and ethical support during the whole process of producing the
campaign.
Ioanna Zouli: For photo capturing the project . 
Katerina Zoupanou, Jay
Simms,  Duke Deluca and Vaseilia Terzaki: For making "I Wish I  Knew How It
Would Feel To Be Free" and setting the start line. 
  
              



Connect with Terry via : 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Terry-Vakirtzoglou108286402568745/
Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzylYEIX7f5WOeU49p5wK2w
Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/terry_vakirtzoglou/?h...

story:
Hello!

This is Julia Barbie, Alicia Sky's manager.  The past 6 months of working with Alicia have been an exciting and never ending journey - one we are so excited to bring you along for.  The video above will take you behind the scenes and give you a glimpse of all of the incredible things Alicia has been working on.  You will hear previews of her new music, and view some exclusive studio and live footage.

Working in the studio until 5 A.M. is only a glimpse of what we've been up to.  With the proper resources, we would be able to market Alicia and her album, and let the world truly see the incredible talent that she brings. Her passion pours into her infectious music. 

We need to raise at least $10,000.  It will go towards the cost of production, marketing and PR.  The more publicity the album gets, the higher chance of her music topping the Billboard charts. To make this a reality we need your help. 

"This is my 9th year since moving to LA to pursue my music and I'm finally completing my first industry standard album. I'm so proud of this collection.  It's a journey through my life full of emotions and experiences brought out by the catchiest of pop melodies. I've poured my heart into this work and am excited to share it with the world. I'm more determined than ever to make this my full time career. With the right PR, the door of mega success is now a huge possibility."  - Alicia 

Rewards

For your contributions, we will send you exclusive rewards such as a limited edition t-shirt designed by Alicia, signed artwork from the album cover, early downloads of new songs from the album, spending the day in Venice, a one on one singing/songwriting session, and much more. 

*If you live in LA and contribute a minimum of $250, you'll be invited to an exclusive, red carpet album launch party. 


Past projects: 


(The video above was funded by a previous indiegogo campaign.)


Follow Alicia

Facebook.com/aliciaskymusic
Instagram.com/aliciaskymusic
Soundcloud.com/aliciasky
Youtube.com/aliciaskymusic
Twitter.com/aliciaskymusic
www.aliciasky.com

Be a part of our journey 

Other ways you can help: 

  • Share this campaign with your friends 
  • Download Alicia's songs on iTunes. 

Thank you so much for your support & generosity!

story:
In a nutshell

Many of you know me as Katie Colpitts and some of you may know me as Katie Cash. I am a native San Francisco Bay Area musician and have passionately dedicated my life to pursuing the things that I love most; writing, playing and performing music.  Over the years I have worked on and released several albums with my rock bands but now it's time for me to release my first solo album.
While this record is a solo project, it is strongly based in community.  Staying true to my original vision, I have already started working with several different artists, musicians and engineers to help bring this album to life.
The vision of this project started several years ago.  I began working on recordings and demos with various members of my Bay Area musical community to piece together a body of work.  In 2012, I put this project on hold after deciding to go back to school to study music composition at Mills College.  While at Mills, I had the great privilege of studying with the extraordinarily brilliant music department: Maggi Payne, Dr. Nalini Ghuman, Chris Brown, John Bischoff, James Fei, Daniel Schmidt, and in my final semester, an independent study with Fred Frith.  Through my study with Fred, I focused on this album and was able to develop my vision in terms of composition, arrangement, and overall scope. 
Once I felt my body of work was strong enough to present to my ideal choice of producer, I set the wheels in motion to take the next steps toward realizing this dream.
I am honored, excited and humbled to have Julie Wolf, of Julie Wolf Music, producing this record and to be tracking with Adam Muñoz at Fantasy Studios in Berkeley, CA.
With your help, I can continue moving forward with pre production and start getting some dates on the calendar with Fantasy Studios to track the record. The entire project will be possible with donations and support from all of you!  
 

Breakdown

I am raising $28,000 to go directly into this project.

Here is a breakdown of exactly where the funds will be going:

Producer, Musicians, Studio (Tracking/Overdubs/Editing/Mixing/Mastering):  $27,925

Piano Tuning: $150

Pressing (Vinyl/CDs): $3700

Digital Distribution: $100

Campaign Video/Gear: $1500

You might be thinking that this total is larger than what I am trying to raise in this campaign, and you're right. I have already received a generous donation of $5000 toward my project!

I'm really excited about some of the perks and exclusives I am able to offer as part of the campaign. Limited edition colored vinyl, VIP tickets to the record release show, and downloads of the album before it's released are just a few items that are up for grabs!

We are aiming to track in May/June and release the record in Fall/Winter of 2016. Turn around time for vinyl is about 16 weeks at this point, so that is why the official release will drop so many months after tracking the record.


A Dream Come True

This project holds a very special place in my heart.  I have worked hard and diligently over the years to support my musical career and to grow as a musician every day.  I have had the incredible opportunity to work with such a diverse group of talented artists and I am honored to be supported by such an incomparable team and community.  This project is an extension of myself and an expression of my gratitude for everyone that has ever supported independent artists.


You can help just by sharing this campaign!

Even if you are not in a position to donate, sharing this campaign with anyone you think might be interested or sharing the link on social media would be a HUGE help!
You can use IndieGoGo's share tools to help spread the word. 

Thank you for all of your consideration and support!


Recognition & Credits:

Campaign Video by: Sara St. Martin Lynne

Campaign Video Photos by:
Elisa Graziani
Ana Elena Hernández
Aaron Ramirez
Charlie Stephens
Val DiGiacinto
Lauren Deardorff
Eden B Jones
Miikka Skaffari
Don Albonico
Shae Rocco
Peter Whitfield

Campaign Video Footage by:
Sara St. Martin Lynne
Ana Elena Hernández
Anthony Albert
Mills College X Sound Festival Archive

Fundraising and Grant Guru: Rae Davis

story:
I am an 18-year old recording artist residing in the city of Boston, Massachusetts devoted to the mission of creating a better world through my music. I have been working relentlessly for over 7 years now. Throughout my career, I have experienced much success, but have also met and learned from a handful of failures. Currently, I am solidifying my musical brand while simultaneously attending college at Bridgewater State University for a degree in business marketing. My goal is to use music as a launching pad to do a lot of other great things for our culture. The vision has undoubtedly been coming to fruition at a gradual yet consistent pace. I have been featured on various publications such as The source and XXL magazine. My music video "Mind Control" was added to MTV's rotation list and aired multiple times throughout 2014. I have performed at the SXSW festival in Austin, TX and performed in front of crowds of ovee 2,000 people. My music has reached millions of ears throughout the world and the fan base I have garnered is one that believes in my vision just as much as I do. Nonetheless, these accolades are only a starting point for the way in which I plan to impact our culture. If you believe the world can improve even in the slightest, then youre supporter of this cause.

The money donated will be used to record, promote, and distribute a full length studio album titled "Complex Simplicity". The purpose behind this album is to promote a positive message throughout hip-hop and pop culture.

- $5,000 will be used to record, mix and master the album.

- The remaining $5,000 will be used to shoot music videos, print physical copies, and market the project.

Thank you to all who sponsor this project.

story:
Karlo Bartolec je mladi pjevač iz Karlovca u suradnji sa kantautorom i skladateljem Ivanom Dvornekovićem; želi preko svojih fanova prikupiti novac za svoj prvi samostalni album. U nadi za što boljom suradnjom sa fanovima, Karlo će napraviti album od sedam pjesama sa vrhunskom produkcijom u studiju Šišmiš u Velikoj Gorici gdje su snimali Oliver Dragojević, Gibonni, Severina itd.. Aranžer će biti gospodin Dražen Pavin, dobitnik porina za pjesmu Vranac koju izvode Najbolji Hrvatski Tabmuraši, osnivač benda duhovne glazbe Emanuel i koji je danas najbolji hrvatski band u tome žanru. Gitaru, bubanj, bass i klavir će svirati profesionalni studijski glazbenici. 


 Karlo treba Vašu pomoć, sa jednostavnim doniranjem od 5 ili više dolara pomažete našem cilju, a time automatski kupujete digitalni album koji će izaći kad bude završen.
Mi ovo radimo jer želimo da Karlo uspije. To nam je cilj, ništa drugo.
Hvala, Vaš Ivan Dvorneković i Karlo Bartolec.


'

story:
Hello friends, Rentheads and people with excellent taste,

Firstly, thanks for getting this far. If you've sat through my video (recorded late at night after a long day of rehearsals so apologies for the 12 o'clock shadow), then you know I'm in need of your help. I've written a brand new album and I would love you to be part of the process of releasing it with me. 

Making an album is expensive. The money you pledge will go to pay for studio time, musicians fees, artwork, pressing albums and promoting it properly. Any additional funds raised will increase my promotion and advertising budget. 

You're not giving money for nothing and tricks for free! I've got all sorts of fun things to do in exchange for your much appreciated cash. We could have champagne on the London Eye together (I've always wanted to go), go for cocktails at the Groucho (the start of a beautiful friendship), I can write a song for your missus, or I can create a ringtone for you doing my best Michael McDonald impression. If you pledge, you can get your hands on the album before it hits the public domain and you'll be a real part of it. 

Thank you, thank you for your help.

Damien xx

story:
The Palouse community had nothing but wheat fields and a massive university before Kazzufest Music & Arts Festival. With the passion for sharing music and art Kazzufest was birthed by Sasha Gonzalez Festival Manager and Jasmine Albertson Co-Founder to create a space in the Pullman community where artists alike could showcase their works.

So we started Kazzufest, our aim is to showcase musical talent and give the community members of the Palouse a platform to celebrate the arts together. But we can't do it alone...funding falls 110% on our shoulders, but with your help we can continue to be in the Palouse for years to come. Your donations will help put on Kazzufest and continue to be a community where music and visual artists alike can show their works.

story:
Namaste, y'all!

Kiki here, from Spiral Rhythm.  For about ten years, now, Kerri and I have had a pet project, one near and dear to our hearts.  We want to make a lullaby CD.  Some recent time in the studio working on a piece for another project has us all fired up and ready to record.

Both of us enjoy singing to our children and could (and still can) be heard crooning to them before bed or when they needed a little extra comfort.

Over the years I have written songs for my kids and for this project, and Kerri has been unstinting with her inspiration and artwork.  

By contributing to our campaign, you'll help us spread our music, our art, in ever-widening ripples as well as help a coupe of singers realize a cherished dream.

Recording ain't cheap!
We have a fantastic relationship with Root Cellar Music Studio and we want to continue working with Rob for this project.  Rob's an amazing fellow, passionate about music, recording, mixing, the whole magilla.  He's a real cheerleader and also a bit of a perfectionist, and he's well versed in many of the myriad ways to make and record music.  He also does this for a living, and while his rates are terrific we can't pay him on our own.  We absolutely want to do this right, and Rob and Root Cellar are part of that.

The funds we seek will go towards recording, recording, and more recording.  We will use them to pay for our studio time, mixing time, and everything that goes with mastering.  Funds raised will also pay for production and pressing of a quality CD in a jewel case with an insert.  It is possible that we could maybe order a pizza one time because recording is hungry work, but that will probably come out of our own pockets because, as I mentioned, recording ain't cheap (and we really don't want a cheap recording).

We feel perky!

We are offering a few perks to help our campaign along.  We may add to them as we think of more things we would like to offer as a "Thank you!" for supporting our campaign.  Check 'em out!

We have some super special stretch goals in mind if y'all get us beyond our goal, wink, wink.

Dream a little dream.

Your contribution means the world to us.  We love our community, and we love that so many of you have been insanely supportive of our band and our music.  We hope that the love we feel for our children, for our songs, and for our community will shine through on this CD.  We hope that our lullabies will make someone's night a little easier, help someone who can't sleep relax, find peace, and drift into pleasant dreaming.

We believe in crowd funding as a way to help launch projects like this, and our recent campaign to fund our latest band CD reinforced that belief.  With your support, we can make this CD happen, and we look forward to singing our butts off for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

It's not always about the dough!  We know how difficult it can be to help fund projects, and there are ways to help without breaking the bank.  Of course, even a dollar helps and we are thankful for every bit you can give, but you can also give us a boost by giving us a boost!  Share our campaign, and share it often.  Tell people about us.  Post on Facebook, e-mail our link, hire a sky-writer...although, really, if you can hire a sky-writer, how about just giving that money to us instead, eh?  

Crowd funding campaigns work best when the crowd shares, passing along a campaign like a wonderful hot potato full of creative goodness.  We appreciate every effort made to help us along.  

Smooches and blessed be!

Your contribution means the world to us.  We love our community, and we love that so many of you have been insanely supportive of our band and our music.  We hope that the love we feel for our children, for our songs, and for our community will shine through on this CD.  We hope that our lullabies will make someone's night a little easier, help someone who can't sleep relax, find peace, and drift into pleasant dreaming.We believe in crowd funding as a way to help launch projects like this, and our recent campaign to fund our latest band CD reinforced that belief.  With your support, we can make this CD happen, and we look forward to singing our butts off for you!

    Other Ways You Can Help It's not always about the dough!  We know how difficult it can be to help fund projects, and there are ways to help without breaking the bank.  Of course, even a dollar helps and we are thankful for every bit you can give, but you can also give us a boost by giving us a boost!  Share our campaign, and share it often.  Tell people about us.  Post on Facebook, e-mail our link, hire a sky-writer...although, really, if you can hire a sky-writer, how about just giving that money to us instead, eh?  Crowd funding campaigns work best when the crowd shares, passing along a campaign like a wonderful hot potato full of creative goodness.  We appreciate every effort made to help us along.  Smooches and blessed be!

story:
Hi, my name is Elizabeth Boaz. I'm 16 years old, and ever since I started performing five years ago, I've wanted to make an album. But first, I'll tell you about how we got to this. 

My parents are both musicians, and raised my sisters and I in a house of music, song, and harmony. I started writing songs when I was 10 years old, and began studying voice a year later. At age 11, I started to learn guitar and told my mom I wanted to sing. So the adventure began. From then on, it was open mics every week around Sonoma County until I started performing at restaurants, festivals, fundraisers- you get the idea. I distinctly remember telling my dad that performing allowed me to connect with anybody, to share what I love, and make people (myself included) feel alive. 

Creating an album has always an intangible dream; however, after five years of performing, I decided to turn this fantasy into a reality. Starting at the beginning of last August, I began to demo all of my songs -- recording them at home and deciding how I wanted them to sound in the studio. I spent my entirety of winter researching studios and sound engineers. By January, I had narrowed it down to 6 songs, and in February, YOU all voted for an album title. Suddenly, an EP album titled The Reason Why by Elizabeth Boaz was falling into place. 

I need $3000 to make this album: this covers the cost of studio time, musicians, album art, and CD distribution. It's a lot -- believe me -- but if everybody helps, it's a lot less. After receiving an overwhelming number of votes for the album title, I realized that I have a larger community around me than I've ever had, and that every single of you wants to help. There is no way that this album can be created without your generous donations, your support, and your uplifting encouragement.

Donate so you can be a part of the process of my first album, donate so you can get all the fun rewards that come with the campaign, and donate so you can be a part of something new and exciting. Whatever reason you have to support me, I am so appreciative and thankful everyday that there's such a wonderful community around me -- this album wouldn't be happening with you. So please, go donate... and help me make this long-awaited dream into a physical CD.

story:
Our Third & Largest Record (So Far)

Tempest & Rapture:  One part is rooted and raring in surreal folk and Southern gothic, the other is pronking out in psychedelic surf-dream wilderness. With a widened scope, The Deer are preparing to print our most dynamic, ambitious album yet on double vinyl LP and  CD. Recorded at four Austin studios, with two new singles and more on the way, we're eager to unleash this beast.

To do it justice, we're reaching out you guys - the people who will be turning along with the music this summer.

Preorder the Album & Then Some

You'll be the first to receive each new single, a signed CD or double vinyl record and full album download upon release, and all sorts of other extraordinary visual and auditory stimulants when you preorder. This includes, but isn't limited to:

  • The signed Double LP or CD, complete with lyrics, art, & downloads. Yes, we're signing the albums.

   

         

  • Friend Hats, Posters
 

  • Original cut Paper art from the album & mudras Grace made. There are several duplicates of each design, and they'll be mounted and framed when you get them. Specify your piece preference when you order. 
Small pieces are in the middle row, mediums are on the top and bottom rows.

  • Large Cut Paper figures used in the animation for our single Do Return. Limited numbers, will be mounted and framed.

  • Stained glass panels by Grace Park - Large, Medium, & Small

                   

         

(Above panel used in the animation)

  • And we'll even come play a concert, acoustic or electric, just for you & your friends at your house or place of choice. Yeah, that's right.

Now > Later

Your preorder is a direct contribution to this album's production, and we're extremely grateful for your support through this endeavor. It pays for:

  • High-quality vinyl records and CDs
  • Mixing, mastering, and marketing
  • Expulsion of roiling musical and artistic inertia!!

Ways To Help

  • For a moment, sit and listen to the new singles and visualize the record in its physical form.
  • Even a mention or share supports us immensely.
  • Show this campaign or this video to a friend, and enjoy!

We're thankful for your ears and your voice. Let's make some noise!!

story:
Hey there,

My name is Rebecca Zola, and my band is called Zolaband.  We play all original music that I write and arrange, and we perform in venues all over New York City and New England.  In February of 2016, we went into Room 17 Studios in Brooklyn to make our very first professionally recorded EP, and now we would like to release it and share it with all of you! "Before and After" is a set of five songs I wrote during a transitional period of my life, after I had lost my father to cancer, and was learning the immense value of relationships with the people I love. I would describe our musical style as indie folk-rock with improvisational aspects coming from my background in jazz.

The EP was a labor of massive amounts of time, work, and love. You'll hear me singing, Coleman Hughes on the trombone, Joe Vilardi on electric guitar, Nick Dunston playing the ukulele bass, and Connor Parks on the drum set.  The EP was recorded and mixed by Joe Rogers, and mastered by Coleman Hughes.

Why We Need Your Help

  • We need $3,000 to cover the costs of recording, engineering, mixing, mastering, paying the musicians fairly, licensing costs, album artwork, and making the physical CDs.
  • In exchange for your donation, you will have the opportunity to pre-order the EP signed by everyone in the band, as well as personalized prizes such as handwritten poetry, voice lessons or music tutoring, a private concert, free tickets to our shows, a Zolaband sweatshirt, producer credit, and more!
  • We really hope that you will consider being a part of our project, because we can only do this with your help!

story:
Vataga is a hip-hop duet from Daugavpils. Just a few years ago they were one of the most bright representatives of informal movement of their hometown, and whole Latvia.

We are one of those who were also part of that get-together, and today we want to do that no one before us did in Daugavpils. A big live Vataga’s concert – Vataga Live – with full of musicians, and another rap-performers of the past and the present!

The main & the most important idea – to gather together all of people of that time, that to pump people up with the quality music and positive energy, just like good old times, and to do it even better than before.

We believe that it is real. We KNOW it is real, because it is ALREADY HAPPENING. Due to the fact that Daugavpils has always been distinguished by the presence of sympathetic friends, acquaintances and good, selfless people, without whose help this event is unlikely to happen. We managed to find some of the best musicians of our city, most of which have long lived outside Latvia, but they will come specially for this event.

Nevertheless, we need YOUR help to make this a truly memorable concert.

We would like to address to those people, in the first case, who had to leave their homeland because of different reasons, and who had to look for better life outside Latvia; those, who still consider themselves an indigenous Daugavpils', who for whatever reason are not able to come to this concert, but would really like to be a part of this important project for us all. YOU CAN BECOME A PART of this unique event.

We don’t have any sponsors, we are organizing everything with our own abilities and means.  But, unfortunately, we have quite a bit short of funds needed to rent the unit to a concert was held in the best and memorable as possible level!

Even the minimum contribution on your part will help us a great support, and thus You will be a part of this great event for our favourite town!

We also understand, that maybe you are the one, who’s not interested at all with hip-hop/informal culture, music and etc. – but just as we’ve mentioned before, we believe that this world is not without kind people, and YOU are one of them!

PLEASE SUPPORT US – THAT IS IMPORTANT FOR ALL OF US!


Additionally you can support us by spreading the word out, like & share this campaign (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc.)........and Thank You in advance!



Vataga Live team


WWW.VATAGALIVE.INFO






.

story:
My name is Sarah Chapman, and I am the lead singer/songwriter for Ghost Cat Attack.  I have been making music, since childhood.  Starting on the piano and flute as a child, I  joined choir in high school and at 16 years old, I picked up the guitar.  My love of poetry and music made songwriting a natural fit, but it was years before I took my songs beyond the coffeehouse/open mic setting.  I spent my 20's modeling, acting and trying my hand at nearly every kind of "day-job" I thought I could stomach.  In 2014 I played a fictional pop-star for a play with the Black Theater Troupe.  After singing someone else's songs as if they were my own, I decided I didn't want to pretend anymore.  I had to admit that I had a whole album already written, just waiting to be born.  
In January of 2015, I set about finding a band to help bring my songs to life. I found them in the hotbed of talent that is the Arizona music scene at open mics and even on craigslist.  Eventually we formed as Ghost Cat Attack and played our first show in April of 2015.  After one year of playing out locally around Phoenix, Scottsdale and Tempe, Arizona, we have built up our fan-base and tightened up the songs.  Now, we are ready to put out a quality product and take this project to the next level.  We want to record an EP  that is radio worthy and get our songs out to the world.  This will allow us to start generating revenue and fund our first tour. 

Meet The Band:

Emmanuel Aube is a native of Normandy in France. He has played guitar since the age of 12 inspired by Brian May, Slash, The Doors, Jimmy Page, Hendrix...He made his first studio recording at the age 16 with a local metal band. Studied briefly at the conservatory & MAI in Nancy, France before he moved to Phoenix in 2008. He played with the JJ'S band for 4-5 years, as well as Hot Birds and the Chili Sauce, and now pursues his solo projects while he collaborates with various artists, such as Ghost Cat Attack.

Andrea Gudeyon began studying music at age six with formal piano lessons. Throughout her school years in Wisconsin, she learned every instrument she could get her hands on. At 17, she fell in love—with the bass. Shortly after, she started her first garage band and moved to Los Angeles to pursue the music dream. That dream was short, but opportunities led her to Phoenix where she studied audio production. She currently works as a sound engineer in theatre, studio recording and live events. She also plays bass with Jenny Jarnagin. Sarah invited Andrea to sit-in with Ghost Cat Attack in the fall of 2015 and they have been making music magic happen ever since.

Lou Perez is originally a New York native who has been living in Arizona about 11 years now. He fell in love with drums at the ripe old age of 8 and has been playing on and off since then, but more consistently over the past 8 years. His musical influences are diverse and he tries to incorporate many genres into his playing. With a background in Metal and Punk, Lou has expanded his skills to show a softer side in joining Ghost Cat Attack. 


This is our passion, our purpose, and lifelong dream.  I have an amazing band who are ready to follow me around the country playing my songs and helping me reach my goals.  It would mean everything if you could help make this dream a reality.  I believe you can.  

What We Need & What You Get


We are asking for $10,000 to cover 2-3 weeks of studio time, mixing, mastering, reproduction, distribution, PR, promotion, and tour support to get us on the road promoting this album and playing our hearts out for you.  This is what we want to be doing for a living, full time.  But we need the tools to build this business.  With your help, I know we can make this EP a huge success.
We have so many amazing perks for you from an advanced download of our first single for as little as a $5 contribution -to having us travel anywhere in the United States to play a private party for you and your friends and a whole lot of cool stuff in between.  I feel that the local music community here in Arizona has been huge in helping our band find it's groove and so we would like to give some perks with them in mind.  Such as:

  • One lucky donor will take home a painting of a Ghost Cat Attack painted by the very talented singer/songwriter/artist extraordinaire Hannah Bones (previously of Doctor Bones).  
  • 2 signed guitars, one of which was signed by Ghost Cat Attack (BIG THANKS TO BIZARRE GUITAR for the hookup!) and one of which has been autographed by all of the amazing artists who played our fundraiser show:  The Banter, Dirty Sunset, Ben Anderson, Carol Pacey & the Honey Shakers, Ghost Cat Attack, Japhy's Descent, Woodworks, Jeanne & the Beat, Hannah Bones, Manny Tripodis, Ronnie Winters, & Jess Pruitt.  This is a collectors item for any die-hard music fan. 
  • Several gift cards to local music venues, such as: Rogue Bar, Pho Cao, Terroir Wine Pub, Twisted Lizard and Stinkweeds record store.
  • 2 hours of practice time at Bomb Shelter Rehearsal Studio where GCA practices
  • 2 lessons with our guitar player Emmanuel Aube
  • A chance to be in the music video for our firs single.

With even half of our goal met ($5,000) we will still be able to get the songs recorded and released digitally, it will just take more time to get the songs out there to the fans.  We'll release the EP digitally on Bandcamp, Amazon, I-tunes & Spotify, etc... to fund the reproduction of physical CDs, and eventually a tour to support the EP beyond our local market.  We will continue with our grassroots approach, returning to the local radio stations and other social media outlets, and most of all word of mouth to promote this music.  Either way, we will have a quality product worth putting out there, even if we don't have the help of a publicist, PR firm or distribution company.

The Impact

I believe that music from the heart, feeds the heart.  This music is from my heart to yours.  It has come from growing up in Arizona, surrounded by the beauty of the desert & the madness of the music scene.  It has been inspired by the search for love, meaning and belonging.  I hope that it will bring you joy, or comfort, or perhaps just simply a release.
In preparation to launch this campaign, we put on a very successful fundraiser show with 8 other bands volunteering their services and raised over $400 towards this project in just one night!  This is a music community that believes in us and is ready to see us take the next step.  I hope you will join them in that belief and contribute to this album.
All 4 members of Ghost Cat Attack take this project very seriously and are ready to make it our full time job.  We see this campaign as a way to raise seed money for the business that is our band.  This investment, will allow us to create our product and give us the capital we need to get it off the ground. 

Risks & Challenges

This is our first time recording a project of this caliber and from recording to actually getting a finished product out, there are many things I am sure I will have to learn along the way.  But luckily I have the support of an amazing music community whose counsel and opinions I trust.  The night of our fundraiser show, we had a technical glitch in the first few minutes- and I realized I was blessed to have 3 different people I could call at the drop of a hat who could and would help just for that one sound issue. 
A wise man once said, "A rising tide lifts all boats" and I firmly believe that.  It is in our best interest to see this music community thrive, because it raises the bar.  Our success is your success and together we are all uplifted.  I have faith in the resources we have to draw on, in the wisdom of our friends that have gone before us, at this very exciting time in the Arizona music scene.  This album is going to ROCK!  


PLEASE NOTE:

If you can't contribute financially, YOU CAN STILL HELP!  Please tell others about this campaign, and use the share buttons for all your favorite social media sites.  Also, come to our next show, and bring a friend!  Get a free sticker at our next show and post it somewhere to spread the word about Ghost Cat Attack.  Then take a picture of your sticker and tag us on social media, like and share! :)
Thank you so much for having taken the time to check out our campaign and feel free to listen to the songs we recorded for free last year, on: www.soundcloud.com/ghostcatattack
