2 lessons with our guitar player Emmanuel Aube
A chance to be in the music video for our firs single. 

With even half of our goal met ($5,000) we will still be able to get the songs recorded and released digitally, it will just take more time to get the songs out there to the fans.  We'll release the EP digitally on Bandcamp, Amazon, I-tunes & Spotify, etc... to fund the reproduction of physical CDs, and eventually a tour to support the EP beyond our local market.  We will continue with our grassroots approach, returning to the local radio stations and other social media outlets, and most of all word of mouth to promote this music.  Either way, we will have a quality product worth putting out there, even if we don't have the help of a publicist, PR firm or distribution company.
   The Impact


I believe that music from the heart, feeds the heart.  This music is from my heart to yours.  It has come from growing up in Arizona, surrounded by the beauty of the desert & the madness of the music scene.  It has been inspired by the search for love, meaning and belonging.  I hope that it will bring you joy, or comfort, or perhaps just simply a release.
In preparation to launch this campaign, we put on a very successful fundraiser show with 8 other bands volunteering their services and raised over $400 towards this project in just one night!  This is a music community that believes in us and is ready to see us take the next step.  I hope you will join them in that belief and contribute to this album.
All 4 members of Ghost Cat Attack take this project very seriously and are ready to make it our full time job.  We see this campaign as a way to raise seed money for the business that is our band.  This investment, will allow us to create our product and give us the capital we need to get it off the ground. 
   Risks & Challenges
This is our first time recording a project of this caliber and from recording to actually getting a finished product out, there are many things I am sure I will have to learn along the way.  But luckily I have the support of an amazing music community whose counsel and opinions I trust.  The night of our fundraiser show, we had a technical glitch in the first few minutes- and I realized I was blessed to have 3 different people I could call at the drop of a hat who could and would help just for that one sound issue. 
A wise man once said, "A rising tide lifts all boats" and I firmly believe that.  It is in our best interest to see this music community thrive, because it raises the bar.  Our success is your success and together we are all uplifted.  I have faith in the resources we have to draw on, in the wisdom of our friends that have gone before us, at this very exciting time in the Arizona music scene.  This album is going to ROCK!     
PLEASE NOTE:
If you can't contribute financially, YOU CAN STILL HELP!  Please tell others about this campaign, and use the share buttons for all your favorite social media sites.  Also, come to our next show, and bring a friend!  Get a free sticker at our next show and post it somewhere to spread the word about Ghost Cat Attack.  Then take a picture of your sticker and tag us on social media, like and share! :)

Thank you so much for having taken the time to check out our campaign and feel free to listen to the songs we recorded for free last year, on: www.soundcloud.com/ghostcatattack

story:
Hi, this is George Gee – bandleader of The George Gee Swing Orchestra here in NYC.  I’ve been known to preach about how #SwingMakesYouHappy to whomever may be within listening radius plus the many captive audiences at our countless shows!  So much so, it’s also the title of our recent CD recording (which was on the short list for a Grammy nomination plus 12 straight weeks on the Jazz radio charts)!

2017 marks our 20th anniversary of performing weekly at SWING46 Jazz & Supper Club located in the heart of NYC on Restaurant Row in Times Square.  Big Band swingin’ for the both the local and international swing dance community supplemented by jazz music lovers and worldwide tourists – this little club that could - has withstood multiple trial and tribulations to be the last one standing (in the WORLD)!

A regular patron we were privileged to entertain on the SWING46 dance floor was the late, great Frankie Manning (the legendary original Savoy Ballroom dancer).  Frankie always claimed The George Gee Swing Orchestra was his favorite modern swing orchestra and personally requested for us to perform at many of his numerous birthday celebrations.  After his unexpected sudden passing right before his 95th birthday, we help maintain the flame by carrying on at that poignant event and then again at his centennial two years ago.

On May 24th, (2 days before Frankie’s actual May 26th birthdate) – we will be swingin’ hard in honor of Frankie102 at our regular Tuesday night Big Band Swing Party at SWING46.  Playing many of Frankie’s musical and danceable favorites (Shiny Stockings, Splanky, Tuxedo Junction, Hard Times, Lets Get Together, Things Ain’t What They Used To Be, Easy Does It, Take the A Train, Christopher Columbus, Wednesday Night Hop and more...) – we will record this sure-to-be magical night of music and dance for posterity.  And after nearly two decades of providing the world a place to swing 7-nights-week – we feel it is time for the FIRST “Live at SWING46” recording!

This project has the full support of The Frankie Manning Foundation and a part of the proceeds from pre-sales and contributions will be donated to The Frankie Manning Foundation to continue in their pursuit of advancing the legacy of Frankie Manning, Big Band music and Lindy Hop.

The budget will cover the cost of the musical performance of the 10 musicians, onsite professional  20 track remote LIVE recording, post-production mixing/mastering, graphic design, special musical arrangements and CD duplication.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration for this creative effort.  It is our goal to continue spreading the joy of big band music and lindy hop - exactly the way Frankie shared with us.........


Musically,

George Gee

George Gee Swing Orchestra

SWING46 Jazz & Supper Club

Frankie Manning Foundation

You Should Be Dancing Studios

Band members of The George Gee Swing Orchestra scheduled to be performing at this LIVE recording at SWING46 on Tuesday, May 24th, 2016 include:

David Gibson - trombone and music director

Ed Pazant - alto saxophone

Michael Hashim - tenor saxophone

Tony Lustig - baritone saxophone

Freddie Hendrix - trumpet

Tatum Greenblatt - trumpet

Steve Einerson - piano

Marcus McLaurine - string bass

Brian Fishler - drums

TO FRANKIE, WITH LOVE!

story:
WHO I AM

My name is Jonas Woods.  I'm a full time touring Christian recording artist, producer, worship team development consultant, worship leader, and speaker.  I tour full time coast to coast and overseas with my amazing wife Becky and two boys Hunter (9) and Liam (6).  Becky sings with me and speaks on occasion.  I've been in the music industry now for almost 15 years.  It's been a crazy journey so far with plenty of mountains and valleys along the way.  My last record "TALES OF THE BITTERSWEET" chronicled some of our struggles and victories that my wife Becky and I endured during the writing and recording of that album.  Becky's diagnosis with stage 4 cancer made every part of that album special.  I've never been so pleased with what was achieved through that creative time. Utilizing my friends Paul Colman, Jeremy Michael, AJ Sanchez, Claas Jambor, Jonathan Thatcher, and Lisa McKenzie we were able to put out something that I am extremely proud of.  

Now it's time to do it again! I'm honored that so many have found solace and comfort in my lyrics.  It truly makes what I do worth it.  We are in this to instill hope, to show love, and to demonstrate through our lives, the amazing Love of Jesus. 

THE NEXT BIG STEP

Becky and I discovered over the last few years that our mission, if you will, is unique in that we don't feel the pressure to be on the radio, on the tv, or in print.  With that being said we're working towards those goals as they are a part of the industry that we work in.  However, having the freedom to share from our hearts, to create uniquely designed concerts and worship services, and being able to speak and perform at various events keeps us busy.  As hard as it has been for us to grasp, we've felt now for a few years that we were being propelled into a sort of, musical mission.  We've all but refrained from calling ourselves musical missionaries.  Yes, we perform covers like "FIRE and RAIN" by James Taylor and play the blues, and sing love songs but our ultimate goal is to leave people with a better understanding of who they are as a child of the Creator!  Super exciting stuff.  

 

THIS IS WHAT IT'S FOR

THE WRITING PROCESS AND RECORDING OF THE NEXT JONAS WOODS FULL ALBUM WITH ALL IT'S BELLS AND WHISTLES.  

WHAT THE FUNDS ARE FOR MORE SPECIFICALLY

HERE'S WHAT THE MONEY IS GOING TO BE USED FOR:

  • 2 TO 3 WEEKS OF WRITING WITH PROFESSIONAL WRITERS IN NASHVILLE
  • RECORDING DEMOS WITH OLD BEAR STUDIOS AND THE TEAM 
  • PAYING FOR THE STUDIO TIME TO RECORD DEMOS
  • THE STUDIO FOR RECORDING THE STUDIO MUSICIANS IE, ELECTRIC GUITAR, BASS, DRUMS, KEYS, PADS, SMALL HORN SECTION ETC.
  • PAYING THE STUDIO MUSICIANS
  • THE CHOIR
  • RECORDING VOCALS AND ACOUSTIC GUITAR
  • MIXING THE RECORD AT FEDORA STUDIOS WITH JEREMY MICHAEL
  • SENDING THE ALBUM OUT TO BE MASTERED
  • ARTWORK DESIGN AND LAYOUT
  • RADIO PROMOTIONS
  • VIDEO RECORDING FOR TV AND SOCIAL MEDIA
  • VIDEO EDITING
  • NEW WEBSITE DESIGN IE. OFFICIAL WEBSITE, FACEBOOK, TWITTER, YOUTUBE, INSTAGRAM
  • FLIGHTS TO AND FROM NASHVILLE
  • PAYING THE PRODUCER 
  • PAYING THE ENGINEER TO RUN THE SESSIONS
IF I DON'T REACH THE ENTIRE GOAL, I WILL USE WHAT FUNDS COME IN TO BEGIN THE WRITING PROCESS.  I'LL GO AS FAR AS I AM ABLE WITH THE FUNDS THAT I AM GRACIOUSLY PROVIDED.  AS MORE COMES IN, I'LL PUSH FORWARD AND MAKE STRIDES TO FINISH.
 

The Impact

Those of you who know Becky and myself will note that we're not in this to impress but rather to instill hope, to show love the best way we know how; through our music.  I want people to have a voice that shares in their joys, their pain, and their victories!  We desire more then anything to be used.  Plain and simple. 

     

      PLEASE HELP US BY SHARING THIS AND ENCOURAGING PEOPLE TO HELP.

story:
'The Wobble' video fund was so  successful,  we landed an agent - Muttis Booking! Thank you! Now we need to press a

7" Vinyl Record:

A side: Iggy Pop's 'Lust For Life'// B side: 'The Wobble' & shoot a video for 'Lust For Life'.

 

I am Saudia Young, a singer from  New York City, based in Berlin Germany. My four piece band and I been playing in Berlin for a couple of years. The sound? Think Big Mamma Thornton, Nick Curran & Bo Diddley. We call it Noir Rockabilly Blues!

  • This campaign is to fund the studio production of  'Lust For Life' by Iggy Pop, the pressing of a 7" VINYL RECORD & a Video for Lust For Life.
  • The last campaign had a powerful  impact on our trajectory as a working band. Muttis Booking,  will submit us to festivals throughout Europe. We have already been booked at the prestigious Sjock Festival in Belgium, July 8th 2017.
  • What Our booking agent absolutely 'must have' is a Vinyl Record to do his job for us.  The Vinyl Record will enable us to get RADIO & DJ play & BOOKINGS . The discs will also be sold on the road, to our lovely fans. The VINYL& VIDEO will help BOOST our profile and will give people another taste of what we bring!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need the funding for the : Song Studio Production & Post Production, Vinyl Production & Video Production.
  • What you get: Vinyl Records, T-shirts, Shopping Bags, Mp3 Downloads, & MORE, plus the knowledge that you are helping us to keep on rocking it, in the free world!
  • The studio recording has been paid out of pocket, so if we do not reach the final goal, it would be great to cover that. So every bit counts.
  • Lust for Life:
    Writer-Iggy Pop
    Producer: Lars Vegas
    Vocals: Saudia Young
    Guitars, upright bass, piano & backing vocals: Lars Vegas
    Drums-& percussion: Tomas Svensson
  • FYI: 5% of funding raised will go for  Indiegogo admin fees & 5% will go to:Sacred Stone Camp//Standing Rock Pipeline Protest Camp's Official fund:

     https://www.gofundme.com/sacredstonecamp   which will go toward purchasing water, food, propane, blankets and other supplies. Checks, cash or supplies (http://sacredstonecamp.org/supply-list/) can also be sent through the mail to:
    Sacred Stone Camp, P.O. Box 1011, Fort Yates, ND 58538

The Impact

  • You are supporting DIY-self made artists, in a time when good music & art, by the people, for the people, is needed more than ever!
  • We successfully completed three funding campaigns, most notably 'The Wobble' Single & Video.
  • Without you we are nothing!
  • WE LOVE YOU!

Risks & Challenges

  • Everyone is funding theses days and many of the projects & campaigns are dear to our hearts. Plus the world is pretty crazy right now. There is A LOT OF NOISE to compete with. Like the survival of humanity and the planet for example. We actively support other  ARTISTS and CAUSES, help  to keep the community strong and hope you can hear and remember us through the current  information STORM. The  RISK is real, we could get lost in the shuffle and fear.
  • BUT-- If we don't meet the goal with this campaign, we will keep on keeping on. Whatever it takes: busking, day jobs, cleaning houses, marrying rich. We are not too proud to work for it. That is what got us this far!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign with your friends! It  is a powerful way to support us, if money is not happening right now. Personal emails are super helpful!
  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! Check Indiegogo share tools! Social Media on our terms!

BUT-- If we don't meet the goal with this campaign, we will keep on keeping on. Whatever it takes: busking, day jobs, cleaning houses, marrying rich. We are not too proud to work for it. That is what got us this far!

story:
This Campaign, My Music, & My Future

So many of you who happen upon this campaign may know me very well, or might not know me at all. To fill in the holes I'd like to introduce myself and give you all some background that you may or may not already know. My pseudonym is Jackson Cavalier, I took on this name a few years ago when I decided to begin my pursuit to become a full time musician. I've been playing music since I was a kid and began playing out at bars and concert halls when I was in high school. After a short stint at college I realized I just couldn't wait any longer to pursue my ambitions of making a living doing what I love to do most, playing music.

My journey began as a busker (street performer) on the streets and farmers markets of Rochester, NY back in 2013.  My act evolved into a one man band folkrock/americana showcase which got the attention of what were to me, shockingly large crowds of passer-bys. That pursuit quickly evolved into all sorts of gigs around upstate NY at bars, private events, concert halls, festivals, and a status as the house musician/music booker at The Daily Refresher.

Now on to why I decided to create this campaign. With this amount of gigging I have been able to make enough to live a modest and happy life, but the one thing I have found I cannot afford to do is find room in my budget to spend on recording my material. Recording a full length album is extremely expensive and it would take years for me to save up enough money to do so if it were entirely on my own. My main goals with this campaign are to create an album reminiscent of the early works of artists like Bob Dylan, where you feel as though you are right there in the room with the artist as they present their songs to you. Much of my new solo material is folk-centric americana, and I want to give you that same experience. Each track will be just as if I were playing it to you live: One voice, one guitar, one suitcase drum kit, one harmonica, and one performance. My second goal in this campaign is to create an album that will further my career as a musician and help get me signed to a label. Being signed to a label would help me immensely to get my music out to those who have never heard it, and to be able to tour across the country getting exposure to all sorts of new crowds. If you are one of the amazingly kind people that have ever told me I'm going to make it big one day, I really think this would be my best bet. This has always been a dream of mine and I believe that the songs on this album will help that dream come true upon completion.

 

What You Will Be Funding, & What You Will Get In Return

As many would want to know, myself included, the following is a list of expenses that your donation will help fund,

  • $2700- Will go to the processes of recording, engineering, mixing, and mastering of the 10 tracks on the album.
  • $500- Will go to the physical production of this album, which includes, CD's, Cases, Cover Art Expenses, all in all the first pressing should be about 300 copies.
  • $300- Will help cover the tax 3-5% collected by indiegogo and other payment sources, as well as costs of promoting the album.

All said and done the campaign goal adds up to $3500.00 which with your help I think can be achieved. If the goal is not met Indiegogo will still allow me to keep the funding I have raised. If the goal is not met my plan is to continue on with this project in a scaled down version, scaling back to fit the amount of money raised. While this is not ideal I still want to be able to supply donors with new material.

Perks!

As with any other indiegogo campaign this one will include Perks for donors! The full list of Perks can be found on the campaign page but will include a copy of the finished album, a song written for you by me, a private show by yours truly, etc.

Can't Donate? You Can Still Help!

If you'd like to donate but don't have the means you can still help. Spread the word about this campaign and what I'm trying to achieve, share the address to this page on social media, tell your friends and family! Any help getting exposure for this campaign is appreciated!

Being signed to a label would help me immensely to get my music out to those who have never heard it, and to be able to tour across the country getting exposure to all sorts of new crowds. If you are one of the amazingly kind people that have ever told me I'm going to make it big one day, I really think this would be my best bet. This has always been a dream of mine and I believe that the songs on this album will help that dream come true upon completion. What You Will Be Funding, & What You Will Get In ReturnAs many would want to know, myself included, the following is a list of expenses that your donation will help fund,
$2700- Will go to the processes of recording, engineering, mixing, and mastering of the 10 tracks on the album.
$500- Will go to the physical production of this album, which includes, CD's, Cases, Cover Art Expenses, all in all the first pressing should be about 300 copies.
$300- Will help cover the tax 3-5% collected by indiegogo and other payment sources, as well as costs of promoting the album.
All said and done the campaign goal adds up to $3500.00 which with your help I think can be achieved. If the goal is not met Indiegogo will still allow me to keep the funding I have raised. If the goal is not met my plan is to continue on with this project in a scaled down version, scaling back to fit the amount of money raised. While this is not ideal I still want to be able to supply donors with new material.Perks!As with any other indiegogo campaign this one will include Perks for donors! The full list of Perks can be found on the campaign page but will include a copy of the finished album, a song written for you by me, a private show by yours truly, etc.Can't Donate? You Can Still Help!If you'd like to donate but don't have the means you can still help. Spread the word about this campaign and what I'm trying to achieve, share the address to this page on social media, tell your friends and family! Any help getting exposure for this campaign is appreciated!

story:
I started playing guitar when I was seven years old. At the age of fourteen I spent time singing and playing with a small band at my church. And as they say, the rest is history! In recent years I have had the opportunity to lead worship and perform at various churches and concert venues along the east coast. Last May I graduated from UNC Asheville with a degree in both History and Religious Studies. After graduation I moved back to Charlotte and I am currently the Contemporary Worship Director at Davidson United Methodist Church, in addition to being a singer/songwriter in the Charlotte, NC, area. 

For the last three years of my college career I was under contract with McLaughlin Music Group International (MMGI), a management company based out of Arkansas. While under management I connected with Uphill Studios in Atlanta, GA. On November 25, 2014, I released my self-titled EP. Since then I have been playing or performing in the surrounding region nearly every weekend. I am excited to announce that this fall I will be working with Gat3 Studio in Charlotte to record my second EP. Since the release of my first EP, my overall sound has changed in beautiful ways. I'm really excited to finish this project and share more of my music with all of you! This campaign will cover the full cost of production and mastering through Gat3, though it does not include the cost of duplicating the physical CD's. 

I appreciate any financial support you can give, and I am excited to share my new EP with you in 2017!

story:
About Shawn T.

With over 15 years in music, writing, performance, peace, love, and emotion, are ways of life for me. I connect with the world through my lyrics, and the passion and emotions behind my writings are relatable to people across the world. I believe music is one of the most powerful tools for spreading messages of love - something we can use much more of in the world today.

My Goal

All funding raised from this campaign will be used towards funding for all aspects of "Beautiful Things - Live sessions from Mockingbird Studio" - Mixing, Mastering, Album art, production, and promotion. Every donation helps! Any money left over will be put towards completion of a full-length disc release by Summer 2017.

story:
Rue Bella's EP Recording Campaign

"Jazz-infused alternative rock combined with sultry, edgy vocals and lyrics that stray to the dark side."

 

Rue Bella consists of...
Taylor Cos - vocals, keyboards
Brandon Webb - guitars, vocals
Adam Clark - bass, vocals
Clint DelBrocco - drums


Fairly new to the music scene, Rue Bella has been quickly making a name for ourselves, winning Barrie's Rock 95: Local and Loud competition as well as playing legendary Toronto venues such as Lee's Palace and the Horseshoe Tavern.  In December 2016, we will be opening up for Canada's award-winning Finger Eleven!

Check out our self-titled EP (2015) recorded and produced by Rue Bella @ https://ruebella.bandcamp.com
______________________________________________________

Your donation will be greatly appreciated! 
We will use it to help fund our Studio Project with a well-known and award-winning producer alongside an excellent engineering/mixing team.  (It's top secret so we can't share who... YET! We will be sharing these details early 2017). This EP will help us reach new and exciting levels for Rue Bella and we are extremely excited to begin the process! There are many ways you can help and we are grateful for any support you would like to offer!

100% of the money raised will go towards the studio costs. of going into the studio.

 

For your generous donations, we are offering some marvelous rewards including... 

  • A LIMITED EDITION Rue Bella EP with a NEW TRACK "Socialites (Anti-Social Remix)"!
  • A LIMITED RUN of Rue Bella T-shirts with some brand new designs!
  • An exclusive LIVE performance at a location of your choice by Rue Bella!
  • Some stickers, pins, digital downloads, and MORE!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help Rue Bella!?

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE!  Please share this crowdfunding campaign. The more people we connect with, the closer we are to reaching our goal!
  • Come to a Rue Bella show!  We play frequently in the Greater Toronto Area.  Your support always helps us move forward.
  • Stay in touch and follow us on facebook at www.facebook.com/weareruebella  


Thank you for your support! <3 


Sincerely, 
Rue Bella
Taylor, Brandon, Adam & Clint

story:
Hello dear D-EDGE supporters!

We have just recorded our 3rd album "Cambierà" and it's time to enhance the music with great music videos!!!

The songs we'd like to have the videos for are:

VORREI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iyM2L-2a8A4&amp...

SOGNO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_HtdvyIByKM&amp...

CAMBIERA': https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cfOWYsXhnuQ&amp...

COME UNA STELLA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zMCk8CtES6Y&amp...

All from the 3rd album "Cambierà" (not yet on digital stores).

More info about Stefano: http://www.stefanomatteucci.co.uk/biography

Previous music videos:

IN MY LIFE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e2_up2RZIyg&amp...

MY GREATEST HOPE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mzf02j88lOE&amp...

MARTA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vM5AfGAteHw&amp...

COLOSSAL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l_hDWEPQDtQ&amp...

KARMA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BrM1WHuvmH4&amp...

BLACK KEYS: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BqvZqYsPnhg&amp...

The full playlist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sR6dr2o8XLM&amp...

What do people think of D-EDGE? : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7DRgcJwMzQY

Lyrics translation:

VORREI (I WISH)

So much sadness, so much pain
that's what's left of this love

Us, always united, everything we were, now two strangers we'll become

You know what's left of those cages we make, deluding ourselves to be forever happy inside them, it's the memory of us and the unbearable void you left inside me!

I crave to come back to when I use to hold you tight, so much I'd like to hear your singing words again, and hear you laughing, feeling you alive and close to me as you were, and seeing you quivering, with burning heart for me  

Traveling, leaving, going far away, forgetting, that's the secret
I go wandering around the world
but my thoughts are fixed there

In an ever staggering sunset, in my every step there's you, always you
What's left is the memory of us, your sweetness and a smile that aren't there for me anymore

I crave to come back to when I use to hold you tight, so much I'd like to hear your singing words again, and hear you laughing, feeling you alive and close to me as you were, and seeing you quivering, with burning passion for me 

Maybe one day you'll have a thought and a little smile for me, for me that I can't forget about us

And in this silence, I rediscover the meaning of freedom, from the emptiness inside me, serenity is now reborn
The dream, the fairy tale of those golden cages of monogamy
loving each other is a total different thing for me.

SOGNO (DREAM):

Being here, light-heartedly
peace upon us
It's a great privilege
that not many have

I feel you inside me
you are part of me
but I can't ignore what's around us

I get lost inside your world
I'm free with you but looking elsewhere
isn't like living

You know I dream that one day
we won't hear of any war anymore

Being here, sincere
truthful as we are
but forgetting isn't love you know?

I get lost inside your world
I'm free with you but looking elsewhere
is certainly not like living

You know I dream that one day
no war will exist anymore

Stay here a minute longer
can you feel the void inside us?
Time passes and at every hour hatred grows

Fragile and frightened we are
but if you really want it
nobody will ever stop us!

story:
Summary of this project & why funds are needed 
Following up the 2013 EP release "Tunes of Portugal", I at last have an album of new songs to share (including 3 cover versions of 80s favorites: "Don't You (Forget About Me)", "Alone Again Or", and "Ai Oboete Imasuka (Do You Remember Love?)" from the epic Japanese anime film Macross Plus). 

The stellar production team includes Boz Boorer (cowriter & producer) and Eric Berdon (coproducer), and the album will be mastered by Emily Lazar at Lodge Mastering, NYC, assisted by Chris Allgood. 

$6500 is the bare minimum needed for remaining production, licensing, and manufacturing costs, but I've set the goal lower at $3,500 to ensure a better chance of reaching it. Over the course of working on this project, I've had to go on disability due to longterm health issues. I personally can no longer carry the full burden of funding this project and am reaching out for help with the remaining funds needed to release the album.  

Project History
The writing and recording of this album began in 2014 when Boz gave me some wonderful music to write to. I traveled to his studio retreat (Serra Vista Studios in Portugal) with him and his wife Lyn later that year and we were able to get four songs done within a week's time.
Boz, me, and drummer Stuart McNab at Serra Vista Studios in Monchique, Portugal

A couple of the songs' vocals really needed more work, so I took vocal and drum lessons for about a year back in Los Angeles and re-recorded those vocals in 2015 with the great help of Lynn Fanelli and Joel Wachbrit.

In 2016, I learned more about production and songwriting through the Mix With the Masters seminar with producer Joe Chiccarelli at La Fabrique Studios (France) and Judy Stakee's Songwriting Retreat (also in France).


Observing intently at the Mix With the Masters seminar at La Fabrique Studios


Communing after a full day of songwriting at Judy Stakee's Songwriting Retreat

With the wonderful support of these new communities of producers, musicians, singers, and songwriters, I was able to finish writing and recording the rest of my album with the wonderful coproduction help of Eric Berdon.  It's been a very long journey, and there is still so much I am learning, but the investment in time and money (including selling off my Vespa... sigh, still miss her) has been so totally worth it. The result is this debut album.

Amazing cover artwork done by my gifted friend Katy Unger

More about the project (Where did the title come from?)
Desdemona is the female lead character in William Shakespeare's play "Othello", conspired against by her husband Othello's sadistic, two-faced, manipulative officer Iago. Both Othello and Desdemona are caught in Iago's web, with Desdemona being the most misunderstood object of violence. She pays the ultimate price for just existing.

I feel it's important to pay attention to the scapegoat of any situation and the intentions of those who point fingers. Shakespeare wrote "Othello" in a way which allows us to see the wider machinations of such people. It's a brilliant and unfortunately timeless metaphor for our world.   

Though Desdemona's role in "Othello" is consequential to her husband and his manipulated actions, I pull focus back to Desdemona herself, as a powerful force in and of herself, with ultimate control over her own destiny, even from the afterlife. 

"Desdemona Resurrect" is about rising up after being completely, wrongly destroyed.

The track listing is:
"Don't You Forget About Me" (cover)
"Grandmother Tongue" 
"Random Rain"
"Ai Oboete Imasuka (Do You Remember Love?)" (cover)
"Dream Child"
"Attachments"
"High Maintenance Man"
"Alone Again Or" (cover) 

In Conclusion
If this project is completed (with your much-needed help), I hope to get a band together and do a small tour sharing the songs live. One thing at a time, though. The production, licensing and manufacturing must happen first.

story:
Welcome!  My name is Taryn Noelle, and I am a vocalist, actor, stage director, and dance teacher/choreographer working throughout the beautiful state of Vermont.  I was born and raised in Toronto, Canada and, as a young girl, studied piano and also trained as a competitive rhythmic gymnast.  We moved to Vermont and I began high school, focused my training in voice and dance, and where I found my love of theatre and the stage.  After cutting my teeth in high school theatre, I studied at Circle in the Square Theatre School in New York City.

 

Back in those high school years, it was during a stage production of the musical "Pippin" that I first met my 'Pal Joey'.... aka, the world class jazz pianist and composer, Joe Davidian.  Three years my junior, this completely hip and blazing talent decided to take me under his wing and we have been working together on special projects ever since. Fast forward...as Joe decided to leave Nashville for New York City to spread his musical wings, I jumped at the chance to work with him again and to make this Holiday record together.  

I often imagine what it was like growing up in the 1930's and 1940's when the Great American Songbook was the music in the ears of the world around us.  The artists from my grandparents' generation have been my own musical inspiration, and where I feel most “at home”.  

 

Christmas and the Holidays are filled with magic and miracles, and this has always been such an inspirational time of year for me.  I wanted to bundle up all of that love and channel it into the music that you will hear on this album.  It's music of hope, joy, laughter, love, loss, dreams, prayers, friendship and family.  The instrumentalists and vocalists whom I have asked to join me on this record are not only talented performers, but also people whom I am so blessed to call family.  

The recording and production costs for this album are high, and I would not be able to do this without the help of my friends, family, and wonderful folks like you!  

Your financial support will help us finish recording in the studio, to mix and master, finalize album artwork, license the tunes, and press CD's, as well as create digital downloads, just in time for you to get your copies...AND just in time for the Holidays!!!  

****************

AND NOW . . . Joe Davidian!

Joe was born in 1981 in rural Vermont and showed musical promise from a very early age. He started taking classical piano lessons at the age of six and became interested in jazz shortly thereafter. He studied jazz piano with professionals Kenny Werner and Jim McNeely throughout his high school years.

In 2003, Joe received his Bachelor of Music in Jazz Piano Performance from the University of Miami, and from 2003-2005, while working on his Master’s degree, he served as Teaching Assistant in the University of Miami Jazz Piano department. After graduation, Joe was hired to teach jazz courses at the University of Vermont during the 2006-2007 academic year.

From 2007 until 2016, Joe lived in Nashville, Tennessee, where he taught jazz piano and directed ensembles at Belmont University and Middle Tennessee State University. He also taught various classes at the Nashville Jazz Workshop.

Joe’s own group, The Joe Davidian Trio, has recorded four albums on the Sonic Mirage Media label: For the Birds (1999), JD3: Live (2003), Silent Fire (2008) and Live at the Jazz Cave: Volume One (2013). Joe has also recorded as a sideman with Chester Thompson, Duffy Jackson, and Alison Brown, among others.

Currently, Joe maintains an active performing schedule with Chester Thompson and Alison Brown, and has extensive performance experience with the likes of Kevin Mahogany, Tito Puente, Lester Bowie, Bob Mintzer, Joe Lovano, Carmen Lundy, Ira Sullivan, Wycliffe Gordon, Bobby Watson, Duffy Jackson and Dave Liebman,

Joe also continues to tour internationally with his trio. The trio made their NYC debut at Dizzy’s Club Coca-Cola, one of the world’s top jazz clubs, in October of 2015.

Joe now lives, performs and teaches jazz in New York City. www.JoeDavidianTrio.com

****************

There are some unique 'Perks' for contributing to this album, and I hope that you will enjoy the fun and experiential options that will come along with your generous support!  If we are able to meet and even exceed our fundraising goal, it is so important that I am able to give back to the community, and especially help families with children who may be in need during the holiday season.  

This campaign would not have been possible without the generous help of our many "Santa's Helpers"!  Amy Bennett, Michael Fisher, Jamie Dragon, Meghan Reichelt, Jill & Mike Loughran, Nancy Jeffries-Dwyer, Joe Davidian, and Richard Pritsky.

Thank you so much for your interest and support, and we hope to see you at the Launch Party in December!  

Happiest Holiday Wishes and Dreams to you all.....With love and gratitude, Taryn!

http://www.tarynnoelle.com
story_txt: Welcome!  My name is Taryn Noelle, and I am a vocalist, actor, stage director, and dance teacher/choreographer working throughout the beautiful state of Vermont.  I was born and raised in Toronto, Canada and, as a young girl, studied piano and also trained as a competitive rhythmic gymnast.  We moved to Vermont and I began high school, focused my training in voice and dance, and where I found my love of theatre and the stage.  After cutting my teeth in high school theatre, I studied at Circle in the Square Theatre School in New York City.  Back in those high school years, it was during a stage production of the musical "Pippin" that I first met my 'Pal Joey'.... aka, the world class jazz pianist and composer, Joe Davidian.  Three years my junior, this completely hip and blazing talent decided to take me under his wing and we have been working together on special projects ever since. Fast forward...as Joe decided to leave Nashville for New York City to spread his musical wings, I jumped at the chance to work with him again and to make this Holiday record together.  I often imagine what it was like growing up in the 1930's and 1940's when the Great American Songbook was the music in the ears of the world around us.  The artists from my grandparents' generation have been my own musical inspiration, and where I feel most “at home”.    Christmas and the Holidays are filled with magic and miracles, and this has always been such an inspirational time of year for me.  I wanted to bundle up all of that love and channel it into the music that you will hear on this album.  It's music of hope, joy, laughter, love, loss, dreams, prayers, friendship and family.  The instrumentalists and vocalists whom I have asked to join me on this record are not only talented performers, but also people whom I am so blessed to call family.  The recording and production costs for this album are high, and I would not be able to do this without the help of my friends, family, and wonderful folks like you!  Your financial support will help us finish recording in the studio, to mix and master, finalize album artwork, license the tunes, and press CD's, as well as create digital downloads, just in time for you to get your copies...AND just in time for the Holidays!!!  ****************AND NOW . . . Joe Davidian! Joe was born in 1981 in rural Vermont and showed musical promise from a very early age. He started taking classical piano lessons at the age of six and became interested in jazz shortly thereafter. He studied jazz piano with professionals Kenny Werner and Jim McNeely throughout his high school years.In 2003, Joe received his Bachelor of Music in Jazz Piano Performance from the University of Miami, and from 2003-2005, while working on his Master’s degree, he served as Teaching Assistant in the University of Miami Jazz Piano department. After graduation, Joe was hired to teach jazz courses at the University of Vermont during the 2006-2007 academic year.From 2007 until 2016, Joe lived in Nashville, Tennessee, where he taught jazz piano and directed ensembles at Belmont University and Middle Tennessee State University. He also taught various classes at the Nashville Jazz Workshop.Joe’s own group, The Joe Davidian Trio, has recorded four albums on the Sonic Mirage Media label: For the Birds (1999), JD3: Live (2003), Silent Fire (2008) and Live at the Jazz Cave: Volume One (2013). Joe has also recorded as a sideman with Chester Thompson, Duffy Jackson, and Alison Brown, among others.Currently, Joe maintains an active performing schedule with Chester Thompson and Alison Brown, and has extensive performance experience with the likes of Kevin Mahogany, Tito Puente, Lester Bowie, Bob Mintzer, Joe Lovano, Carmen Lundy, Ira Sullivan, Wycliffe Gordon, Bobby Watson, Duffy Jackson and Dave Liebman,Joe also continues to tour internationally with his trio. The trio made their NYC debut at Dizzy’s Club Coca-Cola, one of the world’s top jazz clubs, in October of 2015.Joe now lives, performs and teaches jazz in New York City. www.JoeDavidianTrio.com****************There are some unique 'Perks' for contributing to this album, and I hope that you will enjoy the fun and experiential options that will come along with your generous support!  If we are able to meet and even exceed our fundraising goal, it is so important that I am able to give back to the community, and especially help families with children who may be in need during the holiday season.  This campaign would not have been possible without the generous help of our many "Santa's Helpers"!  Amy Bennett, Michael Fisher, Jamie Dragon, Meghan Reichelt, Jill & Mike Loughran, Nancy Jeffries-Dwyer, Joe Davidian, and Richard Pritsky.Thank you so much for your interest and support, and we hope to see you at the Launch Party in December!  Happiest Holiday Wishes and Dreams to you all.....With love and gratitude, Taryn!http://www.tarynnoelle.com

story:
Short Summary

Danny Diaz has touched the lives of may key musicians in his 50 year career as a Guitarist, Songwriter & Educator.  He is a talented guitarist who still performs and composes today.  His dream  is to record his first album of original music featuring some of his former students and peers.  The album will cover several bebop, blues  and swing compositions that he has written.  He is a 3 time survivor of cancer and lives on a very fixed income.   Word has spread quickly and donations of skills, tools, talent are coming in quickly thus reducing the original 11k  cost we budgeted.  We are now calling on family, friends and the public to support the costs for the remainder of the project at $3800 (for artwork, reproduction, studio, mixing, mastering, licensing, publishing set up, etc. ) 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a bigger picture for the project

  • A CD "Lessons In Music" featuring former students and peers on original compositions by Danny Diaz
  • We will be having a Gala and Launch Party for the release and celebration of the record in Jan 2017

  • There will be a short documentary on the life and work of Danny Diaz and your stories can be included!

      The Impact

      Arts and Humanity:  Giving back to someone who has given so many others the gift of talent,  love and passion for music.  Support for out Community:  The San Gabriel Valley is overdue for recognition in music and arts.  This is one way we can leave our historical mark by acknowledging local history.  The San Gabriel Valley is full of historical talent that stems from the 1960's "Brown Sound", and cutting edge music of Oingo Boingo  in the 80's. Lets not forget the Delgado Brothers who are the  2016 International Blues  Challenge Winners  .  Here's a short list of talent he mentored back in days at Johnny Thompsons Music:  

    • Joey Delgado (Winner 2016 IBC - Albert King Award Best Blues Guitarist)
    • Mike Albert (Megadeth, El Chicano, L. Shenkar)
    • Bobby Robles (Paul McCartney, Jackson Browne, Paul Simon -guest appearances)
    • Carlos De La Paz (Film/TV "Real Women Have Curves", production music)
    • John Avila (Producer, Oingo Boingo, Food For Feet)
    • Michael Tover (Food For Feet)
    • Sammy Sanchez (Guitar Tech - ZZ top, Santana, Bonnie Raitt, Slash,  James Taylor, etc)
    • and many more...

    At 70 years old Danny Diaz still goes toe-to-toe with these guys and he has never been more ready to cut an album of original music than now!

    Risks & Challenges

    Our challenge was originally much higher at 11k but with the flood of folks offering to donate time, skills, and tools of the trade, we fill that the new goal of $3800 is attainable.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Share us your stories about Danny Diaz so we can pass it on  and include it in our mini-documentary to air during launch and celebration.
    • Share the campaign with others to surpass our goal
    • Help with social media, marketing, publicity.
    • Use the the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Event planning volunteer, decor, set up-tear down, clean up at launch party

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello!

I'm Alex Van Gils, a composer living and working in the SF Bay Area. You may know me from Oakland-based political theatre ensemble The Bonfire Makers, or from work I've done recently with the Awesöme Orchestra Collective or the Friction Quartet. 

I love synthesizers and computer music, and I use both in my music for theatre, but I've never released an album-length composition of electronic music before. This campaign is here to change that, and give you, my supporters and audience, the ability to take my music home with you for the first time. No longer will you have to wait until the next concert or theatre performance to hear my sounds!

Usually, when I write a piece, the process is kept between me and the performers. This time, I want to try something different. In this case, I am both the composer and the performer—so I want to bring you, my supporters, into the process, through several of the perks available on this campaign.

Here's why I'm raising money:

  • The majority of the funds I'm raising will go towards equipment costs for this project, specifically, a beautiful synthesizer called the Prophet-T8. From the first moment I heard this instrument, I had to compose music for it. In addition to an incredible sound, this instrument also has wonderful weighted keys and a host of features that open my mind every time I visit it in the synthesizer shop. The music that I'm planning for this composition is inspired in particular by this special instrument, and this accounts for about $5,000 of the campaign.
  • Roughly $1,000 of the campaign will go towards the design and release of this album. I'm raising funds to pay my artist and designer friends to work on the visual aspects of the album. There will also be costs to create physical copies of the album.
  • The remainder of the funds raised (roughly $700) will go towards a website to host and represent this work, and cover the Indiegogo fees.

Scroll down on this page and you'll see that this campaign has perks that are designed to give you a window into the creation of this music, either through:

  • early releases of draft sounds and sketches,
  • a behind-the-scenes walkthrough of my work,
  • a special listening party held in your home (or in another location in the SF Bay Area).

If this campaign does not reach the total of $6,700, I'll still complete some kind of electronic composition for synthesizers, though I may need to do it in a different way, perhaps with a different kind of release or with a different instrument

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign right now, but still want to help, OR if you've contributed but you are wanting to do more, please:

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page to send this campaign to your friends, family, and fellow music lovers.

Thank you all!

 

Photo credit: Nye Lyn Tho Photography http://nyelyntho.com/ 

Video credit: Jared Young

story:
Matt O'Ree Bio

New Jersey’s best kept secret is about to make some noise.

Over the past few years. The Matt O’Ree band has done what most area bands do. They’ve played their shows, developed their sound, released their records and very quietly built a local fan base in the process.

What makes this band different from all the others is that their local fan base includes Bruce Springsteen, David Bryan and John Popper, (all of whom have volunteered to perform on the band’s forthcoming album to be released later this year.)

When three of your biggest supporters have sold a collective 230 million units, you know you’re doing something right.

Growing up on influences ranging from Jimi Hendrix, Cream, Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple, Rory Gallagher, ZZ Top, Robin Trower, Joe Walsh and Stevie Ray Vaughan, The Matt O’Ree Band has taken all these diverse elements and forged a new iron.

Matt’s writing is inspired from many life experiences and years of study from the ones that have wrote the book on how to play real guitar rock music. Not as a photocopy, but in a new light that hasn't been seen in quite some time. Now is the time for real music and real musicianship to make a resurrection.

The band takes their fans on a ride that hasn't been heard or seen at this level since the 70's. Their live show is like revisiting a Zeppelin concert at the Garden, and with Eric Safka on Hammond B3, Scott Bennert on Bass, and John Hummel on Drums, they’ve built a foundation that can hold up the biggest house on the block. 

After years of honing their craft, the Matt O’Ree Band is about to become an overnight success. This is New Jersey’s next great export.

Our mission:

Those who know Matt know how many years he has been working toward this dream. It's been a community effort from the beginning, and now The M.O.B. wants you to be a part of their ride by choosing from some incredible funding packages to help make it a reality. 

All monies received will go to the making and promoting of our new album "BROTHERHOOD". We're offering everything from advance copies of the CD to the band playing a concert in your living room. 

Anyone who has ever tried to have a career in the music industry can attest to how difficult a road it is, but like the classic goes, "We'll get by with a little help from our friends". 

Whether it is by making a donation (no matter how small), re-posting, coming out to a show or just spreading the word, your voices are heard and we love you all for that.

story:
We've never liked talking a lot, either on stage, or in media. We've always wanted to let our music speak for itself, and this is how Horizon, Drifters and Similarity came into being.


It's time for a new story, 

the album INNATE.


Help us tell it.


Our goal is to raise 3,000$.  This amount would not cover the entire project from start to finish, but it will be a huge boost for our ultimate goal.

Your contributions shall go to the album recording, mixing, and mastering.

We’ve decided to record INNATE at Electrical Audio Studio in Chicago with Mr. Steve Albini, since we believe that this is exactly the ingredient we seek for to have our live sound and energy reflected on the album. INNATE is going to have 7 compositions on it. Expect the quality of our previous albums, but we are positive we can go at least a level up :)

Thanks a lot for visiting our campaign page. We know it’s not possible for everyone to contribute, so please, spread the word about our campaign. Indiegogo has a number of ways to easily share this page on all social media platforms. It costs nothing, yet it would mean so much to the project. 

Have a nice day,

EYOT

p.s. For all of you who don't know about us and our music, you can see/hear it here : www.eyotmusic.net

story:
MI’KA MOON 

Hawaiian resident,Tennessee native, MI'KA(mee-kuh),born a mix of Hebrew, Cherokee, Hungarian, and German decent, discovered at the tender age of four, that writing original stories, songs,and singing, offered her a place of solace through the challenges of being human.

Her soulful, sweet sounds are influenced by her love for all types of music. Some of her greatest influences include: Alicia Keys, Carol King, Erykah Badu, India Arie , Nina Simone, Stevie Wonder, & traditional world music.

Mi’ka is recognized as a pioneer spirit. Singing from the depths of her soul, through cosmic triumphant melodies, and deeply profound lyrics, weather on piano,guitar,ukulele or hand drum, her songs are a reflection of both her life experiences and her hopes and dreams for the future. She is Creatively inspired to sing for Women’s Empowerment and known for Catalyzing a Healing Presence of Unconditional Love for all souls, through her performances ! 

 

“MI'KA MOON'S Soul Shaking Vocals, Reminiscent Of Early R&B Divas, Extend Messages Of Relevance To A Contemporary Era And Generation! ”

STEVEN MEREDITH KKCR/KAUAI LIVE 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

    Aloha ! 

I'm Mi'ka Moon .

Thank you so much for sharing a few moments of your time with me.

I Sing For Peace, Equality, Justice, And Unconditional Love.

To me music is sacred. I offer these songs to you as my prayers and efforts toward this dream. 

I currently have 5 albums worth of finished music waiting to be recorded!

With your help I will put together a modest portable studio and get busy recording!

Some of the Song Titles are :

"Free Like The Wind" "Lay Down Your Weapons,"Love is the Path ",Better people" "Manafest," "Spirit Dance," "Soul Grateful," "Reach Out," "Love In my Skin," "Angels," "We Cant Do This Alone," "Grandmama," &"Evolve,"  to name a few.

Now more than ever, it is crucial to share this uplifting message with people world wide. Upgrading my gear and getting out on tour, is the most proactive route that I can take, right now, to get this vision moving forward.

So Mahalo for Supporting This Conscious Music Movement Today. I invite you to join in this journey on whatever level feels good in Your Heart .

A lot goes into Being a Musical Messenger , it is a full time job! 

There are Production and Performance Gear , Video Production, Touring Costs, Hiring A Band, Artist Development Training.

If you wish to help with these costs, you will receive the debut album, along with other perks like artwork and concert performances .

Ultimately I am fulfilling my life's purpose, which is to be of service to humanity through these musical offerings on topics near and dear to my heart. Honestly,I can think of no greater gift.

Feel Free to stay tuned for journal entry updates, also you can reach out to me on Facebook for upcoming shows in a town near you. 

I would be so grateful if you would please, share this video with your world.

 

Mahalo Ke Akua, and
 Aloha, Mi'ka Moon
 
"May The Eros Of The Earth Bless You," John O'Donahue.
 
 
 
 

RECENT ACCOMPLISHMENTS :
Opened for Nahko Bear & Medicine For The People HOMEGROWN FESTIVAL

2016 * Released FIRST FULL LENGTH LIVE ALBUM SEPTEMBER 2016 * Released first four song LP June , 2016 * Opened for XAVIER RUDD at MANAFEST 2016

* Played on KKCR HANALEI “ KAUAI LIVE ” MAY & AUGUST 2016 * Opened for DEYA DOVA twice, DECEMBER 2015

PERFORMING WEEKLY: Saturday Nights 7-9 pm Princeville , & Kilauea Art walks UPCOMING EVENTS : Announcing Mi’ka Moon’s First Tour! A Conscious Music Movement May- August 2017

Reach Out to Mi’ka Moon :  mikamoonmusic@gmail.com Mi’ka Moon on Facebook - Mi’ka Moon Music on Instagram www.mikamoon.bandcamp.com

   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

And for your curiosity please feel free to explore further down the page to find out more details...
 
*****
 
I want to express my deep gratitude to my husband Quinn for all your support.
You have been an unshakeable pillar of love and strength  by my side through it all. I love you so much !  To all my angels, guides and guardians, to the great spirit ,Mahalo Nui Loa.
 
 

Where am I going?

I am planning the shows based on people's request to have me come to their town. I will be performing festivals, cafe's , and house gatherings so far . I am currently working with people in California, Oregon, and Canada to anchor in the schedule based upon what we come up with as a collective.

Who's Going with me?

I am currently planning this as a solo tour with the intention of meeting up with some other friends to form a whole band at specific venues for specific shows.  Quinn will be joining me throughout .

Cost breakdown:
 
Hybrid Tour Vehicle $10,000
 Fuel, & Flights $4500
 

Production and performance gear , including macbook pro, interface,headphones, Nord 5D61 Stage piano, accessories (case,pedals,cords,bench,stand). Cost $5000

Anything raised above and beyond these costs will go to Blue Heart Campaign. Working to End Human Trafficking 

https://www.unodc.org/blueheart/en/about-us.html

Now more than ever, it is crucial to share this uplifting message with people world wide. Upgrading my gear and getting out on tour, is the most proactive route that I can take, right now, to get this vision moving forward.
So Mahalo for Supporting This Conscious Music Movement Today. I invite you to join in this journey on whatever level feels good in Your Heart .
A lot goes into Being a Musical Messenger , it is a full time job! 
There are Production and Performance Gear , Video Production, Touring Costs, Hiring A Band, Artist Development Training.
If you wish to help with these costs, you will receive the debut album, along with other perks like artwork and concert performances .
Ultimately I am fulfilling my life's purpose, which is to be of service to humanity through these musical offerings on topics near and dear to my heart. Honestly,I can think of no greater gift.
Feel Free to stay tuned for journal entry updates, also you can reach out to me on Facebook for upcoming shows in a town near you. 
I would be so grateful if you would please, share this video with your world.


 
Mahalo Ke Akua, and
 Aloha, Mi'ka Moon
 
"May The Eros Of The Earth Bless You," John O'Donahue.
 
 
 
 

RECENT ACCOMPLISHMENTS :Opened for Nahko Bear & Medicine For The People HOMEGROWN FESTIVAL
2016 * Released FIRST FULL LENGTH LIVE ALBUM SEPTEMBER 2016 * Released first four song LP June , 2016 * Opened for XAVIER RUDD at MANAFEST 2016
* Played on KKCR HANALEI “ KAUAI LIVE ” MAY & AUGUST 2016 * Opened for DEYA DOVA twice, DECEMBER 2015
PERFORMING WEEKLY: Saturday Nights 7-9 pm Princeville , & Kilauea Art walks UPCOMING EVENTS : Announcing Mi’ka Moon’s First Tour! A Conscious Music Movement May- August 2017
Reach Out to Mi’ka Moon :  mikamoonmusic@gmail.com Mi’ka Moon on Facebook - Mi’ka Moon Music on Instagram www.mikamoon.bandcamp.com
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

And for your curiosity please feel free to explore further down the page to find out more details...
 
*****
 

I want to express my deep gratitude to my husband Quinn for all your support.
You have been an unshakeable pillar of love and strength  by my side through it all. I love you so much !  To all my angels, guides and guardians, to the great spirit ,Mahalo Nui Loa.

 
 

Where am I going?
I am planning the shows based on people's request to have me come to their town. I will be performing festivals, cafe's , and house gatherings so far . I am currently working with people in California, Oregon, and Canada to anchor in the schedule based upon what we come up with as a collective.
Who's Going with me?
I am currently planning this as a solo tour with the intention of meeting up with some other friends to form a whole band at specific venues for specific shows.  Quinn will be joining me throughout .

Cost breakdown:
 
Hybrid Tour Vehicle $10,000
 Fuel, & Flights $4500
 

Production and performance gear , including macbook pro, interface,headphones, Nord 5D61 Stage piano, accessories (case,pedals,cords,bench,stand). Cost $5000
Anything raised above and beyond these costs will go to Blue Heart Campaign. Working to End Human Trafficking 
https://www.unodc.org/blueheart/en/about-us.html

story:
Katie Bradley & Chris Corcoran

I am launching a brand new album called 'C'est la vie' with one of the UK's most exciting and inventive guitarists, Chris Corcoran. Chris is an incredible artist who has been featured in Guitarist Magazine, and is internationally noted for his innovation and authenticity as a composer and musician. In the past few years we have received overwhelming support from you at live shows and festivals in the UK and Europe. In 2013 and 2015 I received nominations for songwriting in The British Blues Awards (with Dudley Ross) and your votes counted towards an amazing adventure. Both of my albums have been championed by British Blues legend Paul Jones who phoned to request a track for his BBC Blues show . The track was called 'I hear the river' and upon this airplay it entered the i-tunes chart at no.7 shoulder to shoulder with Blues giants Son house and Seasick Steve,  a thrilling achievement for a self-release!. In 2015 I was nominated for 'Female vocalist of the year' and awarded 'Songwriter of the year'  in the BBA’s for my second album  Anchor Baby Sessions which you can buy from my site katiebradley.co.uk

The new album C'est la vie is truly is 100% original, a multi dimensional record  drawing on our passion for traditional Blues and Roots whilst continuing the traditions through experiences and bringing them to you bound by infectious grooves and melodies. The musicians on the album are  Chris Corcoran (guitar), Jamie Lawrence (Double Bass) and Mike Thorne (Drums). We will also have world class guests with Paul Jobson on keys and Paul Elliott on percussion making this an exceptional record ready for worldwide release. The album is being recorded at the brilliant  Rimshot Studios in Kent, renowned for award winning records and recording artist's and so we are in the best possible hands with Mike Thorne behind the desk as well as on the drums. The studio is perfection as it offers authentic microphones and expertly sourced recording equipment, ensuring  techniques that are reminiscent of the old recording companies such as Stax and Chess.

What We Need & What You Get

I have already invested what I can to the album to this point,  so now we need your additional help to complete the process ready for release. In effect you are receiving the album in advance as a pre-order, with great bonuses and unique gifts available  to this campaign as 'perks'. Thankyou for contributing and contributing to this venture, making it happen for us – not mentioning ordering a great present or a gift for yourself!

We are aiming to raise £3000 to cover :

  • Final studio session with special guests
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Artwork
  • CD production

 

Risks & Challenges

We really hope we can make the goal, it is a little nerve wracking venturing into the unknown but we are confident that we are offering a record that is unique, that showcases some amazing talent together for the first time. I believe in seize the day and offer my thanks to you for reading this far and for helping us make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it would be greatly helpful if you could

  • Put word out on social media, sharing our posts about the campaign
  • Share our campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Thankyou so much! Katie & Chris

story:
WHAT’S MY STORY?

I’m Leigh Taylor, a singer/songwriter, voiceover artist, worship leader, husband and father.  I’ve been working on some new songs for quite a while now and a few years ago, I figured it was time to head into the studio.

But in late 2014, I was diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer.  However, one surgery and 39 radiation treatments later, I am finally ready to get back to work on this project.  In fact, I can’t wait.  I’ve been practicing these new songs with several musicians, but the two main guys are Ray “Piki” Moreno and John Simons. I can tell you it’s been a lot of fun and I’m looking forward to pushing that record button. 

With an independent project like this, you have the creative freedom. Now, I’m trying to put together a unique album of Christian based originals, which I hope will appeal to a wide audience. However, there is a huge financial burden that comes with creative freedom, especially since a lot of people don't 'buy' albums anymore.

SO WHAT DO I NEED?

I need to raise about $38,500 to fund this CD project. This would go towards things like recording, mixing, mastering, paying musicians and studio engineers, artwork, printing costs, CD production, promotional material and the whole idea of trying to get this project to a wider audience. 

That's right, it's not cheap to make and market a recording for all the reasons listed above, and more, but that’s what it takes to put out something of quality. Something I can be proud of. Something I think you’ll love.

WHAT DO YOU GET?

You get to be a part of the production team by helping to fund this project. And you get to choose from a variety of perks depending on your level of participation. CDs, hats, shirts, bit-o-honey, house concerts, etc.

SPREAD THE WORD!

Please help spread the word to all your friends and family.  You can easily share this campaign by using the buttons on the Indiegogo site, which will help you spread the word via Facebook, etc.  You can also share by e-mail or even word of mouth!  The more that get involved, the quicker it will be to bring this project to completion.  

I’ll do my best to keep you updated on the project as we go.

 

God bless, and many thanks for your love, support and prayers!!!

Leigh

story:
The Skinny

Tall Walls is a six-piece band formed shortly before Summer And Music's Buskerfest 2015 competition (Long Beach, CA) a little over a year ago. Well, we won, and we've been performing and recording ever since. Our new CD documents this time. The recording  was paid for with our Buskerfest winnings.  Those winnings, however, didn't cover everything, so we came out of our own pockets to get our debut out in the world. Obviously we're hoping to recoup our costs through album sales.

Mostly, though, we just want to share what we've done. This campaign was created as a way to share our story and project with you -- friends, families, and fans old and new. You contribute simply by buying the CD (comes with a digital download). We'll mail it to you free of charge.

Want a sample before you lay your good money down? Fair enough. Here's "Government Boy" (which has turned out to be a bit more topical than we'd hoped).

If you have a little extra cash to spend, we'll bring our entire album-release-show set to you -- your backyard, your living room, wherever you say (within Los Angeles and Orange Counties, anyway). 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our story by reposting this campaign on your feed using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Follow us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/tallwalls/?fref=ts).

story:
Who is May Hemmer?

May is known as "The Sassiest Thing in New Orleans" and has been dubbed the "Cocoa Barbie" by Vita DeVoid of Florida. This lady has a larger than life personality and has been gracing the stages with nerdlesque, neo burlesque, and much more since 2011.  A member of the Storyville Starlettes and The Bluestockings, she performs regularly at Burlesque Ballroom,Big Deal Burlesque, and many more independent shows and private events around NOLA.   

With that said, May has started her own production by the name of Haus of MayHem that has traveled to Jackson, MS and will soon have a base in New Orleans. She has also begun a monthly production called Bohemian Burlesque at United Bakery Gallery which is the last Thursday of every month in NOLA.  

Her solo debut has included performances at the Southern Fried Burlesque Festival, Arizona Burlesque Festival, Great Southern Exposure, and many other productions for the troupe BurlEscapades in Phoenix, AZ.  She was recognized in 2015, as the Master of Tassels in the Louisiana Regional Burlypicks and is both the 2016 Shimmy Showdown Siobhan Atomica Brown Noser and Jeez Loueez Boo Bitch Bye award winner.

What I Need & What You Get

What I am looking for is a start to get my swag and merchandise off off the ground.  I have finally reached a part of my career where I want to provide fans with personalized items that they can have.  But why?  The funds I had saved to go towards these items now have to go to replacing damaged costumes due to a break in.

But what will you get in return?  Anything from personal thank you to a ticket to the next show I am in.  I want to be able to thank those who support me and help me grow as a performer as well as a business woman.

The Impact

I am wanting to help spread the awareness of more performers of color (POC) around the country and eventually the world.  I am also aiming to play my part in the POC pin up community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?  Here's other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends
  • Follow me on instagram/twitter at @mayhemmer504
  • Like my fan page at https://www.facebook.com/mayhemmer504
  • Attend my shows <3
