story:
Hello everyone,

My name is Abelita Mateus, and I'm a pianist, singer, composer, and educator based in the New York area.

I am an independent, self-funded artist, and the production of an album entails many costs: paying the musicians, the recording studio, mixing, mastering, registering the songs, printing, art and promotion.

And this where we really need your help!

I would like to invite you to join Project Vivenda by pre-ordering the album, or choosing one of the other exciting rewards such as an intimate private performance, private lessons, exciting Brazilian earrings, and much, much more.

Please join me in sharing this music with the world; I need your support to make Vivenda a reality!

Thank You!

 

Abelita Mateus

www.abelita.com.br

 

Olá a todos,

 

Meu nome é Abelita Mateus,  eu sou um pianista, cantora, compositora e educadora,  morando em NY.

Eu sou um artista independente, auto-financiada, e a produção de um álbum implica em muitos custos: pagar os músicos, o estúdio de gravação, mix e masterização, registro de canções, impressão, arte e promoção.

Por tudo isso eu  realmente preciso da sua ajuda!

Gostaria de convidá-lo a juntar-se ao Projeto Vivenda através da pré-encomenda do álbum, ou escolher uma das outras emocionantes recompensas, como shows, aulas particulares, brincos feitos de Capim Dourado e muito, muito mais.

Por favor junte-se a mim para compartilhar essa música com o mundo; Preciso de seu apoio para tornar Vivenda uma realidade!

 

Obrigada!

 

Abelita Mateus

Www.abelita.com.br

 

ABOUT 

I was born and raised in São Paulo, Brazil, and I’m passionate about Brazilian music and jazz. I began my music studies with classical piano in my teens, and gradually developed a passion for jazz. In Brazil I was lucky to have such great teachers as Rogério Zaghi, Ogair Junior, Edmundo Cassis, Paulo Braga. My passion for jazz drew me to the U.S. to pursue my Masters Degree in Jazz Performance. I was very blessed to get an assistantship at William Paterson University, where I had the unique opportunity to study with Mulgrew Miller, James Weidman, Armen Donelian, and other great teachers.

Abelita Mateus and Mulgrew Miller

In Brazil I had the chance to perform with great artists as Vinicius Dorin, Raul de Souza and Hermeto Pascoal.

Abelita Mateus and Hermeto Pascoal

Living in New York since 2012, I’ve performed in several different groups with great musicians. I’m the pianist and singer of the Chameleon Music Trio, with Phillip Gillette on drums and Daseul Kim on bass. I’m also the pianist for the Dizzy Gillespie Afro-Cuban Experience, directed by Dizzy Gillespie alumni John Lee.

I have performed recently at international venues including the Blue Note New York, The Kennedy Center in Washington D.C., The Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles, Yoshi’s Jazz Club in San Francisco, Ronnie Scott’s in London, the Luna Classics and Musig Am Zurisee Jazz Festivals in Switzerland, as well as various venues in São Paulo, Brazil. In the New York area, I have been playing with the world-class musicians John Lee, Claudio Roditi, Tommy Campbell, Sharel Cassity, the Dizzy Gillespie Big Band, Peter Slavov, Alex Kautz, Matt Marantz.

I became immersed in the jazz scene and I’m applying the “new sounds” into my recent work as a performer and composer.

In September 2016 I composed new songs and decided to record my latest project titled "Vivenda," which is a mix of some of my original songs and compositions of the great Brazilian composers Tom Jobim, Djavan and Gilberto Gil. I produced the project with the assistance of one of my favorite musicians, the wonderful Romero Lubambo. "Vivenda" features some dear friends and amazing musicians, Romero Lubambo on guitar, Claudio Roditi on trumpet, Itaiguara Brandão on bass, Portinho on drums, Adriano Santos on drums and Phillip Gillette on percussion.

 

Vivenda is the title track of the album, and it means “home” in Portuguese. The lyrics express my quest to understand my feelings about the fact that my new home is so far from my family, friends, and my country. It's about recognizing that my heart is “my true home, the place where all I love is, forever in me." Another composition, “Acorda João,” is a reflection on the political situation in Brazil. In a very simple way I enquire why we squander the resources of country, as political corruption humiliates us year after year. We, the people of Brazil, have the power to change the situation, and I hope one day “we will learn to better choose who runs the country”. The chorinho “Família Brandão” is a tribute to one side of my family in Brazil, the “Brandão” family, born and raised in a small, poor town in the state of Bahia. They are a amazing example of strength and courage in my life.

 

This album is a celebration of Brazilian music, and I chose to record some of my favorite Brazilian standards, which represent the richness of our musical heritage. I chose the Djavan compositions “Pedro Brasil,” “Capim,” “Obi,” “Avião,” and “Esquinas,” which make this album partially a tribute to Djavan. I also recorded the Jobim compositions “Discussão” and “Brigas Nunca Mais,” and Gilberto Gil’s “Amor até o Fim,” which means “Love until the End.”

I believe that the music I make is a result of everything that I nurture within myself. I’ve had the privilege to have many wonderful and very different people in my life; through them I became who I am, and their various influences have led me to realize my dreams. I thank deeply all of my family and friends for sharing their life and dreams with me!

Speaking of dreams, Vivenda is a project that I’ve been dreaming of for a long time. This project is an attempt to put into words and music the feeling of living in a new country, a new town, and a new house, but knowing that the place where I was born Abelita Mateus and grew up will always be my home, and will be in my heart forever.

 

"Abelita Mateus has so many of the qualities that are important for any successful musician. Her piano artistry is remarkable, and she is a talented composer and vocalist. Abelita's intelligence and heart are also expressed through her music. 

She is part of the next generation of great Brazilian musicians.  With all this talent, Abelita is someone to really keep your eyes on"​

Romero Lubambo

 

"Abelita Mateus is a young Brazilian musician who did the right thing: she came to the United States to attend music school, graduated, then decided to make the US her new home; her career is already blooming, and she is a talent that all of us should keep an eye on. Congratulations Abelita!"​

Claudio Roditi

 

"Playing with Abelita is a bliss. We had a great time bringing into life her beautiful composition "Saudades do Brasil," as well as re-interpreting Gilberto Gil's famous "Amor até O Fim." Abelita's musicality is both delicate and thundering, and I consider "Vivenda" an album to be not only special but also important for this new generation of Brazilian Jazz"​​

Portinho

 

"It is always a pleasure to work with Abelita. Coming from Brazil with a naturally swinging samba groove, her experience in the US has enriched her capacity for expression in the jazz idiom. I was honored to participate in Abelita’s new album, Vivenda, in which she also demonstrates her skills as a singer, composer, and arranger. In our recording session with the greats Romero Lubambo, Claudio Roditi, Portinho, and Adriano Santos, Abelita had the right dosage of leadership skills, while allowing us to freely express ourselves as musicians".

Itaiguara

 

I want to give a special thanks to Josh Dunn  for helping me taking pictures and assisting me at the recording day, and to Phil Engsberg, for recording and editing one of the videos.

 

 

​

​
story_txt: Hello everyone,My name is Abelita Mateus, and I'm a pianist, singer, composer, and educator based in the New York area.I am an independent, self-funded artist, and the production of an album entails many costs: paying the musicians, the recording studio, mixing, mastering, registering the songs, printing, art and promotion.And this where we really need your help!I would like to invite you to join Project Vivenda by pre-ordering the album, or choosing one of the other exciting rewards such as an intimate private performance, private lessons, exciting Brazilian earrings, and much, much more.Please join me in sharing this music with the world; I need your support to make Vivenda a reality!Thank You! Abelita Mateuswww.abelita.com.br Olá a todos, Meu nome é Abelita Mateus,  eu sou um pianista, cantora, compositora e educadora,  morando em NY.Eu sou um artista independente, auto-financiada, e a produção de um álbum implica em muitos custos: pagar os músicos, o estúdio de gravação, mix e masterização, registro de canções, impressão, arte e promoção.Por tudo isso eu  realmente preciso da sua ajuda!Gostaria de convidá-lo a juntar-se ao Projeto Vivenda através da pré-encomenda do álbum, ou escolher uma das outras emocionantes recompensas, como shows, aulas particulares, brincos feitos de Capim Dourado e muito, muito mais.Por favor junte-se a mim para compartilhar essa música com o mundo; Preciso de seu apoio para tornar Vivenda uma realidade! Obrigada! Abelita MateusWww.abelita.com.br ABOUT I was born and raised in São Paulo, Brazil, and I’m passionate about Brazilian music and jazz. I began my music studies with classical piano in my teens, and gradually developed a passion for jazz. In Brazil I was lucky to have such great teachers as Rogério Zaghi, Ogair Junior, Edmundo Cassis, Paulo Braga. My passion for jazz drew me to the U.S. to pursue my Masters Degree in Jazz Performance. I was very blessed to get an assistantship at William Paterson University, where I had the unique opportunity to study with Mulgrew Miller, James Weidman, Armen Donelian, and other great teachers.Abelita Mateus and Mulgrew MillerIn Brazil I had the chance to perform with great artists as Vinicius Dorin, Raul de Souza and Hermeto Pascoal.Abelita Mateus and Hermeto PascoalLiving in New York since 2012, I’ve performed in several different groups with great musicians. I’m the pianist and singer of the Chameleon Music Trio, with Phillip Gillette on drums and Daseul Kim on bass. I’m also the pianist for the Dizzy Gillespie Afro-Cuban Experience, directed by Dizzy Gillespie alumni John Lee.I have performed recently at international venues including the Blue Note New York, The Kennedy Center in Washington D.C., The Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles, Yoshi’s Jazz Club in San Francisco, Ronnie Scott’s in London, the Luna Classics and Musig Am Zurisee Jazz Festivals in Switzerland, as well as various venues in São Paulo, Brazil. In the New York area, I have been playing with the world-class musicians John Lee, Claudio Roditi, Tommy Campbell, Sharel Cassity, the Dizzy Gillespie Big Band, Peter Slavov, Alex Kautz, Matt Marantz.I became immersed in the jazz scene and I’m applying the “new sounds” into my recent work as a performer and composer.In September 2016 I composed new songs and decided to record my latest project titled "Vivenda," which is a mix of some of my original songs and compositions of the great Brazilian composers Tom Jobim, Djavan and Gilberto Gil. I produced the project with the assistance of one of my favorite musicians, the wonderful Romero Lubambo. "Vivenda" features some dear friends and amazing musicians, Romero Lubambo on guitar, Claudio Roditi on trumpet, Itaiguara Brandão on bass, Portinho on drums, Adriano Santos on drums and Phillip Gillette on percussion. Vivenda is the title track of the album, and it means “home” in Portuguese. The lyrics express my quest to understand my feelings about the fact that my new home is so far from my family, friends, and my country. It's about recognizing that my heart is “my true home, the place where all I love is, forever in me." Another composition, “Acorda João,” is a reflection on the political situation in Brazil. In a very simple way I enquire why we squander the resources of country, as political corruption humiliates us year after year. We, the people of Brazil, have the power to change the situation, and I hope one day “we will learn to better choose who runs the country”. The chorinho “Família Brandão” is a tribute to one side of my family in Brazil, the “Brandão” family, born and raised in a small, poor town in the state of Bahia. They are a amazing example of strength and courage in my life. This album is a celebration of Brazilian music, and I chose to record some of my favorite Brazilian standards, which represent the richness of our musical heritage. I chose the Djavan compositions “Pedro Brasil,” “Capim,” “Obi,” “Avião,” and “Esquinas,” which make this album partially a tribute to Djavan. I also recorded the Jobim compositions “Discussão” and “Brigas Nunca Mais,” and Gilberto Gil’s “Amor até o Fim,” which means “Love until the End.”I believe that the music I make is a result of everything that I nurture within myself. I’ve had the privilege to have many wonderful and very different people in my life; through them I became who I am, and their various influences have led me to realize my dreams. I thank deeply all of my family and friends for sharing their life and dreams with me!Speaking of dreams, Vivenda is a project that I’ve been dreaming of for a long time. This project is an attempt to put into words and music the feeling of living in a new country, a new town, and a new house, but knowing that the place where I was born Abelita Mateus and grew up will always be my home, and will be in my heart forever. "Abelita Mateus has so many of the qualities that are important for any successful musician. Her piano artistry is remarkable, and she is a talented composer and vocalist. Abelita's intelligence and heart are also expressed through her music. She is part of the next generation of great Brazilian musicians.  With all this talent, Abelita is someone to really keep your eyes on"​Romero Lubambo "Abelita Mateus is a young Brazilian musician who did the right thing: she came to the United States to attend music school, graduated, then decided to make the US her new home; her career is already blooming, and she is a talent that all of us should keep an eye on. Congratulations Abelita!"​Claudio Roditi "Playing with Abelita is a bliss. We had a great time bringing into life her beautiful composition "Saudades do Brasil," as well as re-interpreting Gilberto Gil's famous "Amor até O Fim." Abelita's musicality is both delicate and thundering, and I consider "Vivenda" an album to be not only special but also important for this new generation of Brazilian Jazz"​​Portinho "It is always a pleasure to work with Abelita. Coming from Brazil with a naturally swinging samba groove, her experience in the US has enriched her capacity for expression in the jazz idiom. I was honored to participate in Abelita’s new album, Vivenda, in which she also demonstrates her skills as a singer, composer, and arranger. In our recording session with the greats Romero Lubambo, Claudio Roditi, Portinho, and Adriano Santos, Abelita had the right dosage of leadership skills, while allowing us to freely express ourselves as musicians".Itaiguara I want to give a special thanks to Josh Dunn  for helping me taking pictures and assisting me at the recording day, and to Phil Engsberg, for recording and editing one of the videos.  ​​

story:
KRISTS SARŽANTS

is a Latvian composer who takes his inspiration from classical, jazz and film music. Studied classical and jazz piano and composition with Raimonds Petrauskis, Andris Dzenītis, Søren Møller and the others, in 2018 Krists was nominated for the Nic Gotham Award for the contribution to jazz music and jazz life in Latvia. In his music Krists uses modern classical music techniques, jazz improvisation, polyphonic melodies and film music inspired harmonies, with his recordings distributed worldwide at the largest European jazz gathering “Jazzahead! 2017” and included in the official “Jazz in Latvia 2018” CD compilation.

"THEN AND NOW"

"THEN AND NOW" is an album project Krists has been working on for quite some time. It is a compilation of Krists' best compositions in new arrangements and instrumentations for a specially gathered line-up of his friends, colleagues and some renowned musicians from Latvia and Denmark – Evilena Protektore, Sonora Vaice, Ieva Kerēvica, Dāvis Jurka, Matias Fischer-Mogensen to name a few, all of them have agreed to participate in this project and create something unforgettable this July. In addition to the CD we're offering a small album-sized book with never before released stories about each composition, translations, lyrics, info about the musicians, pictures and much more to dig in while listening to the album.

THE RECORDING

As we all know (or might guess at least), it takes a lot to release an album, where even composing the music seems to be the easiest part. Top it up with studio rentals, mixing, mastering, printing, cover art and the other designs... It all takes time, patience and money, so we're reaching out to whoever believes in Krists' music and is willing to be a part of making all of this true.  Some bonuses are on us: from signed CDs with personal thank you's, sheet music, limited prints with signatures, up to a free two-set concert, alternate takes with studio conversations and even a reserved table with a bottle of champagne for a romantic evening on July 24th's Krists Saržants Quintet concert at Berga Bazārs in Riga, Latvia.

THE RESULT

"THEN AND NOW" combines jazz and classical musicians, as well as both Latvian and Danish artists, and we are truly happy for such friendly collaboration between cultures, genres, ages, ideas. In fact, it's a small orchestra, rich with creativity and passion. "THEN AND NOW" is a road all of us take from when we begin whatever it is we begin – business, career in music, family and life itself. This is a story about us then and us now, and that is what this album symbolises – the journey we begin when we take our first breath and the voice we've developed in this journey.
We are ready to be heard!

 

other ways you can help

Share and spread the word about this album, its philosophy and values. Every share, every kind word and every word of support counts, you wouldn't believe how much every little thing is worth – your help will be appreciated!

story:
Hi, I am Jeff Aug, an American guitarist and Guinness(TM) World Record holder living in Germany and currently active as guitarist for my band APE SHIFTER, as well as a solo acoustic instrumental fingerstyle guitarist, the guitarist/vocalist in the rockin´ acoustic country blues duo Dead Tuna, and the guitarist for the British artist Anne Clark -- who is currently taking a break from touring.  

I have released albums with my rock band Sorry About Your Daughter in the 90´s, as well as two acoustic instrumental albums with my duo Floating Stone, 6 solo acoustic instrumental fingerstyle guitar albums, three albums as the guitarist for Anne Clark, one DVD with Anne Clark, and have been featured as a guest on the Atari Teenage Riot album "Is This Hyperreal?" among others.

As a solo artist, I have set the Guinness(TM) World Record for "the most concerts performed in different countries in 24 hours" twice (2009, 2012); have toured as support for Allan Holdsworth, Soft Machine, Carl Verheyen, Alex Skolnick Trio, Johnny A., moe., Scott Henderson, Greg Howe, and many others; been featured on the NPR program "Weekend Edition," and reached #1 position on the iTunes Acoustic Music album charts.

Releasing solo albums without a major label backing your production, marketing, and promotion is not an easy thing to do, especially when producing the recording on a professional level is expensive, most PR campaigns are out of reach, and album sales are very low in general.

At the end of the day, I am still motivated to get this album out.  The first APE SHIFTER album got rave reviews.  As a result of its release, APE SHIFTER performed concerts and festivals in Germany, Switzerland, and The Netherlands.  We played shows with The Skull (ex-Trouble), Mörglbl, and White Cowbell Oklahoma.  Ape Shifter also performed at such esteemed German festivals as Burg Herzberg Festival, Free n Easy, OBOA, and Festival Kult!  The new APE SHIFTER album "Ape Shifter ll" showcases the best electric guitar playing I have ever recorded and the compositions will make bodies move!

We are now reaching out to you – my friends, fans and supporters – to help us with the funding of the new album prior to its release, and at the same time to give you the chance to be the first to acquire the new album via a pre-order.

In addition to the APE SHIFTER debut release, Ape Shifter T-Shirt, and APE SHIFTER ll (cd and vinyl!), this campaign will offer you the possibility of bargain deals on my last two solo albums "Living Room Sessions" and "Wedding Song."

story:
For as long as I can remember, I have enjoyed telling and hearing stories. I honestly believe that the most powerful stories we can tell are the ones which speak truthfully of the struggles and triumphs we have faced. If we are willing to make ourselves vulnerable, we can connect with others in their pain and also celebrate with them in their victories.

Having spent 3 or 4 years coming up with words and melodies in my quiet time, in the summer of 2015 I taught myself some chords and instantly felt a release and a certainty that this was what I should be pursuing. Every time I have completed a song, God has given me a clear word to share it with a specific person and I now believe that He is telling me to go further and make them available to everyone. At the beginning of 2016 I launched a Kickstarter campaign to record an EP and although it raised almost £800, it was ultimately 'unsuccessful' and therefore I didn't receive the money. I believed at the time that the only way I could make a product I would be happy with was to raise the full amount but I have since realised that that was probably pride (and a little fear) talking and I am now excited to see what this campaign will bring.

I would be lying if I said I wasn't nervous about this project but more than anything I am so excited to share these songs that have been on my heart for so long. My desire is that these songs would bring peace to those who hear them.

As of now I am working with a small group of musicians and friends to pull together arrangements for the songs and finalise the details of how this EP will sound. Once all the funds are raised, the next stage will be to begin rehearsing with the musicians and finally hold a live event to finalise the EP recording.

The money raised will go towards paying musicians expenses, sound production costs/equipment and costs of designing and producing hard copies of the EP (including cover art and producing CDs).

Thank you all so much for your support up to this point and thank you in advance for your donations! I'm excited to make this EP with you!

Do you want a copy of the album? On compact disc?? In advance??? Then this deal is for you!

(If you'd like a digital copy please use our pre-order on iTunes. Details coming soon)

Instructions:

  • Select the option that seems right for you.
  • Follow the instructions to complete the transaction.
  • Call someone and tell them you love them!

The Urgency

Ok folks, in order to get the CD to you before the release date, you've only got 16 days to do this thing! Party on!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends and family about the band!
  • Come to a show!
  • Share this campaign on your social media (or via email)!

And that's all there is to it.

Track listing:

  1.  Softer Side
  2. Dance With the One (Who Brought You Here)
  3. Dreamer's Heart
  4. A Little Rain
  5. Suitcases and Truck Stops
  6. Gypsy
  7. Better Than Gold
  8. Don't You Be Lonely
  9. Big Chief and the Medicine Man
  10. When I'm With Suzie (I Do What I Want)
  11. Loving You

Produced by Mike Landolt

story: The garage converted studio in the second part of this video is where I will be creating an album with producer Nathan Agenbroad.  He has brought my music to a deeper level which allows me to strive for perfection.  "She Can Take You There" is the first song on my 11 track album.

story:
Hello all you beautiful, amazing Foes!  

First, I want to thank you all for supporting me and my music through all my various projects!

 Many of you reading this (Hi mom!) have already spent the last five years coming out to see me perform, streaming my music, buying various merchandise, and in general have helped me grow tremendously as a musician and person. Now I come to you all, wig in hand, asking once again for your support.

My producer (Joe Pom) and I have been working on The Foes of Fern’s album "Girl In All My Songs" since the summer of 2016 at good old Telegraph Hill Records. As we learned from producing “Daydreaming” by Airacuda, there is so much that goes into the creation of an album. Right now we have most of the music written/recorded and your donations will go towards finishing the record. But the real work comes after we’ve finished recording.

There is much more to making an album than just recording the music!

I have been on many different albums and projects throughout the year and what we’ve learned is that the success of any musical project depends on how it’s promoted.

With your donations, The Foes will be able to:

  • Complete our vision for this album
  • Create music videos to tell the story of the music
  • Release and promote the album properly
  • Push our music to be heard by new audiences 
  • Get  unique artwork made
  • Finalize the production
  • Make more merchandise: 
    • CDs
    • Vinyl
    • T-Shirts
    • Stickers
    • Sushi with Fern: Seasons 1-3 on bluray

We've created some incredible perks to thank you all for helping us out with realizing our dreams with this project. There are so many personal opportunities from Fern himself:

  • Get an extra song at the Fern hosted open mic @ The Inkwell
  • The Murtaugh Sample Pack containing Fern's recording secret weapon on all his tracks
  • Baby Photos of Fern and all of his Foes
  • Fern-aby: Volume I - Acoustical lullaby series performed by a sleepy Fern for your relaxation
  • Wig/Beard to look like Fern (featured in upcoming "The Monkey" music video) 
  • Fern will teach you Music Theory, Guitar/Bass Performance, Songwriting/Arranging, or Chess
  • Grab a bite to eat with Fern and appear on the critically acclaimed Facebook Live Series "Sushi With Fern" 
  • Have Fern track guitar at your next studio session
  • A personal acoustic concert featuring Fern
  • Let Fern produce your next EP
  • Shave Fern's Beard

For those of you who have enjoyed The Foes’ live performances, this album is the fully imagined vision of that: tons of energy & excitement with thoroughly fleshed out productions & arrangements.

"The Girl in All My Songs" is turning into a 13-song hailstorm that continues to grow each day. We’ve already recorded a live string trio (look for them in updates of our project video!), a few horns and plan to do a woodwind session.  

We want to make these songs huge!

We want the listener to constantly dig into the music and hear something new they didn’t catch the first time.  Most importantly, we want to get so famous after releasing all of this that we can entirely disown all of you, go buy an island somewhere, and live off the royalties of Bike Song...Seriously though, any and all support you choose to give to us is incredibly important and greatly appreciated. We love you for making The Foes a part of your life.

Fear the beard - No friends, only Foes!

story:
My Story

My name is Pauline Schantzer, I’m a comedienne/actress originally from Philadelphia and currently residing in Los Angeles. For the past few years I’ve been performing standup at Flappers Comedy club and creating my own material. I’ve created the web series, Judy and Me (www.youtube.com/judyandme) This past October a short play that I wrote and starred in for Bobby Moresco’s show, Working 2017  received the following review:

“The brilliantly convincing and versatile Pauline Schantzer" - The Tolucan Times

In November I created the comedy music video “Dear Hanukkah:” https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0JyYsBo-p30&amp...

I’m making my second comedy music video, “I’mma Real Jew” that I'm starring in and need your help funding the video!

What I Need

I need to raise $2000, these funds will pay for:

  • Pre-production
  • Crew
  • Location fees
  • Art/props/costume budget
  • Post Production
  • Marketing the video
  • Feeding everyone on set

I ALSO ACCEPT VENMO, USE THIS EMAIL: pschantzer@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't what it's all about. Here are other ways you can be apart of the “I’mma Real Jew” music video:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Share my “Dear Hanukkah” music video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0JyYsBo-p30&t=9s

OR if you have any of the following, contact me at pschantzer@gmail.com

  • Access to Hasidic Jewish clothing
  • Access to a church/or a party hall in Los Angeles 
  • Snack items that you’d like to donate such as chips, cookies, popcorn, trail mix, water bottles, soda cans, coffee etc…a fed crew is a happy crew!

Please share the campaign and encourage others to donate. Any support, monetary or otherwise, is greatly appreciated :)

story:
Since Christmas 2020 we have taught over 1500 grown-ups in the UK who have never learnt an instrument how to play at least one song on the ukulele

...and over 200 went on to join our Awesome Ukulele Accelerator Programme so that they could have fun playing their favourite songs with their friends and family...

...and now we are going GLOBAL!

...because we are determined to make the world a better place, one ukulele player at a time.
We're taking you to The Happy Place!

 
and again...
  1. The more people play ukuleles, the more fun we have.
  2. The more fun we have, the better the world will be.
  3. We all save the world!!! It really is that simple!​

How do we do it?

...by teaching you... just one song...in the...

3-Day Awesome Workshop (less than half-price!!)

During our Awesome Workshop you learn how to tune and hold your uke, change confidently between chords, play your first song, participate in an online concert, and realise that you too can have fun making music together with others in a community. Check out our reviews on Facebook.

When would you like to learn to play your song - either 'Lean on Me' or 'Rudolf'?

3rd October (learn how to tune live session), 4 - 6th the workshop, 7th concert.
The song: 'Lean on Me' by Bill Withers - because we all need a little help, sometimes!

or

13th December (learn how to tune) 14 - 16th workshop, 17th concert.
The song: 'Rudolf the Red-Nosed Reindeer'- it's a banger!!!

 

...and then we learn some more songs

6-Week Awesome Accelerator Programme (half-price!!)

2 sets of dates to choose from: October/November or January/February

Move from beginner to intermediate using our proven process of accelerated learning while playing songs by The Beatles, Elton John, Adele, Elvis, Van Morrison and many more. (Image: the learning platform) There's more information about the Accelerator on our website

 

 

The online learning is combined with live zoom elements and an amazing community aspect within a safe and private Facebook group where students support one another and form accountability bonds. Mindset coaching and singing coaching sessions help with the number ONE obstacle to learning something new as an adult: our emotions.

Whether you think you can, or you think you can't...
you are right!

...but we know learning the ukulele is just a process, and everyone can follow a process!

You just need to find someone that teaches a great process!

 

 

And The Awesome Ukulele Academy not only has that process but is raising funds to bring it to the rest of the world. The Workshop and Accelerator are hugely discounted for this fundraiser ONLY!!

More reviews on our FB page

 

You are never too old to learn an instrument (my mum’s just done the programme!)

Everyone has the capacity to enjoy making music  (you don’t need loads of ‘talent’!)

 

You don’t need hours of boring practice  (10-minutes a day can achieve wonders!)

 

 

No one gets left behind (because everyone learns at their own pace)

 

 

Other amusing perks...

  • Selling Awesome Ukulele Academy branded stuff at inflated designer prices (mugs, tea towels, bags etc)- but they're soooo cool!
  • Matt records a song of your choice - you decide who to dedicate the video to!
  • Matt composes and records you a song about anything you like, for anyone you like!
  • The big perk - The Daddy Of All Perks - is the largest investment but also the one that comes at high personal risk to me. It's the 'Buy A Uke For The Person That Really Needs To Become A Nicer Person' perk, Dial up the Niceness, buddy!. I will deliver a ukulele along with a personalised, dedicated song, detailing why they need a ukulele, to the person of your choice. This can be anyone in the English speaking world - a celebrity, a politician, your boss - whomever you want!*

For evidence of my song writing ability, please check out Penny the Prawn.

 

 

*If I can't make this happen within the year, we will either change the perk or give you your money back! Remember - I will be direct but not mean - we are all about niceness! And please, don't make it someone that might really hurt me!

But, if it's not in Europe or the UK, we might have to have a conversation about travel expenses!

All monies raised will be used for:

  • Saving the world

  • Expanding Matt's 'exotic' shirt collection

 

 

The Impact

At the start of lock-down last year I (Matt Parkin) was teaching music in a school – everything went online and we had to adapt. This went well, so well that I found my instrumental students were starting to achieve as much in 3 months as they used to in a year. This was due to a shift from teaching in the classes, to mentoring with access to good online resources. Then the parents wanted to know if they could have a go – and the rest is history!!

 

 
  • If you pre-purchase a place on the Workshop and Accelerator you will either be excited about doing the programme or be happy in the knowledge that you have gifted the joy of music to a fellow human – hurray!
  • We have a proven track record and established infrastructure that shows we can do this – check out the testimonials and our website. We are ready for world domination in a positive, life affirming way!
  • Whatever happens, we are spreading the love of music two more times before Christmas. The more money we raise, the more love we spread globally! It’s that simple!

 

 

 

'The Niceness Scheme'

Giving the gift of music to another human being is priceless.

We always have places on the Accelerator at greatly reduced prices for people that would benefit from learning the ukulele but can't afford the investment. Our scheme has helped burnt-out Covid nurses, people with light brain trauma, and those with depression. There is growing awareness of the positive effects on mental health from playing music and gifting the Accelerator to another person through our Niceness Scheme says 'Lean on Me' to a fellow human - well done!

You can also donate the cost of an Ortega Uke pack to our Save The World Campaign and we will ensure that another recycled ukulele gets to someone that needs it.

You can add either of 'The Niceness Scheme' options to your Perk at the checkout.

 

 

Ortega Keiki K2 Soprano Uke Pack

The Pack retails at around £64 / $88 / €75 and includes: Soprano ukulele, Headstock tuner, Soundhole hook strap/support, 5 medium picks and drawstring bag included. The Keiki K2 is a great beginners pack with the 'Peace' design by Italian street artist Guglielmo Gasloli. The ukulele is completely painted from head-stock to the body which gives it its very own character.

 

The Hugely Expensive 'Awesome Mug'

 It's a mug...it's hugely expensive... and it helps saves the world!

 

 

 

 

 

I helped save the World Bag

 Awesome 'Bag for Life'. 41cm x 39cm, 100% cotton

 

 

Cute Coasters (for the pricey mug)

4 cute coasters with our Awesome Avatars. Postage included.

 

 

Risk & Challenges

We have everything in place, and we know our process works, so our main challenge is letting people know what we are doing. So, even if you can’t pre-book a workshop or programme, you can buy a mug at huge expense, gift a tea towel or a bag for life, AND you can tell everyone you know – even your mum! My mum came on the last programme and she’s 74!

We have less than three weeks to make this happen - then we start the next launch for our first GLOBAL Awesome Accelerator Programme and the prices go back up! My, oh my - this is exciting!

 

Together we can be awesome!!!!

 

Tell your friends/family/colleagues. Follow us on social media, call people to our posts, and use the Indiegogo share tools! And together we can BE AWESOME! Let's save the world, one ukulele player at a time! Here's the sharing  link again:

https://igg.me/at/awesomeukulele

For more information or media inquiries email hello@theawesomeukuleleacademy.com

PLUS, a little secret...this is probably your only chance ever, to get the Awesome Ukulele Accelerator at this price. Just come and learn the ukulele - it's a laugh!

story:
'Shine' The Song :

'Shine' was inspired by our dear friend, Sara, whom was diagnosed with stage four cancer. 'Shine' was written to uplift her spirits and shed light in a time of darkness. Our song is universal and the meaning became more than its origination. We want to bring happiness and shed our light to others in the world that may be going through difficult times. We are hoping to raise $10,000 to fund our music video of which 40% proceeds will go to a nonprofit organization called 'Ready to Empower.' 'Ready to Empower' is dedicated to supporting women living in poverty by cultivating leaders within their communities in an effort to restore hope and foster self-reliance. To learn more about 'Ready to Empower,' please visit their website at  https://readytoempower.com

We are shooting August 22 and 23rd in Los Angeles, CA and Las Vegas, NV. 

Please follow our Instagram page @shinethesong #shinethesong 

Thank you kindly for your time.

Dina, Sara, and Danny

Who we are :

Dina Montefuscoli is a singer, actor, producer, and activist. She is dedicated to spreading love and awareness through her projects by shining light on nonprofit organizations, different ways to elevate the human condition, and adding in a few laughs! She is a lover of life and a genuine healer looking to take her vision to the next level! She joined the board of Ready To Empower in 2017. 

Danny Colandro goes by the name "Italiano aka DNA." He is a rap artist from Stamford, Ct.  He has been on the game since 1991 and has worked with the likes of Beanie Sigel, Bad Boy, and many other amazing artists . He has performed at SOB's and many other great venues. He continues to give you lyrics from his heart and life experiences!

Sara Weidel is a strong, independent, and loving woman. She is currently a student pursuing her dreams as an architect  excelling by making Dean's List and Honor Roll. She has the most adorable dog named Gigi and lives in Stamford, CT. She is passionate about her story and sharing it with others in hopes to bring them peace. She is super excited to see this project come to life while empowering women! 

Amanda Ready is the founder and CEO of Ready to Empower. She met a community of women in Costa Rica who she found to be jobless, uneducated, without adequate health care, living in poverty, and victims of abuse with no long-term support. Having experience working in social services and the mental health field, Amanda began offering mental health therapy to women to gain insight into their emotional challenges. After many sessions with the women, Amanda learned that not only mental health support was needed but also food, clothing, healthcare, education and employment opportunities.



Shout out to the amazing music production team; Serafin El Revolucionario and Bryan Spitzer.

Thank you to Jon Delice for filming our campaign video, please follow him on instagram @jdelice.

story:
WHO’S GOT MY BACK?

I am pleased to announce that Ben Elliott at American Showplace Music. (www.americanshowplacemusic.com) will be producing my new studio album!

I feel so blessed to be given this opportunity by Ben, and his team of professionals.

NOW!!!!!!

I need you on Team Hurricane Ruth!!! 

I don’t need a lot. I just need a little....... a little help from my friends. 

I am responsible for several of the promotional and marketing expenses. Both are very important when putting out a new record!!

Thank you in advance for your help!

Please check out the perks, and join Team Hurricane Ruth!

story:
My Next Solo Album

Hello friends! I'm Samantha Pearl - singer, songwriter, actress and painter. What I love most is connecting with people through my music and art. Evoking a range of emotions from creative endeavors has become my passion. I love to captivate an audience with the sole purpose of leading them on an emotional adventure through the music I create and the painting that I have made over my lifetime. I'm here to share some beautiful songs I have written oven the past year through my travels in Europe. I'm here to make music and art that helps people heal. My hope in creating this studio album with my friend Raymond Richards in Portland is to capture a special moment of transformation and transition. I have spent much time touring overseas in Europe over the past 3 years doing solo performances and performing with other musicians back in New Orleans. During Covid I have been working on growing and I would like to focus more during this time to stay as productive as possible. It's a bit scary, but mostly exciting. These are songs I've been waiting to share for some time now and with your help I can record them in a way that captures the true heart and soul of each one. 

For me and For You

  I had planned on making this album without financial support. I was proud to be working to reinvest in myself, but sometimes we have to take a step back and ask for help. After the unfortunate outbreak of Covid-19 the majority of my shows and tours were cancelled and moving forward with the album was no longer an option. A friend suggested I reach out to my beautiful fans and community and here we are! 

So here's the financial breakdown

$1000 to finish the album 

$ 500 for Music Video costs

$500 for mixing and mastering

$2000 for pressing CDs and Vinyl

$1500 for other Merch (T-shirts, Stickers, etc...) 

What I'm most excited about are the perks! They will span $10-$1,000 and there is something for everyone! Vinyl, T-Shirts, signed merch, original paintings, hand-written lyrics, song writing sessions, an intimate over-night listening party, and even a private house concert, and more.

I am so excited to finally bring these songs to life and share them with you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know during this difficult time some people will not be able to contribute. By sharing my campaign you are helping spread the word and that is a contribution all its own! Listening to my music on streaming platforms like Spotify is another great way to help! 

Thank you for all of your love and support!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know during this difficult time some people will not be able to contribute. By sharing my campaign you are helping spread the word and that is a contribution all its own! Listening to my music on streaming platforms like Spotify is another great way to help! 

Thank you for all of your love and support!

Thank you for all of your love and support!

story:
Rosalía Mowgli y la Escuela Encantada

Somos Rosalía Mowgli y la Escuela Encantada  y estamos haciendo un disco de música para niños. Creemos que los niños merecen escuchar buena música para disfrutar, aprender y desarrollarse como seres humanos.

We are Rosalía Mowgli and the Enchanted School and we are recording a music album for children. We believe children deserve good  music to enjoy, learn and develop as human beings.



Miembros.  La Escuela Encantada la conformamos Rosalía Mowgli (guitarra, voz, instrumentos raros), David Larrínaga (voz, guitarra, melódica y sitar), Luis Gálvez “Punto” (percusiones) y Marisol Bock (trompeta y voz).

Members. The Enchanted School's members are Rosalía Mowgli (guitar, vocals, strange instruments), David Larrínaga (vocals, guitar, melodica and sitar), Luis Gálvez “Punto” (percussion) and Marisol Bock (trumpet and vocals). 


Cultura de Paz. Con este proyecto queremos contribuir a una cultura de paz, que creemos comienza en las mentes y corazones de cada un@ de nosotr@s. Los mensajes que dan nuestras canciones son de compartir, ser feliz, tener curiosidad y de cuidar otras personas y la naturaleza.

Culture of Peace. With this project we want to contribute to a culture of peace, which we believe begins in the minds and hearts of every individual. The messages that we share through our songs are about sharing, being happy, feeling curiosity and caring for others and for nature.

(art: Lotus Pond 1998 by Nancy Jackson)

Instrumentos Tradicionales. Usamos instrumentos clásicos como la guitarra y la trompeta e instrumentos tradicionales de distintos lugares del mundo como la pandereta, el pandero cuadrado, el sitar, ocarinas precolombinas y arpas de boca.

Traditional Instruments. We use classical instruments such as guitars and trumpets and traditional instruments from different parts of the world like  the tambourine, the square drum, the sitar, pre-columbian ocarinas and mouth harps.




Instrumentos Raros. También usamos instrumentos inventados a partir de objetos como el manillar de bicicleta, el grifo o la muleta.


Strange Instruments. We invent instruments out of objects such a a bicycle handle, a water faucet and a crutch.




Nuestras Canciones. Tenemos canciones basadas en música tradicional española y latinoamericana, poemas de Juan Ramón Jiménez, Antonio Rubio y otras escritas por la compositora y directora del proyecto, Rosalía Mowgli. También hay canciones de otras culturas como In La kech, un saludo maya que significa "yo soy tú".

Our Songs. We have songs based on traditional Spanish and Latinamerican music, poems by Juan Ramón Jiménez and Antonio Rubio and other songs written by the composer and director of the project, Rosalía Mowgli. We also play songs from other cultures, like In La kech, which is a Mayan greeting that means "I am you".



Para qué son los fondos. Necesitamos financiar la producción del mismo disco que incuye la grabación en un estudio profesional, su edición y masterización y el diseño gráfico y también la imprenta del disco. Aunque somos conscientes de que la música se escucha más y más en formato digital, haremos un número limitado de discos físicos con un bello diseño.

What we are collecting for. We the funds to finance the production of our music album, which includes recording at a professional studio, editing and mastering, graphic design and also printing of the CD.  We are aware that most people listen to music in digital format, so we aim for a limited amount of beautifully designed, physical CDs.



Una vez superada la meta de la campaña haremos llegar el 25% de lo recaudado a niños de pocos y ningunos recurso, como venimos haciendo en nuestro trabajo voluntario en Colombia.  Buscams aliarnos con otros grupos como asociaciones, colegios y teatros, a quienes les interese una colaboración para fomentar una cultura de paz a través de la música.

Stretch goals. Once we have reached our goal we pledge to give 25% of the received funds to children with little or no resources, as we have already started doing with our volunteer work in Colombia. We are looking for alliances with other groups, associations, schools and theatres that are interested in collaborating to promote a culture of peace through music.



Participa. Este primer disco de Rosalía Mowgli y la Escuela Encantada se basa en la música que venimos tocando en nuestros conciertos didácticos por España y Latinoamérica en los últimos años. Grabar este disco supone un trabajo musical profundo, una propuesta artística y educativa que creemos que merece mucho la pena.

¡Ayudadnos, donando y compartiendo esta campaña!

Participate. This first music album by Rosalía Mowgli and the Enchanted School is based on songs we have been playing at our educational concerts in Spain and Latin America over the past years. Recording this CD has been a profound musical process for us. To us the Enchanted School represents an artistic and educational mission which we strongly believe in.

Please help us to by donating and sharing this campaign!

story:
The Journey Begins.

  • SpinKicK was formed by me in October 2015, with a focus on sharing music that the audience can enjoy and relate too. We spin our melodies, and kick it into the hearts of our fans. We combine, Jazz, Funk, Hip Hop, and Dance music to provide a kaleidoscope of sound that will make you move and groove.
  • This campaign is to bring our music from our live shows into your home. When I wrote the music for our album I was inspired by bands such as Earth Wind and Fire, Brand New Heavies, Prince, and Jamiroquai. Thanks to the artistic talent of Karen Marie on vocals, Sean Richey on Guitar, Andrew Freeman on Keys, and Alex Busby Smith on Bass, SpinKicK's music is artistic, deep, and universal. 
  • I have been sitting on this music for over 10 years. I always had a vision for my own group, but it never materialized. Other bands, other engagements, and then Tendonitis took me away from my passion to play music for 2 years. Through my family and friends I was able to pull from the darkness and form this group of amazing artists. Your help today will give us the chance to release our voice to the world, share the spirit of excitement, and bring a groove hotter than fire for years to come.

We have started the recording process, but we need our fans to get us to the finish line.

What We Need From You & What You Get Back

  • We are ready to give this great music to you, but we need your help to make it a reality. We need to raise $9,000 to achieve our goal. This is for the mixing, the making of CDs, touring, the artists and more. 
  • We have different perks to go with your donation. Donate what you can, we greatly appreciate it! The higher your donation, the bigger your perk. Perks include digital downloads of the album, SpinKicK merchandise, and VIP privileges just to name a few. 
  • If we are not able to reach our goal by the deadline, we will go forward with the donations we received. It will be harder though, and we hope we can work together to make this dream real.

The Impact of Your Donation

  • The impact you would be making by donating would be huge. There are many bands out there, but none exist like SpinKicK. The melodies will move you, the rhythms will groove you and the harmonies will soothe you. 
  • We have performed all over NYC, but with enough donations from our fans we can tour and promote all over the country. The endgame goal will be to perform around the world!
  • We have the power to bring the vibes and the spirit, you have to power to bring this album to life. 

The Risks & Challenges of Making an Album

  • The challenges have been financially draining. It costs nothing to dream, but costs everything to bring it to the forefront.  I was born in Queens NY to a hardworking Middle Class family. I have student loans that take a chunk of my account, and has always made me self conscience about recording an album. 
  • However, I work hard, perform, promote, book, teach and do what I can to fulfill my dreams. Now, I need help because me and my band cannot do it alone.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can not donate, but want to help please share this indiegogo link and spread the word! That helps a long way. The more people know, the more ways they can help become available!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your time, we hope you can help us on our journey!!

story:
My Story

My name is Kruttika Sequeira. I grew up in Mumbai, India. My story isn't like most artists who always knew they wanted to be a musician and had been playing since they were three. I had vague ideas about what I wanted to do. I thought I would be someone important and make a more direct difference in people's lives, like be a doctor, or join the armed forces, but after I lost partial eyesight when I was 13 and become permanently disabled, everything changed. All those dreams I had were shattered. How could I save lives when I could barely hang on to my own. What was someone in my state to do? I couldn't even travel on my own. It took me years to train myself how to navigate the world without assistance. I ended up in art school, since that seemed like something I didn't really need the best eyesight for. The experiences I had in those 4 years set me on the course to find a new dream. The creative world. Luckily I found I was actually good at it. I had anyway being learning the keyboard since 10, so I decided to do something in the arts field. I wrote my first song at 20 and for the first time I felt that I had found the truest form of expression. I never felt more myself than when I was singing or playing the piano. Music saved my life. 

About "Snow"

    These six songs I'm releasing are among the first I ever wrote. I was in a dark place when I wrote these. I was in so much emotional pain that I desperately longed for something to numb it. My decision to record these songs and release them was my way to finally let go of the hurt and anger and start afresh. I no longer harbour the same dark emotions. A lot of therapy and meditation has helped me focus and reset. That's why this project is so close to my heart, it's the past, younger me that I am setting free, so I can begin a new story. And even though these songs were written by another version of myself, I always cherish them because it made me who I am today.

Where are your contributions going?

I am aiming for a goal of $5000 to cover the expenses of putting together this EP and following music videos. The money will be going towards:

Post-Production (copyright registrations, artwork, mastering)- $500

Distribution and manufacturing-$500

Merchandise-$500

Music video shoots$3000 (to shoot videos for at least 3 songs out of the 5)

PR and promotions- $500

** Also add in Indiegogo's fee of 5%

I'm doing everything I can to make this happen. I work a part-time job at a Coffee Co., give voice lessons online and playing shows in and around LA. But I can't do this alone. I need your help to make this dream come true.

What Do YOU Get?

And now here's the fun part! Here's what you get if you donate to EP! 

Social Media Shout Out

If you contribute just $5, I'll give you a Digital High Five in the form of a Social Media Shout Out!

+ BTS videos and photos from my video shoots.

Preview of the Music videos  1 Week BEFORE Release!

If you contribute $15, you will get to watch the music videos before anyone else!!! It'll be our little (big) secret!!! ;)

PLUS:

+ Social Media Shout Out

+ Exclusive BTS Content 

Limited Edition Signed Physical Album

If you contribute $50 or more, you will be one of the few to have a Signed Physical Album! I'm only making a few physical copies, hence the "limited edition." In each album you will also find a postcard size copy of my album artwork.

PLUS:

+ Preview of the music videos  1 Week BEFORE Release

+ Exclusive BTS Content

Name in Album and Video Thank You Notes

If you contribute $100 or more, your name will live on for eternity in my album! No better way to say THANK YOU than to include YOUR NAME in the album! You can show it off to all of your friends! :D

PLUS:

+ Limited Edition Signed Physical Album

+ Preview of music videos  1 Week BEFORE Release

+ Exclusive BTS Content

Free Merch Item

If you contribute $250 or more, you will get a free merch item. Either a T-shirt or Album artwork wall hanging, mug, etc with stickers and lots more.

PLUS:

+ Name in Album and Video Thank you notes

+ Limited Edition Signed Physical Album

+ Preview of music videos  1 Week BEFORE Release

+ Exclusive BTS Content

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't just have to donate money to help, there are other ways to contribute as well! 

Spread the word -- Share this on Facebook/Instagram/Twitter, etc.

If you're an artist or music lover with great PR skills and you want join my team, please reach out to me at kruttika.sequeira@gmail.com! Your help and skills may just be the perfect contribution! 

Thank You for reading this all the way to the end, and Thank you for your contributions. You have done a wonderful job by supporting Indie Music.

story:
Rake Yohn’s Band PURPLESTICKEY Needs Your Help To Complete Their Full Length Album & Music Video! 

 $25 You Get your name mentioned in Special Thanks on the full length album

$50 Gets you a personalized video from the man himself RAKE YOHN! 

Donate any other denomination  over $50 gets you a longer personalized video

$500 gets you the opportunity to record a song with RAKE YOHN at Sweet Creek Studio ( See FAQ for details )                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Our mission is to create the most unique and addictive Metal Punk fusion album ever! We welcome all ages and lovers of all genres to a musical experience that not only includes Rake Yohn but the legendary Chuck Treece, his son Kieran Treece, Art Webb 1986 and Tristan M. Formally known as Purplestickey. The goal for the album in total will be 10 to 12 tracks depending  on the amount of donations we receive. The music video: we plan to cram 2 to 3 songs into a dope 8 min video. We plan on using a haunted house and or a outdoor club with a great view ( subject to change). We hope to broaden the music scene more in a dramatically fun way and with your help we can make it happen right on time for when concerts become a thing again! We thank you with all our Metal/Punk hearts!

story:
Desde tiempos inmemorables el artista ha necesitado un mecenas para llevar a cabo sus proyectos. (Los Beatles lo tuvieron a Brian Epstein, Dylan a Grossman, etc.) Es por esto que acudo a ustedes con la esperanza de recaudar fondos y así terminar el nuevo disco (el séptimo). Para colaborar con esta noble causa pueden pre-ordenar la versión digital o física del álbum, comprar accesorios o agendar una presentación. 

Noel Grisanti es un exiliado sin patria, un hombre que se fue en busca de si mismo y nunca encontró el camino de vuelta a casa. En estos últimos años he tenido que sortear cualquier cantidad de trabajos miserables y situaciones clásicas del inmigrante; que aunque me han hecho más fuerte como persona, también me impidieron tener el tiempo para concentrarme y grabar mis nuevas canciones.

La parte positiva es que estas nuevas vivencias me llenaron el tanque de combustible y me inspiraron a escribir cientos de canciones, las cuales tocan temas de distinta índole: Desamor, desarraigo, humor negro, critica social, fatalismo, psicodelia, vejez, etc. A mi parecer, son las mejores que compuse en mi vida. 

Mucho tiempo pasó desde aquellos discos caseros en lo que me hacía llamar El Caminante, donde surgieron temas bandera del under puertocruzano: Súbanle el sueldo a los policías, Pto My home, Qué Dirían Tus Padres Si Te Ven?, El Marinero, La Suerte Del Gato Negro, etc. Una humilde carrera que me llevó a encontrarme con Max Martinez, productor de Sumergido en el azul y Sueños de bromazepam. Y con Rodrigo Vera, compañero músico y productor de mi última placa Horrenda hermosura. Además de una larga lista de músicos talentosos que fielmente me acompañaron hasta que decidí abandonarlos a todos y exiliarme en tierras lejanas. 

Actualmente en Argentina encontré al productor estrella para esta nueva aventura y ya estamos organizando todo el material que será grabado. Así mismo, cuento con varios músicos argentinos que llevan en sus venas el feelin sagrado de García, Spinetta, Tanguito, Cerati, Moris, es decir, estoy bien acompañado. (Cuando se habla de rock en español esta gente es la que sabe.)

Bueno, en fin, ya sé que hay montones de causas más necesarias y nobles en este mundo que debemos resolver. pero no desestimemos el poder de un nuevo disco para curarnos todos los males y acompañarnos en estos tiempos difíciles. Salud!

story:
Short Summary

If you don't know me yet heres a little introduction. My name is Mikael Rochman aka Young Zion. I was born in Miami, moved around the world but never lost touch of where my true home is. Before I joined the IDF I was thinking of other ways I could play a role in bring my generation forward, defending Israel, and empowering Jewish and non Jewish Zionists. After a friend brought me to a studio to watch him record, I used the extra studio time to try it out myself and found a new passion and talent in making music. Music is one of the most important platforms of influence and for the most part the messages which are promoted today are very negative. I decided that I would make music that not only sounds great but will change the worlds perspective on Israel and Zionism. Since then, with little promotion my songs have accumulated over half a million streams. Imagine how many ears my message can reach with more funds to promote it.

I recently finished my 2 year service as a Paratrooper in the Israeli Defense Force and I am now focused on my music and making an Album. I want each and every song on this project to make an impact which is why I need your help. During my army service I was able to save up money which most soldiers use for their post-army trip, however because this album and the change it can bring is so important to me I decided that I would use my army savings to fund my music as much as possible.

My Costs

As an independent artist I have many costs to pay including production, engineering (mixing and mastering) and once the album is finished, promotion. On average the price to fully complete one song without promotion is 600$ after engineering and production. Since I finished the army I have recorded about 22 songs and I am still going, however, I will pick the best 13-15 tracks to include on the album which without promotion comes out to about 9000$. The next, most important step is promotion which is to get people to actually listen to my work. This will cost another few thousand dollars based on which ways I choose to promote the album.

The Impact

My music touches on a range of subjects including Civil Rights, Racism, Anti-semitism/Zionism, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and more. I want to empower Jews around the world to fight for their rights and promote a message of peace with our neighbors so that my generation can find a way forward. Just Imagine the positive impact my album could have on pop culture and bringing change in the future.

Why I Need Your Help

As a recently released lone soldier and independent artist I just don't have the funds yet to be able to finish and release this project which is why I need the help of every Zionist who wants to see change in the way the media and pop culture treats Israel and empower other Zionists to stand up in their own way. I truly believe that my music can achieve all of these goals and all I ask is for you to put some faith in me and join the movement.

Lets end Anti-Semitism/Zionism, empower our people, and bring an end to the hate that has plagued our world for so long.

story:
Jai Aquarian

 

Hi, I am Jai Aquarian Kydd. For the last 16 years I have mostly lived in East Vancouver, BC, where I've been deeply involved in community building, event organizing and co-creating. I have been studying and facilitating movement and voice workshops for almost 20 years. I also write songs. A lot of songs and prompt poems (taking words from friends and strangers and producing work inspired on dance floors and at events that I feel are making a new paradigm and crafting a new culture).

I often joke that the new paradigm is called #sexyweird. It's like the old paradigm, with a lot more equality and consent, and a little more tongue. The catchy, trappy, festival bass song Kitties embodies exactly what the #sexyweird paradigm is all about. The vision for the video came that first night the words poured onto paper at Blessed Coast 2016.  It features professional dancers who have learned the first original choreography I've taught to others and a lot of community contributed content, DIY craftiness and perks I am excited to share with my friends family and the growing Kitten Army.

Launching this campaign will help complete the video I have been seeding and nurturing for almost two years. It will also facilitate a  re-mix the vocals that has evolved through several live performances of Kitties, The vision allows the community to contribute a lip-synced verse, submit a 5 second video of actual kittens (especially acting out the lyrics of the song) to be considered for the final edit and invite the #sexyweird to come to fruition.

Aside from the CROWDSOURCED aspects of this video the CROWDFUNDING will help Jai Aquarian pay the dancers and the Videography team (Fractal Five Productions), pay for transportation, video editing and post-production effects, and update his website and create an advertising campaign for the Video launch to take the viral video potential of this song to greater audience.

The perks for supporting this project will help book shows and workshop appearances in advance of Jai's Canadian tour, June 15-August 3rd, as well as releasing Jai Aquarian's first merchandise offerings (Kitties tights, handmade crystal tipped unicorn horns, Kitty ears by local artisans including Jai Aquarian) and help finally publish a 66 page retrospective of Jai Aquarian's original songs, postcard and prompt poems (release date August 11th, 2019).

What We Need & What You Get

We are paying dancers for their time to learn this choreography-- 6 dancers @$200 each $1200

We need two make-up artists to do make-up for the dancers for the video, as well as the lip sync sessions $600

Transportation and catering for the video shoots $300

Website hosting and updates for jaiaquarian.com $400

Editing (hiring a mentor to work with Fractal Five productions to keep costs down) $450

Video Launch advertising campaign $250

Videography services for Fractal Five Productions $600

Location costs Rental of a studio to shoot the choreography in $350

Re-recording studio vocals for the Video release $120 (4 hours @ 30/hr)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Total Campaign budget=$4270

The unique perks to this campaign include Canned Unicorn Horns handmade by Jai Aquarian, Kitten ears  used in the filming of the video (also handmade by Jai Aquarian and other talented local crafters), a 66 page 8x12 copy of Jai Aquarian's Postcard Poems and Song Seeds book (coming in August 2019). #Sexyweird merch offerings also include special Kitties tights featuring the lyrics of the songs and the famous third eye Kitten by Phresha Le Vandale (used with permission of the artist), #sexyweird tanks, underwear and halters, the 7 song Shake Yr Sunshine EP (Jai Aquarian's first proper studio release featuring over a a dozen guest vocalists and musicians) in digital or cd form (with lyric sheet in the cd format).

Also on offer, pre-book Jai Aquarian to share a house concert, or live appearance on his Canadian tour mid June to early August, his VoiceBodyLove vocal playshop (suitable for adults or kids) or his brand new full-day offering Empowered Vocal Energetics.  Empowered Vocal Energetics will also be offered as a monthly 10-15 minute video series. It showcases Jai's unique vocal training resources for achieving a more embodied accessto your full, authentic expression.

Should we not achieve the full funding compliment in this campaign, the obvious cuts to expenses will be in scaled down advertising and web-site updating budgets as well as more in-house editing (the hiring of a mentor would speed up the process of our Videographer, Marquie Murphy of Fractal Five Productions) completing the video and help her develop her skill sets in exchange for a lot of donated time and dedication to this project,

Lastly, I paid to make an EP that showcased the wide range of songwriting styles I work with, re-recording the vocals prior to the video release reflects my desire to show how the few live performances of this song have evolved it from the original EP version. Though if i don't meet my target budget I would cover that expense myself. Check out the EP version at https://soundcloud.com/jaiaquarian/kitties-1 and please feel free to like and comment on Soundcloud.

Also, if you want to skip this whole crowdfunding hoopla, you can purchase a physical copy of the album at cdbaby,com through this link: https://hearnow.com/settings/2falb01250971#nt

Or a digital copy of the EP at jaiquarian.bandcamp.com

The bonus of that route, is we get access to those funds immediately, not when the campaign is over.

The Impact

Having dedicated my life to serving my community in various capacities, as a community organizer for Car-Free Commercial Drive Fests, the Intention Gatherings, as Master of Ceremonies for Earthdance Vancouver and Pancakes and Jam. I have been a prolific controbutor and collborator, and always shared the secrets I've learned on the path of full expression with as many people as possible. Making my first music video I hope will open new audiences to hearing my music, which if you know me is about 1 tenth silly and #sexyweird and nine tenths passionate, people and earth focused, social change music. I want to participate in the big discussions and launch a podcast about these deeper topics later this year. Establishing myself as a culture creator requires I get out into the world, and Kitties is that #sexyweird foot in the door to help make that happen.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have never released a Crowdfunding campaign before and I am nervous about that. I have made most of my art for the sake of art and how it feels to create and share. I have done a lot of research in the past two years to get to the point where I feel like I know how to be an entrepreneur as well as an artist. I am leaning on people who believe in this project and we are making this on a shoestring to demonstrate what a lifelong investment in community can yield. The risks include having not enough time to get the word out to meet our funding goals,  I am fully committed to seeing this project through to completion and have been seeding this for a long time to get it this far. This Garden of Kitties just needs some more people to get excited about our unique perks and potentially contributing a lip synced verse in their best kitten costumes, or sending in some footage of their actual feline friends being adorable to bring the Kitten harvest to the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know its a lot to ask your friends, family and strangers for money. That's why I've dropped lots of hints and word-of-mouthed this to death for the last year. I have plumbed the depths of my imagination to bring you tangible perks if you like to dress up all costumey, or feel like your Full expression could benefit from some of the training I've sought out in the 18 years I've studied voice and movement and  pumped out Spoken Word, Hip-Hop, Folk, R n B and Soul music.

If you can't contribute, please don't feel any pressure or need to excuse that. But maybe if you've been touched by my music or me as a human trying to be kind and loving and empowering in the world, consider using the Indiegogo share tools or sending this link out to your networks with a little testemonial about me. Pretty please with kittens on top

story:
SALUT

Nous sommes Wavery, un groupe indie rock de la région de Victoriaville né en 2016. Notre musique, à la fois émotionnelle et accrocheuse, propose un son dynamique où tous les instruments sont mis de l’avant, en passant des guitares rock'n'roll aux synthés pop. Écoute « Another Leaf on the Ground », tu comprendras.


Notre premier album Slowdancer sorti l’an dernier a connu un certain succès localement, principalement à Victoriaville. Nous sommes maintenant prêts à aller plus loin et repousser nos limites créatives.
 

C’EST QUOI VOTRE PROJET DE FOU LÀ?

Ce n’est plus un secret. Nous sommes plus qu’excités d’entrer en studio professionnel en aout 2019 pour deux semaines.

Nous allons donc enregistrer un nouvel album de 10 chansons au Studio RadicArt situé à Notre-Dame-du-Mont-Carmel avec Francis Perron, membre du groupe Bears of Legend.

 

ÇA ME SEMBLE CHER

Tu as raison. C’est notre rêve et nous ne sommes pas prêts d’abandonner.
Pour te donner une idée, nous allons enregistrer chaque instrument séparément pour chaque chanson, avec les meilleurs équipements de l’industrie. Ceci inclut la guitare, basse, drum, clavier, voix, ainsi qu’une section de cuivres et de cordes.
Francis s’occupera par la suite de mixer de de masteriser le tout.

Nous payons la majeure partie de ce projet de notre poche. Nous assurons le cout de la fabrication des CD, la réalisation de vidéoclips, la promotion, etc. Ce qui veut dire, pas de cadeaux de noël pour le beau-frère l’an prochain (désolé Steeve). Comme nous sommes principalement des jeunes étudiants, on se permet de te demander quelques sous pour accomplir ce projet ambitieux.

 

ET J’AI QUOI MOI?

Ta contribution vaut tout l’or du monde pour nous. Sérieusement.
En plus de notre éternelle reconnaissance envers toi, tu pourrais avoir:

  • Download digital
  • CD
  • T-shirts
  • Fanny pack (sac banane)
  • Entrée gratuite pour notre spectacle de lancement

 

POURQUOI DEVRAIS-JE VOUS AIDER?

Le monde de la musique indépendante n’est pas chose facile aujourd’hui. Comme nous sommes 100% DIY, nous n'avons pas de gérant, pas d'agent, pas de maison de disques, et aucune aide financière.
Chaque dollar investi ici influencera directement la qualité du produit final. Grâce à vous, cette aventure excitante sera plus réelle que jamais.
Notre promesse est de créer un album avec tout notre cœur et notre passion profonde pour la musique.

 

MAIS J’AI PAS UNE CENNE

T’es cassé sincère. C’est correct. Ça ne veut pas dire que tu ne peux pas aider;

  • Parles-en à tes ami(e)s.
  • PARTAGE cette page.
  • Suis notre aventure sur tous nos réseaux sociaux; spotify, facebook, instagram.
     

Merci!
