C’est notre rêve et nous ne sommes pas prêts d’abandonner.Pour te donner une idée, nous allons enregistrer chaque instrument séparément pour chaque chanson, avec les meilleurs équipements de l’industrie. Ceci inclut la guitare, basse, drum, clavier, voix, ainsi qu’une section de cuivres et de cordes.Francis s’occupera par la suite de mixer de de masteriser le tout.Nous payons la majeure partie de ce projet de notre poche. Nous assurons le cout de la fabrication des CD, la réalisation de vidéoclips, la promotion, etc. Ce qui veut dire, pas de cadeaux de noël pour le beau-frère l’an prochain (désolé Steeve). Comme nous sommes principalement des jeunes étudiants, on se permet de te demander quelques sous pour accomplir ce projet ambitieux. ET J’AI QUOI MOI?Ta contribution vaut tout l’or du monde pour nous. Sérieusement.En plus de notre éternelle reconnaissance envers toi, tu pourrais avoir:
Download digital
CD
T-shirts
Fanny pack (sac banane)
Entrée gratuite pour notre spectacle de lancement
 POURQUOI DEVRAIS-JE VOUS AIDER?Le monde de la musique indépendante n’est pas chose facile aujourd’hui. Comme nous sommes 100% DIY, nous n'avons pas de gérant, pas d'agent, pas de maison de disques, et aucune aide financière.Chaque dollar investi ici influencera directement la qualité du produit final. Grâce à vous, cette aventure excitante sera plus réelle que jamais.Notre promesse est de créer un album avec tout notre cœur et notre passion profonde pour la musique. MAIS J’AI PAS UNE CENNET’es cassé sincère. C’est correct. Ça ne veut pas dire que tu ne peux pas aider;
Parles-en à tes ami(e)s.
PARTAGE cette page.
Suis notre aventure sur tous nos réseaux sociaux; spotify, facebook, instagram. 
Merci!

story:
The Loving Janis story

Featuring the music and life stories of Janis Joplin and Janis Ian, as well as my own, the show takes us on a musical voyage from early girlhood to adulthood. The play weaves a narrative about searching for your own voice and how our influences shape and define us. 

Why the show means so much

I started performing in the Young Actor's Workshop in SF at age 13. Discovering how much I loved acting led me to dive into the art form completely, and I moved to LA at 15 to study and pursue it full time. Disillusionment led me to an artist commune at age 20 to attempt a different kind of artistic life! At 25 I moved to Paris to immerse myself in the blues, and music took me over. I returned to the Bay Area in 2007 and began to study music full time. I graduated from the California Jazz Conservatory in 2014. This project brings together so many aspects of my own creative life. It is both thrilling and terrifying, and I feel very lucky to have the opportunity to bring it to an audience. 

The show needs your support

This campaign is raising funds to pay for:

  • licensing the Janis Ian & Janis Joplin songs 
  • short theatrical run in late 2019
  • artist fees for readings and development 
  • marketing and promotion

The show includes original songs from both Janis Ian and Janis Joplin. One of the reasons for fundraising is to support the licensing fees, which are considerable. Another reason we are raising money is to produce a theatrical run of the play - for specifics, or if you're able to assist in other ways, please email us - any help is appreciated!

Funds will be allocated to the following:

  • Licenses: Paying all copyright owners a per-performance-fee for use of the songs 
  • Contracts: Paying music licensing company fees to track down and negotiate contracts
  • Artist Fees for Production & Rehearsal: Performers, Director (Jayne Wenger), Lighting Designer, Art Direction
  • Marketing 
  • Additional Costs: Venue Rentals, Costumes, Set Design, Projection/Slides

& what you get in return

First - you get my sincere gratitude for supporting me and helping me make this dream a reality. But on top of that, you will get one of the following items for each level of contribution:

  1. $20+ = CD "Loving Janis: Live at Ashkenaz"
  2. $50+ = CD + ticket to Ashkenaz event
  3. $100+ = CD + ticket to Ashkenaz event + video of me singing you a song of your choosing
  4. $500+ = CD + 2 tickets to Ashkenaz event + private Kyra Gordon house concert (anywhere in the Bay Area)
  5. $1,000+ = CD + 2 tickets to Ashkenaz event + private Loving Janis house concert performance of the music in the play (anywhere in the Bay Area) 
  6. $2,500+ = CD + private Kyra Gordon house concert (anywhere in the USA, includes travel)
  7. $5,000+ = CD + private Loving Janis house concert performance of the play (anywhere in the USA, includes travel) 

Other ways to support the show

If you don't have the means to financially support the campaign I totally understand. I would still love to connect! Here are some free ways you can support the show:

  • Follow us on Instagram @LovingJanisShow and Facebook @LovingJanis.
  • Can you share the message about the campaign? Here's a quick link to copy: bit.ly/Donate2LovingJanis.

Thank you for taking time to learn more about the Loving Janis project, I really appreciate it.

story:
What's Up?! We're When The Sun Sets

We are a Pop-Punk band based out of the Northwest Suburbs of Chicago, IL and we are finishing up our second EP!

As you may know, recording is extremely expensive and we are not rich! That is why we are inviting you to come behind the scenes with us and see what goes on while recording a record in exchange for your help! We appreciate every single one of you who has supported us this far in our journey and we assure you that this new material will take it to the next level.

You will be constantly receiving updates as the campaign goes on so you can stay up to date on how it is coming along!

 

What We Need

Our goal is $1,200 and with this cash we are going to:

  • Go into the studio and finish recording our 2nd EP
  • Create sick new merch!
  • Give you some Christmas gifts (gifts listed below)

 

What You Get

For donating, you will receive all kinds of fun gifts:

  • $10- A signed copy of the new EP as soon as it is released
  • $20- WTSS Limited Edition Dad Hat & a custom painted canvas from the band
  • $30- Mystery piece of merch + Ticket to our EP release show!
  • $50- Invite to a pre-release listening party WITH PIZZA in the studio!
  • $75- An invite to come to the studio while we are recording & be featured on a song!
  • $100- Bag-O-Merch + Invite to the studio + Song Feature 
  • $200- Be featured in our next music video
  • $300- Come on tour with us and experience all of the behind the scenes shenanigans
  • $500- Rename our band van + we will play at your next party and wear whatever you want us to wear
  • $1,000- We will give you Tyler's sparkly blue drumkit + a signed guitar from the band

 

 *Every prize includes a signed copy of the EP upon release

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to help financially, we totally understand. Here are some other ways that you can help us get this EP out:

Give us a follow on social media and spread the word

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WhenTheSunSetsIL
  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/WhenTheSunSetsIL
  • Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/WTSSIL

 

Stream Our Music On Spotify!

https://open.spotify.com/artist/5En7VgLDFTKb9kOcZs6cF4

 

 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
We are a socially conscious Mexican American band from Los Angeles and Mexico City that plays folk music from the border. We have a habit of supporting social causes in our community. Check out some of our previously released music below!

El corrido de Benjamin Ramírez  

Muro 

One way ticket to TJ

All the band members are multicultural and bring their own unique experience to the project. We want to spread the Mexican American flavor and connect with as many people as we can. We are all in this together and want to raise our voices, celebrating the uniqueness of our culture!

A couple years ago we heard Flaco Jimenez for the first time and fell in love with his music. Then we found out he’s recorded with legends like Dr. John, Bob Dylan and The Rolling Stones. If you don’t know Flaco, PLEASE CLICK HERE. 

We are almost done recording our first full length album and this collaboration would be a dream come true. We’re also dying to play Texas! And to play with Los Texmaniacs, that would be another dream come true!

Help us collaborate with this legend and bring his music to a new generation. Also, help us get our start in Texas!

What We Need & What You Get

This will be a short campaign. We’ve got 3 weeks to raise a total of $5000 USD. And the money will be used as followed.

Flights to San Antonio

Lodging

Studio Time

Flaco's contribution

Mixing

Video content 

And because we are forever grateful for your support, we have super awesome perks that you can scroll on the right side of this page!


A preview of our upcoming single ¨El corrido de la Caravana¨, a song that tells the story of the various caravans that have been walking north looking for a better life. Super fun merch, singing-grams, personalized voice messages and in house concerts in the SoCal Area. 

The Impact

Your contributions will make you a part of The Mexican Standoff movement. Be part of our musical journey. Reaching our goal will fund our start in Texas and our collaboration with Flaco Jimenez. We’d love you to be part of it!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is to fund this trip and recording session. Being an independent artist cost money. So we need as much help as we can!

story:
The Evil of Two Lessers

Songwriters Mike Ethan Messick and Ben Morris explore their darker sides on this upcoming joint project, produced by John Evans. The album, which will consist of murder ballads, tales of general mayhem and criminality, is a project 9 years in the making, stemming back to 2011 when Messick & Morris played a handful of shows together and saved up a small-chunk of change to one-day make this record. The scope of the project (how many songs make it on the album), will depend on the generosity of friends and fans and their willingness to participate as "backers". There is a loose funding goal of $5000; any amount raised over the target will just keeps things interesting (more $ = more songs, etc.).

Mike Ethan Messick is one of the most respected (and underrated) songwriters in the state of Texas. He has released three full-length albums, 2007's "Bootlegger's Turn", 2011's "The Only Easy Day Was Yesterday", and 2017's "How Close We Came".

Ben Morris has put out two solo albums, "The Other Side of Broken" from 2007,  and 2013's "Amen Brother", along with 5 projects with his band, The Great American Boxcar Chorus, including the most-recent "The Violets and the Blues", from 2018.

All money raised will go towards recording and manufacturing costs associated with recording with an award-winning producer at a state-of-the-art recording studio, Signal Hill studios in Austin, TX.

The perks are simple: pre-order the record on the front end, or hire the duo out for a record-release show/house concert on the back end, and simultaneously help us make the album! If for some reason the goal is not reached, the project is still happening and all money raised will go towards it's release, it just may fewer songs on the album...

We realize that some friends/fans may not be in a position to help this campaign financially; if that is the case you can still help us by sharing this around to help us get the word out! We appreciate any and all support that you are able to throw our way!

See you down the trail!

story:
Hello, I'm DÓTTIR. An upcoming Danish-Faroese musician who has made a name on the alternative rock scene. I released my first single, Yellow Trees back in 2014, which was followed by a string of concerts in Denmark and the Faroe Islands – where I'm originally from. This led to an invitation to tour Russia in 2015 as part of a Russian/Faroese culture exchange together with Kristian Blak & Yggdrasil and Marius Ziska, which put me in contact with my current label, Tutl.

In April 2017, I released my debut EP “DIVISION” in collaboration with Tutl followed by a tour in Copenhagen and the Faroe Islands. The past year, I've been recording songs for my full-length debut album “SEEKER” expected for release in early 2019. Tutl is a small Faroese record label that is helping me with the distribution, BUT(!) doesn't have much money to pay for studio time, video recordings and that sort of stuff.

DIVISION was a dedication to my roots in the Faroe Islands and the feeling of being divided between two cultures. Growing up in Denmark while longing for the Atlantic Islands, the existential meaning of home has been a central theme in my work, and this is also reflected in my music when I sing in both Faroese and English. The lyrical universe in SEEKER symbolises a search for identity, knowledge, answers, meaning, understanding, love and retreat when life becomes too difficult. They are two very personal pieces and deal with human themes that I think everyone can relate to – which is precisely the purpose of my music.

The sound is a mountain landscape that takes the listener on a dynamic, wondrous and unexpected journey to the North. The music can be described as alternative Nordic rock, moving between intimate and powerful passages in a mythical, captivating and introspective universe. In SEEKER, I extend this audio image, (singing in both Faroese and English), where I explore new areas with a touch of 90's grunge, desert rock, psychedelic rock and anthems from the traditional Faroese singing tradition. It goes on a dark journey into the mind, opening the listener up to hope and redemption and I can't wait to share this with all of you.

I have recorded all the songs and they are right now in the mixing process. I wouldn't have come this far without the funding I've received from Kodas kulturelle midler, DJBFA and Dansk Artist Forbund, but to make it to the end I need your help, so I can pay alle the nice people who has helped me and is helping me with the rest of the production. Your help will help me pay for:

  • Recordings, mix and master of the music
  • Pressing of the vinyl – because, yeah – I'm releasing on vinyl!
  • Production of the cover art (and thereby you are also supporting artist Kirstin Helgadóttir)
  • Production of a music video for the first single

All in all I need €2000. Any amount is highly appreciated, but by donating €40 (or more) I will send you a signed vinyl album + a personal "thank you" card. Note that this offer only is available for people living in Denmark and in the Faroe Islands (sorry!).

All help is much appreciated and a huge thanks in advance!

Kind regards,

DÓTTIR

story:
We started our movement almost 10 years ago, and the need for what we do has grown stronger and so must we. Collectively our musicians speak over 45 languages, come from countries & cultures around the world, and each has dedicated themselves to their own musical styles & traditions.  When they join together on stage, the common language of music allows them to create new sounds and visuals to inspire us all.

Who we are...
The Pangean Orchestra (TPO) Professional musicians from diverse countries, delivering a message of peace and tolerance, performing with both exotic and familiar instruments. 

What we want to do...
Raise the funding for international concerts and recordings in 2019 & 2020, that can serve as an example for the world

Where we want to do it...
Worldwide – United States, Turkey & Online

When we will do it...
August of 2019 through July of 2020

Why we are doing this...
Serve as an inspiration for peace by setting an example of what happens when cultures come together while creating a new evolution in music. 

How we’ll do it...
We’ll unite world musicians through the leadership of founder and conductor, World Maestro – Colin O’Donohoe.  Our videos and recordings will be spread worldwide to serve as an example of what’s possible.

 

The Campaign

The Pangean Orchestra has been in a “beta test” mode for almost 10 years, and with your help we can establish ourselves in a lasting and impactful way. 

The truth is, formalizing and orchestra & musical movement isn’t cheap.  We need to pay our talented musicians and support staff…and no matter how well we flatter our bill collectors, the still insist on being paid.  We hope to raise the funds needed to create a formal blueprint for this new world-music concept, record the performances with high quality video and sound, and continue to be an inspiration for others. 

Our deliverables:

Video recordings

Audio recordings

2 Live Concerts (streamed and shared world-wide) 

 

What We Need & What You Receive

Every dollar donated will help us get closer to our goal of $15,000.  These funds will be spent on;

  • Musicians 
  • Film Crew
  • Audio Crew
  • Support Staff
  • Venue rentals
  • Marketing
  • Operational expenses

We also need you…as a fan, as motivation for us, and as a member of the movement!

Whether you give $1 or $1,000, we’ll assign you a fun & creative, fantasy role with the Pangean Movement. From a Tetra-Chord Therapist to a Tri-Tone Detective every role is important.

Perk Up! 

Donating to The Pangean Orchestra comes with fabulous rewards. We’re so proud of our partnership with CRNZ Comics, and together we’re offering perks that bring you into the Pangean Movement. We’ll assign you a fun job title (fictional of course), and then create a unique comic starring YOU!  The comics will be of varying length, based on your contribution.

Additionally, there are invitations to meet the musicians before & after a performance event, the chance to get musical instruction via Skype from one of our musicians, or even our director…so you can claim this benefit wherever the internet exists. 

And don’t forget the Free Concert Tickets, a private house concert with a select group from Pangean, exclusive access, MP3s and more!

Even at the $1 level you're welcomed in as a tenderfoot and given a unique title. 
For example;
Jason Giardino - Tri-Tone Detective
Ozgu Akbulut - Boogie Woogie Bridge Builder

 

Make an Impact – Be the Example

There are too many people in the world that don't want to see people from different religions, genders, and ethnicities work together.  But it’s those differences, working side by side, that not only produce the most beautiful musical styles!

Your donations drive the message of peace and inclusivity. Your donations help the orchestra, the musicians, and all who we represent!

 Through participating in TPO, some musicians have had their own careers take-off exponentially.  You are helping musicians who might otherwise not have had the opportunity to have their music heard.  New opportunities and welcoming audiences arise out of our projects which further promotes world cultures and music. 

 

We can change hearts and minds through our examples…and we will!

Please donate now, subscribe to our newsletter and follow us on Facebook or Instagram

Let's be the change we wish to see,
and let's have a GREAT time doing it!
story_txt:
We started our movement almost 10 years ago, and the need for what we do has grown stronger and so must we. Collectively our musicians speak over 45 languages, come from countries & cultures around the world, and each has dedicated themselves to their own musical styles & traditions.  When they join together on stage, the common language of music allows them to create new sounds and visuals to inspire us all.Who we are...The Pangean Orchestra (TPO) Professional musicians from diverse countries, delivering a message of peace and tolerance, performing with both exotic and familiar instruments. What we want to do...Raise the funding for international concerts and recordings in 2019 & 2020, that can serve as an example for the worldWhere we want to do it...Worldwide – United States, Turkey & OnlineWhen we will do it...August of 2019 through July of 2020Why we are doing this...Serve as an inspiration for peace by setting an example of what happens when cultures come together while creating a new evolution in music. How we’ll do it...We’ll unite world musicians through the leadership of founder and conductor, World Maestro – Colin O’Donohoe.  Our videos and recordings will be spread worldwide to serve as an example of what’s possible. The CampaignThe Pangean Orchestra has been in a “beta test” mode for almost 10 years, and with your help we can establish ourselves in a lasting and impactful way. The truth is, formalizing and orchestra & musical movement isn’t cheap.  We need to pay our talented musicians and support staff…and no matter how well we flatter our bill collectors, the still insist on being paid.  We hope to raise the funds needed to create a formal blueprint for this new world-music concept, record the performances with high quality video and sound, and continue to be an inspiration for others. Our deliverables:Video recordingsAudio recordings2 Live Concerts (streamed and shared world-wide)  What We Need & What You ReceiveEvery dollar donated will help us get closer to our goal of $15,000.  These funds will be spent on;
Musicians 
Film Crew
Audio Crew
Support Staff
Venue rentals
Marketing
Operational expenses
We also need you…as a fan, as motivation for us, and as a member of the movement!Whether you give $1 or $1,000, we’ll assign you a fun & creative, fantasy role with the Pangean Movement. From a Tetra-Chord Therapist to a Tri-Tone Detective every role is important.Perk Up! Donating to The Pangean Orchestra comes with fabulous rewards. We’re so proud of our partnership with CRNZ Comics, and together we’re offering perks that bring you into the Pangean Movement. We’ll assign you a fun job title (fictional of course), and then create a unique comic starring YOU!  The comics will be of varying length, based on your contribution.Additionally, there are invitations to meet the musicians before & after a performance event, the chance to get musical instruction via Skype from one of our musicians, or even our director…so you can claim this benefit wherever the internet exists. And don’t forget the Free Concert Tickets, a private house concert with a select group from Pangean, exclusive access, MP3s and more!Even at the $1 level you're welcomed in as a tenderfoot and given a unique title. For example;Jason Giardino - Tri-Tone DetectiveOzgu Akbulut - Boogie Woogie Bridge Builder Make an Impact – Be the ExampleThere are too many people in the world that don't want to see people from different religions, genders, and ethnicities work together.  But it’s those differences, working side by side, that not only produce the most beautiful musical styles!Your donations drive the message of peace and inclusivity. Your donations help the orchestra, the musicians, and all who we represent! Through participating in TPO, some musicians have had their own careers take-off exponentially.  You are helping musicians who might otherwise not have had the opportunity to have their music heard.  New opportunities and welcoming audiences arise out of our projects which further promotes world cultures and music.  We can change hearts and minds through our examples…and we will!Please donate now, subscribe to our newsletter and follow us on Facebook or InstagramLet's be the change we wish to see,and let's have a GREAT time doing it!

story:
The Astral Voyage Community is an international collective of creatives, technicians, and educators from 25 different countries around the globe. It is our mission to establish a global community built around self-empowerment through music worldwide. 

We produce uplifting music, host educational workshops and provide online concert series for the community. As a collective, our primary goal is to connect with a global audience and act as a vehicle of healing and growth for people around the world. 

But before we are able to fully lift off the ground, we need your help with developing the community to its fullest potential. This journey contains many financial risks during our campaign phase, but we are confident in its development and the supportive help from you. The financial and technical responsibilities required for the community’s development is shown below:

Remote Album Recording: $800

Audio Engineering (mixing & mastering): $7,500

Legal Fees: $3,700

Graphic Design: $1,000

Website Development: $600

Marketing: $2,000

Video Editing: $400

Merchandise Development: $1,200

IndieGoGo Platform Fees: $800

Taxes (~10%): $2,000

= $20,000 total

 

Astral Voyage: The Big Electric Orchestra is a 39 piece ensemble which performs high energy electro-funk and soul with a full big band horn section, luscious strings, pounding drums, vibrant electronics and features many different vocalists from all around the world.

 

The band consists of an abundance of diverse artists including New Orleans singer Josh Kagler, international jazz saxophonist Mike Casey, and Traxsource’s ‘Soulful House’ chart-topping Tertulien Thomas. Our band members have performed with legends such as Stevie Wonder, Earth Wind & Fire, John Legend and more. Our producers have worked on TV shows including American Idol and America’s Got Talent as well as live events with artists like Garth Brooks.

 

The Astral Voyage Community is a large organization with a lot of moving parts including a Core Team developing the community on a daily basis. With over 50 band members performing on weekly productions and countless more audiovisual projects to come, we have been putting in hundreds of hours of hard work and are just getting started! 

Our main objective is to heal and grow with people of all different backgrounds through the power of art and education. Even though the development of this community is a massive undertaking, with your support, we can bring Astral Voyage to life. Despite these challenges, we are confident that with your help combined with the professionalism behind our collective team, we will be officially lifting off in 2021 and spreading positivity through music and education for years to come.

Do you consider yourself:

  • a music student, artist or producer that is seeking for more insight in your craft or talent? 
  • a creative and mindful soul that is looking for daily motivation and deeper self-realization? 
  • a supporter of education and the arts in a world that is in immediate need of positivity? 

If you answered yes, then we want to personally welcome you along this journey! This community is a global environment that supports each other through the power of music without discrimination -  and we’re so happy to have you.

 

We strive to make individual change throughout humanity and provide positive influence to those that are younger than us. Through healing our internal wounds and assisting others to heal, we can create a better world for ourselves and the coming generations. We acknowledge that the youth is the future of humanity. All of us MUST share messages of unity and compassion through actions of love to set a positive example. Most importantly, our first supporters will be the ones to lay the foundational brick work for this community of positive change. 

 

With your help, you too can become an important part of the inspirational story behind Astral Voyage. Now you can join us on an empowering journey where Astral Voyage steers the spaceship, but you too experience every twist and turn of the ride. 



Social Media Links:

Official Email: astralvoyagecommunity@gmail.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/astralvoyagecommunity

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/astralvoyage_

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q5KLgdyRlr8

SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/astralvoyage

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/astralvoyage

story:
Welcome to the Stoughton Chamber Music Festival fundraising page!

(A quick thing about me: My name is Madlen Breckbill and I am a Stoughton native. I began playing violin at the age of 4 with the Suzuki Strings of Madison, played many years in the Wisconsin Youth Symphony Orchestra, sang in the Stoughton concert choir (as well as one year with the Stoughton Madrigal Singers), attended UW-Madison where I studied violin performance with David Perry, and then ventured off.... After 3 years studying at the Glenn Gould School in Toronto (and discovering my love of viola, thanks to Steven Dann) I moved to Berlin, Germany, where I just finished an academy contract with the Konzerthaus Orchestra, Berlin.) 

This is a brand-new festival, taking place in Stoughton WI in mid August at the beautiful Stoughton Opera House. 

The festival is twofold as it celebrates some of the wonderful musicians in Wisconsin as well as celebrating the Stoughton community and it's surrounding neighbors. 

There is also a third aspect-- good chamber music!

The festival will begin with one week of intensive rehearsals with this year's company musicians, resulting in two performances: one on August 17th at 3pm and the other on August 19th (yes, a Monday) at 7pm at the Stoughton Opera House.

I have been slowly dreaming up this festival for the last few years, finding inspiration from some of the festivals I have attended, both as a musician and an audience member. Last summer I put together a short concert at the Stoughton Opera House and was blown away by the number in attendance as well as the appreciation and enthusiasm from the audience. This concert ignited my chamber festival imagination and has inspired this leap. I am also inspired by the musicians who have grown up in the Madison area or who have come through to study at UW-Madison. The talent, integrity, and good spirit of these musicians leaves me wanting more opportunities to play with them and see them perform. 

The Stoughton community is a perfect home for such a festival as it boasts the wonderful Stoughton Opera House (a dream chamber music hall), is a calming and beautiful sanctuary from city life, and is home to an ever lovely community of people and small businesses. Stoughton is also where I grew up and a place I think of fondly. Therefore, I want Stoughton to feel that this is their festival, something they can enjoy each summer and to which they can invite the neighboring communities. Ultimately, it is a beautiful opportunity to celebrate community both small and large. 

We have two fun programs planned. The first will be a warm and loving combination of Brahms and Bach, which will feature one of my favorite Brahms compositions, the viola quintet op. 111. Our second program is designed to reflect the Norwegian heritage of Stoughton. The program will pair pieces by both Norwegian and American composers and is shaping up to be really exciting and enjoyable. I think you will have to come see it ;) Both programs will include bits of information about each piece or musical experience during the concert, to further engage thought, enjoyment and understanding for both the experienced and fresh classical music listeners. 

This year's company is made up of musicians from both near and far. We have David Perry and Alex Norris playing violin, Zou Zou Robidoux and Taylor Skiff on Cello, myself, Laila Zakzook, Micah Behr and Greta Breckbill on Viola, Thomas Kasdorf and Micah Behr on piano, and Kirsten Larson, Mezzo Soprano. 

The simple reason why we are fundraising is that we really want to pay these fantastic musicians and create an experience enjoyable for all. There are also certain costs that come with starting a new chamber music festival. In addition we want to keep this festival accessible to all of our audiences so we will be keeping ticket prices as simply a suggested donation. 

We are aiming to fundraise $6,000, most of which goes directly to the musicians. The rest will be used to purchase music, advertisement costs, and other miscellaneous costs. After which, we will rely on the income from the ticket donations. 

Fundraising is one of the most important pieces to this little chamber music puzzle at this point, so I hope you can help us solve it. So, check out the cheeky incentives and donate if you are able! 

Either way, we hope to see you at both of the concerts!! And tell your neighbors, share via email, or find us on Facebook. 

 

Peace,

 

Madlen Breckbill

 

 

A thank you to John Beutel and the Stoughton Music Appreciation class, and logo artist Hannah Sandvold

story:
Overview:

Who loves Walmart?! My mom Judy does, and so do I!

I created the "Walmart, Walmart" comedy rap song after taking a trip to Walmart with my hilarious mother, Judy. And we’re turning it into an epic music video!

 

My Story:

My name is Pauline Schantzer/Polly Wolly, I’m a comedian/actor originally from Philadelphia and currently living in Los Angeles. For the past few years I’ve been creating comedy rap music videos and performing the songs in comedy clubs around LA. I’ve also created the comedy web series, Judy and Me (www.youtube.com/judyandme)

 

I’m making my 8th comedy music video, “Walmart Walmart” that I'm starring in and need your help funding the video!

 

What I need:

I need to raise $1500.00

These funds will pay for;

•    Pre-production

•    Crew

•    Art/props/costume budget

•    Post Production

•    Marketing the video

•    Feeding everyone on set

 

I ALSO ACCEPT VENMO, USE THIS: @Pauline-Schantzer

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Money isn't what it's all about. Here are other ways you can be apart of the “Walmart Walmart” music video:

•    Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign 

•    Share my “Jew Toy” music video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N3RvZxfIsXw

•     Subscribe to my YouTube channel: YouTube.com/pollywolly 

 

OR if you have any of the following, contact me via facebook messenger: https://m.facebook.com/pauline.anne.796

•    A Fat suit

•    Walmart employee shirt

•    Interested in being an extra in it?  Contact me!

•    If there are any snack items that you’d like to donate such as chips, cookies, popcorn, trail mix, water bottles, soda cans, coffee etc…a fed crew is a happy crew!

***Please share the campaign and encourage others to donate. Any support, monetary or otherwise, is greatly appreciated :)

story:
Pre-Order to hear the new album early

The pre-orders will be shipped out in September, a month before the public release on October 1st. We would love your support and have some special pre-orders perks available here now, grab yourself an exclusive printed copy of the new Savage Sunday album, a T-Shirt, Jumper or one of the 3 custom BJL Fender Savage Sunday guitars.

We have worked so hard on this album and can't wait to share it with you all. It's been a journey, lots of tears, beers and cheers but the time has come!

 

What You Get

The money raised from the pre-orders will be going straight back into the band to help with touring costs, getting our new album out to you and to keep us working on the next one. There are a bunch of great pre-order perks available on the right and we would love your support.

We have,

  • Exclusive Printed cardboard digipak CD's of the new Savage Sunday album
  • Exclusive SIGNED versions of the new album
  • Yellow or Black Savage Sunday T-Shirts
  • Limited Black Savage Sunday Jumpers
  • 3 Custom Being Jane Lane Savage Sunday Fender Stratocaster Guitars!

 

Album Tour (Oct 2019)

We will also be heading on tour to Melbourne, Adelaide, Gold Coast and Brisbane to support the new album and would love to see you at one of the shows. Tickets and deets available on Facebook and our website www.beingjanelane.com.

story:
Who are Kev Minney and Steph Brown?

Hello from Brighton UK. 

We are Kev Minney and Steph Brown and we are two separate independent, professional singer-songwriters. We have toured the UK and Europe extensively and our music has had airplay on stations such as BBC 6 radio music and featured in magazines such as Guitarist and Clash. 

We are a couple and although we are two individual artists we work together to make a life of full-time music-making possible. 

 

Your Pre-order makes a difference

Music is at the center of our lives and we bring music to our community- from the running of a music school to leading a community choir in our home city of Brighton. We support and make our art without compromise.

We have made two heartfelt albums with producer Jag Jago and string arranger Andrew Stuart Buttle and both albums have an atmospheric and orchestral quality coupled with catchy songwriting that gives a nod to 70's icons like Nick Drake and Joni Mitchell. In this process we have hired over 20 local, professional artists - the selling of our records not only secures our future as musicians but also feeds the local musical economy.

 

Bring our albums to life

We play a lot of live shows and after two years of hard work making these records we want to print them to take around with us at shows across the UK and Europe but we cannot do this without your help. There are lots of people who are enthusiastic about buying our music in CD and Vinyl but as self-financing musicians getting that initial capital can be really quite difficult after two years of spending to make the albums. Pre-order the records here and help us bring both our albums to print for our live audiences all over the world! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

It's surprisingly expensive to print a record and the more you print the cheaper it gets. We want to print a substantial amount so we are able to sell our records on tour and keep keeping our expenses covered. To print our records on CD and vinyl will cost us £1500 each for the minimum. amount of copies you can get printed. 

In return (depending on your contribution) you will get a limited edition, signed copy of the album in CD or Vinyl delivered directly to your door. Downloads will be sent to you so you also have an electronic copy of the album should you want it. This is the only run that will have a limited edition lyric book accompanying the record designed and especially for you. To add to this both albums will have special design details on the cover to distinguish this first crowdfunded print run from any future print runs!

 

Risks & Challenges

By selling the record before we have made the money to print it there is always a risk if we do not reach our target. We want to assure you as a buyer that if we do not raise enough to print the record in this campaign, we will keep running a presale campaign at our live gigs until we make the money to get our record to you as promised. 

As independent musician's we have managed to sculpt our own career in this industry we have overcome many hurdles and we are no strangers to raising money to enable our artistic ambitions, all the same, we need your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to further help us reach our goal please spread the word about our music and our campaign - make some noise on social media or over a cup of tea with a friend or on your lunch break at the office...

Thank you endlessly for your support

Steph and Kev 

x

 

Songs from these albums

Feel you Near
 

God is an Algorithm

Come with Me

Magic

Hello from Brighton UK. 
We are Kev Minney and Steph Brown and we are two separate independent, professional singer-songwriters. We have toured the UK and Europe extensively and our music has had airplay on stations such as BBC 6 radio music and featured in magazines such as Guitarist and Clash. 
We are a couple and although we are two individual artists we work together to make a life of full-time music-making possible. 
 
Your Pre-order makes a difference
Music is at the center of our lives and we bring music to our community- from the running of a music school to leading a community choir in our home city of Brighton. We support and make our art without compromise.
We have made two heartfelt albums with producer Jag Jago and string arranger Andrew Stuart Buttle and both albums have an atmospheric and orchestral quality coupled with catchy songwriting that gives a nod to 70's icons like Nick Drake and Joni Mitchell. In this process we have hired over 20 local, professional artists - the selling of our records not only secures our future as musicians but also feeds the local musical economy.
 
Bring our albums to life
We play a lot of live shows and after two years of hard work making these records we want to print them to take around with us at shows across the UK and Europe but we cannot do this without your help. There are lots of people who are enthusiastic about buying our music in CD and Vinyl but as self-financing musicians getting that initial capital can be really quite difficult after two years of spending to make the albums. Pre-order the records here and help us bring both our albums to print for our live audiences all over the world! 
 
What We Need & What You Get
It's surprisingly expensive to print a record and the more you print the cheaper it gets. We want to print a substantial amount so we are able to sell our records on tour and keep keeping our expenses covered. To print our records on CD and vinyl will cost us £1500 each for the minimum. amount of copies you can get printed. 
In return (depending on your contribution) you will get a limited edition, signed copy of the album in CD or Vinyl delivered directly to your door. Downloads will be sent to you so you also have an electronic copy of the album should you want it. This is the only run that will have a limited edition lyric book accompanying the record designed and especially for you. To add to this both albums will have special design details on the cover to distinguish this first crowdfunded print run from any future print runs!
 
Risks & Challenges
By selling the record before we have made the money to print it there is always a risk if we do not reach our target. We want to assure you as a buyer that if we do not raise enough to print the record in this campaign, we will keep running a presale campaign at our live gigs until we make the money to get our record to you as promised. 
As independent musician's we have managed to sculpt our own career in this industry we have overcome many hurdles and we are no strangers to raising money to enable our artistic ambitions, all the same, we need your support.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to further help us reach our goal please spread the word about our music and our campaign - make some noise on social media or over a cup of tea with a friend or on your lunch break at the office...
Thank you endlessly for your support
Steph and Kev 
x
 
Songs from these albums

Feel you Near
 


God is an Algorithm

Come with Me

Magic

story:
Short Summary

After 10 years with The City Harmonic, I released my first album as a solo artist in 2019, The Work Vol. 1. It's been an incredible privilege to see the impact those songs have had all around the world. Yet so much has changed in the past two years. 

  1.  A lot of troubling stuff has come to the surface in the Church and it feels like God’s been stirring some thoughts in me that I’ve got share. I feel an incredible urgency to turn these prayers of wrestling into songs for the Church. I believe that the Christian faith can be a thing of passion and reason alike - it’s time to re-learn to love God and engage the world with heart, soul and mind.   
     
  2. Musically and stylistically, these songs really feel as though they fit together more than Vol. 1. like there’s an artistic and emotive statement in it. The last time I felt this strongly about a collection of songs was our The City Harmonic album “I Have A Dream (It Feels Like Home)”. So I’m really excited to put this thing together and share it with you all.
     
  3. The thing is, while it’s possible to record an entire album at home by myself, it rarely leads to the best product. I’m dying to collaborate more on this record, and after a season where many have struggled to make ends meet, I’d love to honor some of these incredible musicians I love financially through this project by getting more people involved.
     
  4. I’d love to involve YOU and go one step further with a crazy idea inspired by the social distancing music video we made for my song “Good”. Everyone who supports this project will have the opportunity to “join the choir” - We’ll form a choir of believers singing these songs together from all across the globe, then blend those parts together on the album!

A common FAQ I've been getting is around singing on the album:

Does everyone *have* to sing on the album? No! not at all! It's just an option. Even more importantly, it's an option you can gift to someone else who might be more interested if you back the record!

story:
Hi! Thank you for being here!

It's been 4 years since I've released my last album, Otias. I wrote that album after my Mom passed away from cancer to help heal myself and help others get thru challenging times. 

Inspiring and helping people is what interests me. This album is dedicated to anyone who has suffered from anxiety, depression, confusion or illness.  I hope that this album will help people feel better! I will be incorporating 432HZ frequencies & more!

I look forward to making this album with you! Thank you! 

Love & light, 

Franki ☮️

ABOUT FRANKI:

-Award winning singer/songwriter & classically trained pianist 

-Best music video nomination "Hollywood Film Festival"

 -Billboard International Song Contest - Best Song -  Shadow 

-Performed Internationally and at Cannes Film Festival

-Mentored by Grammy award winning Phil Ramone 

-La Music Awards - Best song - Shadow 

-Female Singer Songwriter of the Year - La music awards 

-2 full length album releases: Franki Love & Otias 

-Created the Meditation Album "Peace Within" to help reduce anxiety 

-Best song - Songwriter Universe 

-Shadow music video on Grammy ballot 

What We Need & What You Get

Related Costs: Making a full length album, with musicians, studio time, mixing, mastering, artwork and manufacturing - can be very expensive. My last album Otias, cost approximately $20,000.  Regardless, I'm setting the Kickstarter goal to a modest $7,000.  However, I do hope we can reach $20,000 and also reach the stretch goals!

1st Stretch goal: $30,000 - Hospital and Yoga Studio tour -  if we meet this goal, we will plan a tour to hospitals, including children's hospitals, visiting patients to play them the album live and via the album recordings. We'll also plan some performances at yoga studios and alternative venues in cities around the USA (hopefully in the UK too!).  

2nd Stretch goal: $50,000- a crew and I will create a documentary on how music can uplift and inspire people. Ideally, we will film and document the hospital tour.

The Impact

Facts about 432 Hz music:

What is so special about music tuned to 432 hz? 

Clinical studies show that 432 Hz resonates with the Heart Chakra

What is 432 hz? 

A=432 Hz, known as Verdi's 'A' is an alternative tuning that is mathematically consistent with the universe. Clinical studies show: Music based on 432Hz transmits beneficial healing energy, because it is a pure tone of math fundamental to nature.

What does 432 Hz do to the brain?

Clinical studies show that 432 Hz music is said to resonate inside the body, releasing emotional blockages and aligning you with the heartbeat of the universe. Studies say that the music is said to heighten perception, increase mental clarity and unlock intuition.

Risks & Challenges

I feel confident that I will meet the timeline of the delivery of this album to you. I've successfully completed 2 other Kickstarter campaigns and delivered the albums on time. This will be my third full length album. It's important to me that you feel comfortable, so will always keep you updated on the progress. Thank you. Much love & light.

 

Franki Performing in Los Angeles:

Franki performing in NYC:

Franki at the Hollywood Film Festival for Best Music Video (Shadow):

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Let your friends know about this campaign!

Make sure to share this post!

Let me know if there are any special rewards you would like to have, and I'll do my best to make them happen.

story:
Wordcraft Circle: Renewing Our Stories

In 1992, Dr. Lee Francis III founded Wordcraft Circle with the vision of creating an organization that would help promote the works and words of Native American writers and storytellers throughout the world.  Through strong mentoring and authentic relationships, Wordcraft became the largest Native mentorship organization in the United States.  More than twenty years later, we seek to continue the legacy of Dr. Francis by renewing and revitalizing the work of Wordcraft Circle for the next generation!

At a time when cultural appropriation runs rampant and Native communities continue to struggle in the face of poverty and systematic oppression, it is more important than ever that we, as Native and Indigenous people, represent ourselves in our own voices!

Wordcraft has always been a membership-based, non-profit that has existed upon a shoestring budget.  With your help we can continue to revitalize our programs, gatherings, and mentorship activities into the next year.  We have a number of exciting ideas but those ideas take resources to implement and that is why we are reaching out to those supporters, friends, and allies who wish to see the stories of Native and Indigenous people heard throughout the world!

What We Need & What You Get

Every year in the Spring, the blessings of rain renew the earth and bring forth the bounty of our Mother.  Wordcraft is no different: we need a little rain as well.  To help us get the flowers blooming, we are seeking a total of $8500.  This amount, coupled with other resources, will help get things moving in the right direction. 

What does this money help us do specifically?  Read on, dear friends!

Communications & Membership - $1500

Getting the word out about Wordcraft and our projects is critical to our success as an organization.  This includes: brochures and media, webhosting, membership support software, and mailings/postage.

Gatherings and RTG - $2000

Hosting gatherings and convenings allows our members and supporters to share and learn from one another.  Additionally, we are looking to host RTG, Returning the Gift, a national Native writers conference that started in 1991.

Story Keepers Project - $2000

Our Story Keepers Project seeks to help engage Native youth in becoming storytellers and guardians of the stories of their community.  The funds for this project will help pay for facilitators, workshops, and stipends to community elders/storytellers for their valuable time.

Youth Literacy Project - $2000

Reading and writing are critical to the success of Native youth and Native communities and our literacy efforts seek to promote reading and writing from an Indigenous perspective.  The funds for this will be used to conduct trainings, workshops and engage technical assistance as necessary.

Organizational Needs - $1000

We are never sure what lies around the corner.  We have bills to pay.  We have trainings to attend.  These funds will be used to help ensure the organization itself stays healthy.

If you choose to support Wordcraft, we have some wonderful rewards as a thank you for your help!

Rewards and Thanks

Seeds and Soil ($5)

We need good seeds and strong soil to help us grow and for every contribution at this level, you get a huge thanks (and mention on our website) as well as a limited edition digital postcard direct to your inbox!

Strong Branches ($10)

Strong branches help us reach our goals as we reach into the sky.  At this level, you get a special Wordcraft sticker, as well as the digital postcard and our thanks!

e-WCers ($20)

Our digital supporters help us advance our writing and stories to the digital age.  At this level, you get a Digital Download of our Sunday Evening Poems Book.  Yours to keep, your to share!

Friends and Family ($40)

Experiences are always better when shared.  At this level, you will receive two, year-long membership and all the benefits, for the price of one!  If you are already a member, you can give these both away and bring some new folks into the Circle!

Talking Leaves ($40)

We hear them in the wind gifting us with their stories.  At this level, you will have a book written by a Native writer donated to a Native student at a local school in our hometown of Albuquerque AND a Wordcraft Circle T-Shirt so you can show your support for Native writers and storytellers!

Collector ($40)

We all collect many things, we can't think of anything better than comics.  At this level, you will get a bundle of comics from our sister organization, INC Comics, to add to your collection!

Word Bank ($50)

Every word we write is a treasure.  At this level, you will receive a year-long membership to Wordcraft and a limited-edition Wordcraft Coin.  This coin will only be available for this IndieGogo campaign!

Bookbinder ($75)

An ancient art form: the practice of sewing words and pages together to create a book.  At this level, you will receive a Printed Copy of the Sunday Evening Poems to add to your library PLUS a year-long membership in Wordcraft Circle.  These copies will only be available for this campaign!

Wordkeeper ($100)

Those who keep the words are entrusted with the wisdom of Creation.  At this level, you will get a year-long membership in Wordcraft PLUS a limited-edition Moleskine Notebook emblazoned with the Wordcraft logo.  Keep those words in a location worthy of their importance!

Librarian ($100)

Never underestimate the librarians for they are the keepers of the knowledge of civilization.  At this level, Wordcraft will donate a box of books (the box will include at least 10 books ) by Native writers to a local school or library of your choosing. 

Scout ($250)

Our scouts were always the ones who led the way and guided us through the difficult times.  At this level, you will receive a brand new Messenger Bag with the Wordcraft logo embroidered right on the front.  Show your Wordcraft pride as you venture into the world!

Guardian ($500)

Those guardians were there to ensure the sustainability of the people and the community.  At this level, you will get a Lifetime Membership in Wordcraft Circle and an exclusive Wordcraft Circle Windbreaker with the Wordcraft logo embroidered over your heart!

Sequoyah ($1000)

A our highest level, named in honor of the great Cherokee linguist and scholar, you will receive a life-time membership in Wordcraft, the exclusive Wordcraft Circle Windbreaker, AND your sponsorship of a school of your choosing where we will conduct writing workshops for the students and faculty of the school!

Wordcraft is located in New Mexico and we are well aware that ANY bit of moisture is helpful in the desert.  So if we don’t reach our funding goal, we will still use all the contributions in the ways previously described!  Any bit of rain and blessings can help us!

Your Impact

Too often our voices are silenced and replaced.  Our stories are often told by others.  The work of Wordcraft has always been to promote the authentic stories of Native and Indigenous people from their own mouths and hands.  Your support for Wordcraft allows us to continue to be a driving force in these efforts.

As we have been doing this work for almost 25 years, we know that any of our efforts pay huge dividends to the people involved.  Throughout that time, we have worked with thousands of emerging and professional Native writers and storytellers, many of whom have been published or who have continued on through their academic pursuits.  Addtionally, we have had numerous critical successes including:

  • Publication of When The Rain Sings, a book of poetry authored by Native youth, as collaboration between the National Museum of the American Indian and Wordcraft.
  • Development of The 100 Years Project at the Indian Pueblo Cultural Center, where we engaged Pueblo youth at five school sites in New Mexico in crafting poems and stories about their Pueblo experience.
  • And, of course, the hundreds of members who have been a part of this organization throughout the years speak to our experience and capacity for good work!

Ultimately, we are committed to our mission and vision.  We are committed to the voices and stories of Native and Indigenous people.  We are committed to developing the next generation of writers who will use their words to change the world and give back to their communities.  We are committed to ensuring that we, as Native people, are not relegated to the pages of a history we have not had a hand in writing.  We are committed to creating a vibrant and dynamic world where the stories and lives of Native and Indigenous people are honored and celebrated!

The Obstacles & The Risks

Our biggest challenge is capacity.  Always has been.  As such the greatest obstacles toward reaching our goals will be in getting supporters beyond this campaign; not just with donations but with time and energy.  To this end, our main efforts continue to be in developing our membership and those folks committed to this work to help us reach our goals.  We have had so many beautiful supporters, sponsors, and champions throughout the years, we are positive that we can press forward with all our ideas, projects, and programs once this campaign concludes.

You Can Be The Difference

We know not everyone will be able to contribute monetarily; we know that even spreading the word about this campaign can be just as valuable.  So if you are unable to contribute, please share this with your friends.  Let them know who important this work is and how much a small contribution can help with our efforts.  IndieGogo has a number of sharing tools and options at your disposal or you can just tell your friend, neighbor, colleague, or whoever to visit and contribute to this campaign.

With your help, we can ensure the voices and Native and Indigenous writers and storytellers - past, present, and future - are heard throughout the world!

know not everyone will be able to contribute monetarily; we know that even
spreading the word about this campaign can be just as valuable.  So if you are unable to contribute, please
share this with your friends.  Let them
know who important this work is and how much a small contribution can help with
our efforts.  IndieGogo has a number of
sharing tools and options at your disposal or you can just tell your friend,
neighbor, colleague, or whoever to visit and contribute to this campaign.
With
your help, we can ensure the voices and Native and Indigenous writers and
storytellers - past, present, and future - are heard throughout the world!

story:
Artists are the lifeblood of Brooklyn.  They are the fuel that keeps this diverse, exciting community going.  Over the years, musicians have sought out this creative haven, finding a network of likeminded artists and affordable spaces in which to perform and create.  In many neighborhoods in Brooklyn, these artists have laid down tracks, created innovative new sounds, pushed the boundaries of their talent and transformed empty warehouse spaces into packed musical venues.  Here, these renegade innovators have found the support and freedom to create transformative work and spark musical shockwaves that travel far.

 
Unfortunately, it’s gotten harder as of late.
 
As Brooklyn has started to evolve, many of these artists have been pushed out, their practice spaces and performance venues bought up by developers and corporate entities.
 
I am one of these artists.
 
As a Brooklyn-based musician for the last twelve years, I’ve had the gift of meeting some of the most extraordinary, talented artists around.  I’ve played some large venues and worked with Grammy-winning producers, but I’ve found my real community – those who are pushing the envelope and changing the face of music forever – in Bushwick.  When a number of us were recently forced out of our studio space by a developer, we decided it was time to stop complaining and make a difference.
 
That’s where Whoadie's comes in.
 
The word Whodie originated in post-Katrina New Orleans, the early variation Wardie used as a term of affection for your friends, homies and crew.  Eventually, this term evolved into Whoadie, and is used as a term of endearment for someone residing in the same neighborhood as you. In the same way this term exemplifies the fighting spirit of the displaced New Orleans musicians and communities fighting to keep hope and make music, we honor their strength by adopting the term.
 
In supporting the creation of Whoadie's, a DIY practice space and venue in Bushwick, you are supporting the very spirit of independent music.  You’ll be giving the gift of time, space and access to talented up-and-coming musicians who believe in creating great work and supporting their community of artists.  By supporting Whoadie's, you’ll be part of our community.
 
Let’s send shockwaves together.
 

It took a lot of searching, but we found the place:  a 3000 square feet warehouse in a safe location.  Right off the L train, this place offers a second floor, space enough to build six rehearsal rooms and a sublime performance venue.  There is even a balcony that will offer a perfect view of the stage.
 
Now we just need the stage.  And that’s where you come in.
 
Amongst the group of artists driven to make this happen, there are sound technicians, carpenters and lighting experts.  All share the same vision, and are willing to sweat, bust ass and put in the man hours needed to form this outlet for Bushwick’s musical community.  But to do that, they need the resources.


6 Rehearsal Rooms Build Out Cost- $11,500
building materials, dry wall, duct work, electrical, lighting, furniture, acoustic treatment.
 
Music Equipment Rehearsal Rooms- $12,500
(12) 50 watt guitar amps, (6) 100+ watt bass amps, (6) drum sets, (12) 400 watt powered speakers, (6) Mixers, (18) microphones, (18) mic stands,  (18) 20 ft. xlr cables. (24) 1/4 inch instrument cables, di boxes…
 
Venue Needs- $8,500
PA System w/ speakers and subs for the main room, 24 channel cable snake, 24 channel mixer, cables, DI boxes, microphones, stage, lights, sound treatment (bass traps, acoustic panels).
 
Common Space Needs- (lighting, chairs, tables, floor, misc. ) = $3,000
 
Additional Electrical Work- $5000
 
If we are lucky enough to make our goal, we will use all local resources for projects, hiring local artists to show their work, create installations and collaborate on performances.  They will be the ones who help design the interior and exteriors, aiding in further additions and adjustments to the structural base.  In this way, Whoadie’s will be a living, breathing piece of art; a collaborative community vision whose very foundations are literal artistic collaborations.


Your generous donations, even small ones, will have a huge impact.  They might just change the face of music forever.  You’ll be eternal VIPs in our hearts, and will be supporting artists who really care about the work.  As a donor, you will be a honorary member of our community.  If you are nearby, our doors will be open to you.  You’ll be a welcomed VIP guest to every show and exhibit.  And if you are so kind as to give the highest level donation, we will have a local artisans engrave your name on locally sourced mediums on the building ourselves. This way, no matter how far away you reside, you will always be a visible part of the Whoadie community and close to our hearts.

story:
Short Summary

Linzi Gold is a singer/songwriter and artist from Manchester. On 25th December 2014 she was 'discovered' by manager Alan Whitehead. Since then we have been trying to raise funds to help Linzi create an EP, a music video and have a professional photoshoot in order to present her to the labels.

The last campaign managed to raise £1581 of the needed £4000, since then we, her parents, have been helping out as much as we can.

Linzi is now at a stage where the EP has been finished, the photoshoot took place shortly afterwards and the Video is due to be filmed in July 2015.

Now she needs to continue work on her first album. Writing and recording more songs could be crucial to her potential to work in the industry as, with a full set of her own songs, she can then go out and perform them.

Linzi is on the cusp of a life changing experience. All she needs is a little help and support from anyone who wants to see a young person, with real talent, make something of themselves.

Here's two more of the songs, available to listen on YouTube:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vsAttRLk8TY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gsaplme-UP4


What We Need & What You Get

We already have 4 songs - we need to record another 6.

Each track costs £500 to do. Can you help us reach our goal of £3500?

Initally we will be offering the full album as a perk if you donate £15 - because of the cost of producing these, this will be a physical copy if you are in the UK, or email of the MP3 version of all the tracks if you are anywhere else in the world.

This money will go to creating the tracks, paying for the CDs to be burnt and for the album cover design as well as the creation of each track.

Costings: 6 x £500 for tracks (£3000)

CDs/CD Cases/Booklets/Postage/Cover Design/Signed photographs £500

Of course you can donate any amount at all to help Linzi. All donations will be gratefully received.

    The Impact

    With a full set of songs Linzi will be in a position to perform and start earning money to help towards her own career. This could be a life changing experience for her and you could be part of that.

    What you will receive is a beautiful album of thought-provoking, excitingly different music.

    Risks and Challenges
    Whatever you give will help towards the album. The only risk is that we may not reach our full goal - in which case we may not be able to make all of the 6 new songs. However, you will still receive your perk with as many songs as we can make on it.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can share this campaign with your friends. Get the word out and generate interest in Linzi and her music. This greatly improves her chances of being picked up by a label too - because views/hits mean popularity and the labels watch potential artists to see how the word is spreading about them.

    • Use the Indiegogo share tools and this also helps us see how the campaign is trending.

story:
Estaremos viajando este verano como representación de SEBIME y necesitamos tu apoyo! Por favor apoyanos para poder lograr nuestro sueño de adorar al Señor con todos nuestros talentos y darlo a conocer en todas partes.


We will be traveling this summer as representation of SEBIME and we need your help! Please help us fulfill our dream of worshiping the Lord with our talents and letting Him be known in all places!

Por favor apoyanos para poder lograr nuestro sueño de adorar al Señor  con todos nuestros talentos y darlo a conocer en todas partes.We will be traveling this summer as representation of SEBIME and we need your help! Please help us fulfill our dream of worshiping the Lord with our talents and letting Him be known in all places!
